/rsc/js/videojs/ -> video.js (source)

[Summary view] [Print] [Text view] 

   1  /**
   2   * @fileoverview Main function src.
   3   */
   4  
   5  // HTML5 Shiv. Must be in <head> to support older browsers.
   6  document.createElement('video');
   7  document.createElement('audio');
   8  document.createElement('track');
   9  
  10  /**
  11   * Doubles as the main function for users to create a player instance and also
  12   * the main library object.
  13   *
  14   * **ALIASES** videojs, _V_ (deprecated)
  15   *
  16   * The `vjs` function can be used to initialize or retrieve a player.
  17   *
  18   *     var myPlayer = vjs('my_video_id');
  19   *
  20   * @param  {String|Element} id      Video element or video element ID
  21   * @param  {Object=} options        Optional options object for config/settings
  22   * @param  {Function=} ready        Optional ready callback
  23   * @return {vjs.Player}             A player instance
  24   * @namespace
  25   */
  26  var vjs = function(id, options, ready){
  27    var tag; // Element of ID
  28  
  29    // Allow for element or ID to be passed in
  30    // String ID
  31    if (typeof id === 'string') {
  32  
  33      // Adjust for jQuery ID syntax
  34      if (id.indexOf('#') === 0) {
  35        id = id.slice(1);
  36      }
  37  
  38      // If a player instance has already been created for this ID return it.
  39      if (vjs.players[id]) {
  40  
  41        // If options or ready funtion are passed, warn
  42        if (options) {
  43          vjs.log.warn ('Player "' + id + '" is already initialised. Options will not be applied.');
  44        }
  45  
  46        if (ready) {
  47          vjs.players[id].ready(ready);
  48        }
  49  
  50        return vjs.players[id];
  51  
  52      // Otherwise get element for ID
  53      } else {
  54        tag = vjs.el(id);
  55      }
  56  
  57    // ID is a media element
  58    } else {
  59      tag = id;
  60    }
  61  
  62    // Check for a useable element
  63    if (!tag || !tag.nodeName) { // re: nodeName, could be a box div also
  64      throw new TypeError('The element or ID supplied is not valid. (videojs)'); // Returns
  65    }
  66  
  67    // Element may have a player attr referring to an already created player instance.
  68    // If not, set up a new player and return the instance.
  69    return tag['player'] || new vjs.Player(tag, options, ready);
  70  };
  71  
  72  // Extended name, also available externally, window.videojs
  73  var videojs = window['videojs'] = vjs;
  74  
  75  // CDN Version. Used to target right flash swf.
  76  vjs.CDN_VERSION = '4.12';
  77  vjs.ACCESS_PROTOCOL = ('https:' == document.location.protocol ? 'https://' : 'http://');
  78  
  79  /**
  80  * Full player version
  81  * @type {string}
  82  */
  83  vjs['VERSION'] = '4.12.0';
  84  
  85  /**
  86   * Global Player instance options, surfaced from vjs.Player.prototype.options_
  87   * vjs.options = vjs.Player.prototype.options_
  88   * All options should use string keys so they avoid
  89   * renaming by closure compiler
  90   * @type {Object}
  91   */
  92  vjs.options = {
  93    // Default order of fallback technology
  94    'techOrder': ['html5','flash'],
  95    // techOrder: ['flash','html5'],
  96  
  97    'html5': {},
  98    'flash': {},
  99  
 100    // Default of web browser is 300x150. Should rely on source width/height.
 101    'width': 300,
 102    'height': 150,
 103    // defaultVolume: 0.85,
 104    'defaultVolume': 0.00, // The freakin seaguls are driving me crazy!
 105  
 106    // default playback rates
 107    'playbackRates': [],
 108    // Add playback rate selection by adding rates
 109    // 'playbackRates': [0.5, 1, 1.5, 2],
 110  
 111    // default inactivity timeout
 112    'inactivityTimeout': 2000,
 113  
 114    // Included control sets
 115    'children': {
 116      'mediaLoader': {},
 117      'posterImage': {},
 118      'loadingSpinner': {},
 119      'textTrackDisplay': {},
 120      'bigPlayButton': {},
 121      'controlBar': {},
 122      'errorDisplay': {},
 123      'textTrackSettings': {}
 124    },
 125  
 126    'language': document.getElementsByTagName('html')[0].getAttribute('lang') || navigator.languages && navigator.languages[0] || navigator.userLanguage || navigator.language || 'en',
 127  
 128    // locales and their language translations
 129    'languages': {},
 130  
 131    // Default message to show when a video cannot be played.
 132    'notSupportedMessage': 'No compatible source was found for this video.'
 133  };
 134  
 135  // Set CDN Version of swf
 136  // The added (+) blocks the replace from changing this 4.12 string
 137  if (vjs.CDN_VERSION !== 'GENERATED'+'_CDN_VSN') {
 138    videojs.options['flash']['swf'] = vjs.ACCESS_PROTOCOL + 'vjs.zencdn.net/'+vjs.CDN_VERSION+'/video-js.swf';
 139  }
 140  
 141  /**
 142   * Utility function for adding languages to the default options. Useful for
 143   * amending multiple language support at runtime.
 144   *
 145   * Example: vjs.addLanguage('es', {'Hello':'Hola'});
 146   *
 147   * @param  {String} code The language code or dictionary property
 148   * @param  {Object} data The data values to be translated
 149   * @return {Object} The resulting global languages dictionary object
 150   */
 151  vjs.addLanguage = function(code, data){
 152    if(vjs.options['languages'][code] !== undefined) {
 153      vjs.options['languages'][code] = vjs.util.mergeOptions(vjs.options['languages'][code], data);
 154    } else {
 155      vjs.options['languages'][code] = data;
 156    }
 157    return vjs.options['languages'];
 158  };
 159  
 160  /**
 161   * Global player list
 162   * @type {Object}
 163   */
 164  vjs.players = {};
 165  
 166  /*!
 167   * Custom Universal Module Definition (UMD)
 168   *
 169   * Video.js will never be a non-browser lib so we can simplify UMD a bunch and
 170   * still support requirejs and browserify. This also needs to be closure
 171   * compiler compatible, so string keys are used.
 172   */
 173  if (typeof define === 'function' && define['amd']) {
 174    define('videojs', [], function(){ return videojs; });
 175  
 176  // checking that module is an object too because of umdjs/umd#35
 177  } else if (typeof exports === 'object' && typeof module === 'object') {
 178    module['exports'] = videojs;
 179  }
 180  /**
 181   * Core Object/Class for objects that use inheritance + constructors
 182   *
 183   * To create a class that can be subclassed itself, extend the CoreObject class.
 184   *
 185   *     var Animal = CoreObject.extend();
 186   *     var Horse = Animal.extend();
 187   *
 188   * The constructor can be defined through the init property of an object argument.
 189   *
 190   *     var Animal = CoreObject.extend({
 191   *       init: function(name, sound){
 192   *         this.name = name;
 193   *       }
 194   *     });
 195   *
 196   * Other methods and properties can be added the same way, or directly to the
 197   * prototype.
 198   *
 199   *    var Animal = CoreObject.extend({
 200   *       init: function(name){
 201   *         this.name = name;
 202   *       },
 203   *       getName: function(){
 204   *         return this.name;
 205   *       },
 206   *       sound: '...'
 207   *    });
 208   *
 209   *    Animal.prototype.makeSound = function(){
 210   *      alert(this.sound);
 211   *    };
 212   *
 213   * To create an instance of a class, use the create method.
 214   *
 215   *    var fluffy = Animal.create('Fluffy');
 216   *    fluffy.getName(); // -> Fluffy
 217   *
 218   * Methods and properties can be overridden in subclasses.
 219   *
 220   *     var Horse = Animal.extend({
 221   *       sound: 'Neighhhhh!'
 222   *     });
 223   *
 224   *     var horsey = Horse.create('Horsey');
 225   *     horsey.getName(); // -> Horsey
 226   *     horsey.makeSound(); // -> Alert: Neighhhhh!
 227   *
 228   * @class
 229   * @constructor
 230   */
 231  vjs.CoreObject = vjs['CoreObject'] = function(){};
 232  // Manually exporting vjs['CoreObject'] here for Closure Compiler
 233  // because of the use of the extend/create class methods
 234  // If we didn't do this, those functions would get flattened to something like
 235  // `a = ...` and `this.prototype` would refer to the global object instead of
 236  // CoreObject
 237  
 238  /**
 239   * Create a new object that inherits from this Object
 240   *
 241   *     var Animal = CoreObject.extend();
 242   *     var Horse = Animal.extend();
 243   *
 244   * @param {Object} props Functions and properties to be applied to the
 245   *                       new object's prototype
 246   * @return {vjs.CoreObject} An object that inherits from CoreObject
 247   * @this {*}
 248   */
 249  vjs.CoreObject.extend = function(props){
 250    var init, subObj;
 251  
 252    props = props || {};
 253    // Set up the constructor using the supplied init method
 254    // or using the init of the parent object
 255    // Make sure to check the unobfuscated version for external libs
 256    init = props['init'] || props.init || this.prototype['init'] || this.prototype.init || function(){};
 257    // In Resig's simple class inheritance (previously used) the constructor
 258    //  is a function that calls `this.init.apply(arguments)`
 259    // However that would prevent us from using `ParentObject.call(this);`
 260    //  in a Child constructor because the `this` in `this.init`
 261    //  would still refer to the Child and cause an infinite loop.
 262    // We would instead have to do
 263    //    `ParentObject.prototype.init.apply(this, arguments);`
 264    //  Bleh. We're not creating a _super() function, so it's good to keep
 265    //  the parent constructor reference simple.
 266    subObj = function(){
 267      init.apply(this, arguments);
 268    };
 269  
 270    // Inherit from this object's prototype
 271    subObj.prototype = vjs.obj.create(this.prototype);
 272    // Reset the constructor property for subObj otherwise
 273    // instances of subObj would have the constructor of the parent Object
 274    subObj.prototype.constructor = subObj;
 275  
 276    // Make the class extendable
 277    subObj.extend = vjs.CoreObject.extend;
 278    // Make a function for creating instances
 279    subObj.create = vjs.CoreObject.create;
 280  
 281    // Extend subObj's prototype with functions and other properties from props
 282    for (var name in props) {
 283      if (props.hasOwnProperty(name)) {
 284        subObj.prototype[name] = props[name];
 285      }
 286    }
 287  
 288    return subObj;
 289  };
 290  
 291  /**
 292   * Create a new instance of this Object class
 293   *
 294   *     var myAnimal = Animal.create();
 295   *
 296   * @return {vjs.CoreObject} An instance of a CoreObject subclass
 297   * @this {*}
 298   */
 299  vjs.CoreObject.create = function(){
 300    // Create a new object that inherits from this object's prototype
 301    var inst = vjs.obj.create(this.prototype);
 302  
 303    // Apply this constructor function to the new object
 304    this.apply(inst, arguments);
 305  
 306    // Return the new object
 307    return inst;
 308  };
 309  /**
 310   * @fileoverview Event System (John Resig - Secrets of a JS Ninja http://jsninja.com/)
 311   * (Original book version wasn't completely usable, so fixed some things and made Closure Compiler compatible)
 312   * This should work very similarly to jQuery's events, however it's based off the book version which isn't as
 313   * robust as jquery's, so there's probably some differences.
 314   */
 315  
 316  /**
 317   * Add an event listener to element
 318   * It stores the handler function in a separate cache object
 319   * and adds a generic handler to the element's event,
 320   * along with a unique id (guid) to the element.
 321   * @param  {Element|Object}   elem Element or object to bind listeners to
 322   * @param  {String|Array}   type Type of event to bind to.
 323   * @param  {Function} fn   Event listener.
 324   * @private
 325   */
 326  vjs.on = function(elem, type, fn){
 327    if (vjs.obj.isArray(type)) {
 328      return _handleMultipleEvents(vjs.on, elem, type, fn);
 329    }
 330  
 331    var data = vjs.getData(elem);
 332  
 333    // We need a place to store all our handler data
 334    if (!data.handlers) data.handlers = {};
 335  
 336    if (!data.handlers[type]) data.handlers[type] = [];
 337  
 338    if (!fn.guid) fn.guid = vjs.guid++;
 339  
 340    data.handlers[type].push(fn);
 341  
 342    if (!data.dispatcher) {
 343      data.disabled = false;
 344  
 345      data.dispatcher = function (event){
 346  
 347        if (data.disabled) return;
 348        event = vjs.fixEvent(event);
 349  
 350        var handlers = data.handlers[event.type];
 351  
 352        if (handlers) {
 353          // Copy handlers so if handlers are added/removed during the process it doesn't throw everything off.
 354          var handlersCopy = handlers.slice(0);
 355  
 356          for (var m = 0, n = handlersCopy.length; m < n; m++) {
 357            if (event.isImmediatePropagationStopped()) {
 358              break;
 359            } else {
 360              handlersCopy[m].call(elem, event);
 361            }
 362          }
 363        }
 364      };
 365    }
 366  
 367    if (data.handlers[type].length == 1) {
 368      if (elem.addEventListener) {
 369        elem.addEventListener(type, data.dispatcher, false);
 370      } else if (elem.attachEvent) {
 371        elem.attachEvent('on' + type, data.dispatcher);
 372      }
 373    }
 374  };
 375  
 376  /**
 377   * Removes event listeners from an element
 378   * @param  {Element|Object}   elem Object to remove listeners from
 379   * @param  {String|Array=}   type Type of listener to remove. Don't include to remove all events from element.
 380   * @param  {Function} fn   Specific listener to remove. Don't include to remove listeners for an event type.
 381   * @private
 382   */
 383  vjs.off = function(elem, type, fn) {
 384    // Don't want to add a cache object through getData if not needed
 385    if (!vjs.hasData(elem)) return;
 386  
 387    var data = vjs.getData(elem);
 388  
 389    // If no events exist, nothing to unbind
 390    if (!data.handlers) { return; }
 391  
 392    if (vjs.obj.isArray(type)) {
 393      return _handleMultipleEvents(vjs.off, elem, type, fn);
 394    }
 395  
 396    // Utility function
 397    var removeType = function(t){
 398       data.handlers[t] = [];
 399       vjs.cleanUpEvents(elem,t);
 400    };
 401  
 402    // Are we removing all bound events?
 403    if (!type) {
 404      for (var t in data.handlers) removeType(t);
 405      return;
 406    }
 407  
 408    var handlers = data.handlers[type];
 409  
 410    // If no handlers exist, nothing to unbind
 411    if (!handlers) return;
 412  
 413    // If no listener was provided, remove all listeners for type
 414    if (!fn) {
 415      removeType(type);
 416      return;
 417    }
 418  
 419    // We're only removing a single handler
 420    if (fn.guid) {
 421      for (var n = 0; n < handlers.length; n++) {
 422        if (handlers[n].guid === fn.guid) {
 423          handlers.splice(n--, 1);
 424        }
 425      }
 426    }
 427  
 428    vjs.cleanUpEvents(elem, type);
 429  };
 430  
 431  /**
 432   * Clean up the listener cache and dispatchers
 433   * @param  {Element|Object} elem Element to clean up
 434   * @param  {String} type Type of event to clean up
 435   * @private
 436   */
 437  vjs.cleanUpEvents = function(elem, type) {
 438    var data = vjs.getData(elem);
 439  
 440    // Remove the events of a particular type if there are none left
 441    if (data.handlers[type].length === 0) {
 442      delete data.handlers[type];
 443      // data.handlers[type] = null;
 444      // Setting to null was causing an error with data.handlers
 445  
 446      // Remove the meta-handler from the element
 447      if (elem.removeEventListener) {
 448        elem.removeEventListener(type, data.dispatcher, false);
 449      } else if (elem.detachEvent) {
 450        elem.detachEvent('on' + type, data.dispatcher);
 451      }
 452    }
 453  
 454    // Remove the events object if there are no types left
 455    if (vjs.isEmpty(data.handlers)) {
 456      delete data.handlers;
 457      delete data.dispatcher;
 458      delete data.disabled;
 459  
 460      // data.handlers = null;
 461      // data.dispatcher = null;
 462      // data.disabled = null;
 463    }
 464  
 465    // Finally remove the expando if there is no data left
 466    if (vjs.isEmpty(data)) {
 467      vjs.removeData(elem);
 468    }
 469  };
 470  
 471  /**
 472   * Fix a native event to have standard property values
 473   * @param  {Object} event Event object to fix
 474   * @return {Object}
 475   * @private
 476   */
 477  vjs.fixEvent = function(event) {
 478  
 479    function returnTrue() { return true; }
 480    function returnFalse() { return false; }
 481  
 482    // Test if fixing up is needed
 483    // Used to check if !event.stopPropagation instead of isPropagationStopped
 484    // But native events return true for stopPropagation, but don't have
 485    // other expected methods like isPropagationStopped. Seems to be a problem
 486    // with the Javascript Ninja code. So we're just overriding all events now.
 487    if (!event || !event.isPropagationStopped) {
 488      var old = event || window.event;
 489  
 490      event = {};
 491      // Clone the old object so that we can modify the values event = {};
 492      // IE8 Doesn't like when you mess with native event properties
 493      // Firefox returns false for event.hasOwnProperty('type') and other props
 494      //  which makes copying more difficult.
 495      // TODO: Probably best to create a whitelist of event props
 496      for (var key in old) {
 497        // Safari 6.0.3 warns you if you try to copy deprecated layerX/Y
 498        // Chrome warns you if you try to copy deprecated keyboardEvent.keyLocation
 499        if (key !== 'layerX' && key !== 'layerY' && key !== 'keyLocation') {
 500          // Chrome 32+ warns if you try to copy deprecated returnValue, but
 501          // we still want to if preventDefault isn't supported (IE8).
 502          if (!(key == 'returnValue' && old.preventDefault)) {
 503            event[key] = old[key];
 504          }
 505        }
 506      }
 507  
 508      // The event occurred on this element
 509      if (!event.target) {
 510        event.target = event.srcElement || document;
 511      }
 512  
 513      // Handle which other element the event is related to
 514      event.relatedTarget = event.fromElement === event.target ?
 515        event.toElement :
 516        event.fromElement;
 517  
 518      // Stop the default browser action
 519      event.preventDefault = function () {
 520        if (old.preventDefault) {
 521          old.preventDefault();
 522        }
 523        event.returnValue = false;
 524        event.isDefaultPrevented = returnTrue;
 525        event.defaultPrevented = true;
 526      };
 527  
 528      event.isDefaultPrevented = returnFalse;
 529      event.defaultPrevented = false;
 530  
 531      // Stop the event from bubbling
 532      event.stopPropagation = function () {
 533        if (old.stopPropagation) {
 534          old.stopPropagation();
 535        }
 536        event.cancelBubble = true;
 537        event.isPropagationStopped = returnTrue;
 538      };
 539  
 540      event.isPropagationStopped = returnFalse;
 541  
 542      // Stop the event from bubbling and executing other handlers
 543      event.stopImmediatePropagation = function () {
 544        if (old.stopImmediatePropagation) {
 545          old.stopImmediatePropagation();
 546        }
 547        event.isImmediatePropagationStopped = returnTrue;
 548        event.stopPropagation();
 549      };
 550  
 551      event.isImmediatePropagationStopped = returnFalse;
 552  
 553      // Handle mouse position
 554      if (event.clientX != null) {
 555        var doc = document.documentElement, body = document.body;
 556  
 557        event.pageX = event.clientX +
 558          (doc && doc.scrollLeft || body && body.scrollLeft || 0) -
 559          (doc && doc.clientLeft || body && body.clientLeft || 0);
 560        event.pageY = event.clientY +
 561          (doc && doc.scrollTop || body && body.scrollTop || 0) -
 562          (doc && doc.clientTop || body && body.clientTop || 0);
 563      }
 564  
 565      // Handle key presses
 566      event.which = event.charCode || event.keyCode;
 567  
 568      // Fix button for mouse clicks:
 569      // 0 == left; 1 == middle; 2 == right
 570      if (event.button != null) {
 571        event.button = (event.button & 1 ? 0 :
 572          (event.button & 4 ? 1 :
 573            (event.button & 2 ? 2 : 0)));
 574      }
 575    }
 576  
 577    // Returns fixed-up instance
 578    return event;
 579  };
 580  
 581  /**
 582   * Trigger an event for an element
 583   * @param  {Element|Object}      elem  Element to trigger an event on
 584   * @param  {Event|Object|String} event A string (the type) or an event object with a type attribute
 585   * @private
 586   */
 587  vjs.trigger = function(elem, event) {
 588    // Fetches element data and a reference to the parent (for bubbling).
 589    // Don't want to add a data object to cache for every parent,
 590    // so checking hasData first.
 591    var elemData = (vjs.hasData(elem)) ? vjs.getData(elem) : {};
 592    var parent = elem.parentNode || elem.ownerDocument;
 593        // type = event.type || event,
 594        // handler;
 595  
 596    // If an event name was passed as a string, creates an event out of it
 597    if (typeof event === 'string') {
 598      event = { type:event, target:elem };
 599    }
 600    // Normalizes the event properties.
 601    event = vjs.fixEvent(event);
 602  
 603    // If the passed element has a dispatcher, executes the established handlers.
 604    if (elemData.dispatcher) {
 605      elemData.dispatcher.call(elem, event);
 606    }
 607  
 608    // Unless explicitly stopped or the event does not bubble (e.g. media events)
 609      // recursively calls this function to bubble the event up the DOM.
 610      if (parent && !event.isPropagationStopped() && event.bubbles !== false) {
 611      vjs.trigger(parent, event);
 612  
 613    // If at the top of the DOM, triggers the default action unless disabled.
 614    } else if (!parent && !event.defaultPrevented) {
 615      var targetData = vjs.getData(event.target);
 616  
 617      // Checks if the target has a default action for this event.
 618      if (event.target[event.type]) {
 619        // Temporarily disables event dispatching on the target as we have already executed the handler.
 620        targetData.disabled = true;
 621        // Executes the default action.
 622        if (typeof event.target[event.type] === 'function') {
 623          event.target[event.type]();
 624        }
 625        // Re-enables event dispatching.
 626        targetData.disabled = false;
 627      }
 628    }
 629  
 630    // Inform the triggerer if the default was prevented by returning false
 631    return !event.defaultPrevented;
 632    /* Original version of js ninja events wasn't complete.
 633     * We've since updated to the latest version, but keeping this around
 634     * for now just in case.
 635     */
 636    // // Added in addition to book. Book code was broke.
 637    // event = typeof event === 'object' ?
 638    //   event[vjs.expando] ?
 639    //     event :
 640    //     new vjs.Event(type, event) :
 641    //   new vjs.Event(type);
 642  
 643    // event.type = type;
 644    // if (handler) {
 645    //   handler.call(elem, event);
 646    // }
 647  
 648    // // Clean up the event in case it is being reused
 649    // event.result = undefined;
 650    // event.target = elem;
 651  };
 652  
 653  /**
 654   * Trigger a listener only once for an event
 655   * @param  {Element|Object}   elem Element or object to
 656   * @param  {String|Array}   type
 657   * @param  {Function} fn
 658   * @private
 659   */
 660  vjs.one = function(elem, type, fn) {
 661    if (vjs.obj.isArray(type)) {
 662      return _handleMultipleEvents(vjs.one, elem, type, fn);
 663    }
 664    var func = function(){
 665      vjs.off(elem, type, func);
 666      fn.apply(this, arguments);
 667    };
 668    // copy the guid to the new function so it can removed using the original function's ID
 669    func.guid = fn.guid = fn.guid || vjs.guid++;
 670    vjs.on(elem, type, func);
 671  };
 672  
 673  /**
 674   * Loops through an array of event types and calls the requested method for each type.
 675   * @param  {Function} fn   The event method we want to use.
 676   * @param  {Element|Object} elem Element or object to bind listeners to
 677   * @param  {String}   type Type of event to bind to.
 678   * @param  {Function} callback   Event listener.
 679   * @private
 680   */
 681  function _handleMultipleEvents(fn, elem, type, callback) {
 682    vjs.arr.forEach(type, function(type) {
 683      fn(elem, type, callback); //Call the event method for each one of the types
 684    });
 685  }
 686  var hasOwnProp = Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty;
 687  
 688  /**
 689   * Creates an element and applies properties.
 690   * @param  {String=} tagName    Name of tag to be created.
 691   * @param  {Object=} properties Element properties to be applied.
 692   * @return {Element}
 693   * @private
 694   */
 695  vjs.createEl = function(tagName, properties){
 696    var el;
 697  
 698    tagName = tagName || 'div';
 699    properties = properties || {};
 700  
 701    el = document.createElement(tagName);
 702  
 703    vjs.obj.each(properties, function(propName, val){
 704      // Not remembering why we were checking for dash
 705      // but using setAttribute means you have to use getAttribute
 706  
 707      // The check for dash checks for the aria-* attributes, like aria-label, aria-valuemin.
 708      // The additional check for "role" is because the default method for adding attributes does not
 709      // add the attribute "role". My guess is because it's not a valid attribute in some namespaces, although
 710      // browsers handle the attribute just fine. The W3C allows for aria-* attributes to be used in pre-HTML5 docs.
 711      // http://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-primer/#ariahtml. Using setAttribute gets around this problem.
 712      if (propName.indexOf('aria-') !== -1 || propName == 'role') {
 713       el.setAttribute(propName, val);
 714      } else {
 715       el[propName] = val;
 716      }
 717    });
 718  
 719    return el;
 720  };
 721  
 722  /**
 723   * Uppercase the first letter of a string
 724   * @param  {String} string String to be uppercased
 725   * @return {String}
 726   * @private
 727   */
 728  vjs.capitalize = function(string){
 729    return string.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + string.slice(1);
 730  };
 731  
 732  /**
 733   * Object functions container
 734   * @type {Object}
 735   * @private
 736   */
 737  vjs.obj = {};
 738  
 739  /**
 740   * Object.create shim for prototypal inheritance
 741   *
 742   * https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/create
 743   *
 744   * @function
 745   * @param  {Object}   obj Object to use as prototype
 746   * @private
 747   */
 748  vjs.obj.create = Object.create || function(obj){
 749    //Create a new function called 'F' which is just an empty object.
 750    function F() {}
 751  
 752    //the prototype of the 'F' function should point to the
 753    //parameter of the anonymous function.
 754    F.prototype = obj;
 755  
 756    //create a new constructor function based off of the 'F' function.
 757    return new F();
 758  };
 759  
 760  /**
 761   * Loop through each property in an object and call a function
 762   * whose arguments are (key,value)
 763   * @param  {Object}   obj Object of properties
 764   * @param  {Function} fn  Function to be called on each property.
 765   * @this {*}
 766   * @private
 767   */
 768  vjs.obj.each = function(obj, fn, context){
 769    for (var key in obj) {
 770      if (hasOwnProp.call(obj, key)) {
 771        fn.call(context || this, key, obj[key]);
 772      }
 773    }
 774  };
 775  
 776  /**
 777   * Merge two objects together and return the original.
 778   * @param  {Object} obj1
 779   * @param  {Object} obj2
 780   * @return {Object}
 781   * @private
 782   */
 783  vjs.obj.merge = function(obj1, obj2){
 784    if (!obj2) { return obj1; }
 785    for (var key in obj2){
 786      if (hasOwnProp.call(obj2, key)) {
 787        obj1[key] = obj2[key];
 788      }
 789    }
 790    return obj1;
 791  };
 792  
 793  /**
 794   * Merge two objects, and merge any properties that are objects
 795   * instead of just overwriting one. Uses to merge options hashes
 796   * where deeper default settings are important.
 797   * @param  {Object} obj1 Object to override
 798   * @param  {Object} obj2 Overriding object
 799   * @return {Object}      New object. Obj1 and Obj2 will be untouched.
 800   * @private
 801   */
 802  vjs.obj.deepMerge = function(obj1, obj2){
 803    var key, val1, val2;
 804  
 805    // make a copy of obj1 so we're not overwriting original values.
 806    // like prototype.options_ and all sub options objects
 807    obj1 = vjs.obj.copy(obj1);
 808  
 809    for (key in obj2){
 810      if (hasOwnProp.call(obj2, key)) {
 811        val1 = obj1[key];
 812        val2 = obj2[key];
 813  
 814        // Check if both properties are pure objects and do a deep merge if so
 815        if (vjs.obj.isPlain(val1) && vjs.obj.isPlain(val2)) {
 816          obj1[key] = vjs.obj.deepMerge(val1, val2);
 817        } else {
 818          obj1[key] = obj2[key];
 819        }
 820      }
 821    }
 822    return obj1;
 823  };
 824  
 825  /**
 826   * Make a copy of the supplied object
 827   * @param  {Object} obj Object to copy
 828   * @return {Object}     Copy of object
 829   * @private
 830   */
 831  vjs.obj.copy = function(obj){
 832    return vjs.obj.merge({}, obj);
 833  };
 834  
 835  /**
 836   * Check if an object is plain, and not a dom node or any object sub-instance
 837   * @param  {Object} obj Object to check
 838   * @return {Boolean}     True if plain, false otherwise
 839   * @private
 840   */
 841  vjs.obj.isPlain = function(obj){
 842    return !!obj
 843      && typeof obj === 'object'
 844      && obj.toString() === '[object Object]'
 845      && obj.constructor === Object;
 846  };
 847  
 848  /**
 849   * Check if an object is Array
 850  *  Since instanceof Array will not work on arrays created in another frame we need to use Array.isArray, but since IE8 does not support Array.isArray we need this shim
 851   * @param  {Object} obj Object to check
 852   * @return {Boolean}     True if plain, false otherwise
 853   * @private
 854   */
 855  vjs.obj.isArray = Array.isArray || function(arr) {
 856    return Object.prototype.toString.call(arr) === '[object Array]';
 857  };
 858  
 859  /**
 860   * Check to see whether the input is NaN or not.
 861   * NaN is the only JavaScript construct that isn't equal to itself
 862   * @param {Number} num Number to check
 863   * @return {Boolean} True if NaN, false otherwise
 864   * @private
 865   */
 866  vjs.isNaN = function(num) {
 867    return num !== num;
 868  };
 869  
 870  /**
 871   * Bind (a.k.a proxy or Context). A simple method for changing the context of a function
 872     It also stores a unique id on the function so it can be easily removed from events
 873   * @param  {*}   context The object to bind as scope
 874   * @param  {Function} fn      The function to be bound to a scope
 875   * @param  {Number=}   uid     An optional unique ID for the function to be set
 876   * @return {Function}
 877   * @private
 878   */
 879  vjs.bind = function(context, fn, uid) {
 880    // Make sure the function has a unique ID
 881    if (!fn.guid) { fn.guid = vjs.guid++; }
 882  
 883    // Create the new function that changes the context
 884    var ret = function() {
 885      return fn.apply(context, arguments);
 886    };
 887  
 888    // Allow for the ability to individualize this function
 889    // Needed in the case where multiple objects might share the same prototype
 890    // IF both items add an event listener with the same function, then you try to remove just one
 891    // it will remove both because they both have the same guid.
 892    // when using this, you need to use the bind method when you remove the listener as well.
 893    // currently used in text tracks
 894    ret.guid = (uid) ? uid + '_' + fn.guid : fn.guid;
 895  
 896    return ret;
 897  };
 898  
 899  /**
 900   * Element Data Store. Allows for binding data to an element without putting it directly on the element.
 901   * Ex. Event listeners are stored here.
 902   * (also from jsninja.com, slightly modified and updated for closure compiler)
 903   * @type {Object}
 904   * @private
 905   */
 906  vjs.cache = {};
 907  
 908  /**
 909   * Unique ID for an element or function
 910   * @type {Number}
 911   * @private
 912   */
 913  vjs.guid = 1;
 914  
 915  /**
 916   * Unique attribute name to store an element's guid in
 917   * @type {String}
 918   * @constant
 919   * @private
 920   */
 921  vjs.expando = 'vdata' + (new Date()).getTime();
 922  
 923  /**
 924   * Returns the cache object where data for an element is stored
 925   * @param  {Element} el Element to store data for.
 926   * @return {Object}
 927   * @private
 928   */
 929  vjs.getData = function(el){
 930    var id = el[vjs.expando];
 931    if (!id) {
 932      id = el[vjs.expando] = vjs.guid++;
 933    }
 934    if (!vjs.cache[id]) {
 935      vjs.cache[id] = {};
 936    }
 937    return vjs.cache[id];
 938  };
 939  
 940  /**
 941   * Returns the cache object where data for an element is stored
 942   * @param  {Element} el Element to store data for.
 943   * @return {Object}
 944   * @private
 945   */
 946  vjs.hasData = function(el){
 947    var id = el[vjs.expando];
 948    return !(!id || vjs.isEmpty(vjs.cache[id]));
 949  };
 950  
 951  /**
 952   * Delete data for the element from the cache and the guid attr from getElementById
 953   * @param  {Element} el Remove data for an element
 954   * @private
 955   */
 956  vjs.removeData = function(el){
 957    var id = el[vjs.expando];
 958    if (!id) { return; }
 959    // Remove all stored data
 960    // Changed to = null
 961    // http://coding.smashingmagazine.com/2012/11/05/writing-fast-memory-efficient-javascript/
 962    // vjs.cache[id] = null;
 963    delete vjs.cache[id];
 964  
 965    // Remove the expando property from the DOM node
 966    try {
 967      delete el[vjs.expando];
 968    } catch(e) {
 969      if (el.removeAttribute) {
 970        el.removeAttribute(vjs.expando);
 971      } else {
 972        // IE doesn't appear to support removeAttribute on the document element
 973        el[vjs.expando] = null;
 974      }
 975    }
 976  };
 977  
 978  /**
 979   * Check if an object is empty
 980   * @param  {Object}  obj The object to check for emptiness
 981   * @return {Boolean}
 982   * @private
 983   */
 984  vjs.isEmpty = function(obj) {
 985    for (var prop in obj) {
 986      // Inlude null properties as empty.
 987      if (obj[prop] !== null) {
 988        return false;
 989      }
 990    }
 991    return true;
 992  };
 993  
 994  /**
 995   * Check if an element has a CSS class
 996   * @param {Element} element Element to check
 997   * @param {String} classToCheck Classname to check
 998   * @private
 999   */
1000  vjs.hasClass = function(element, classToCheck){
1001    return ((' ' + element.className + ' ').indexOf(' ' + classToCheck + ' ') !== -1);
1002  };
1003  
1004  
1005  /**
1006   * Add a CSS class name to an element
1007   * @param {Element} element    Element to add class name to
1008   * @param {String} classToAdd Classname to add
1009   * @private
1010   */
1011  vjs.addClass = function(element, classToAdd){
1012    if (!vjs.hasClass(element, classToAdd)) {
1013      element.className = element.className === '' ? classToAdd : element.className + ' ' + classToAdd;
1014    }
1015  };
1016  
1017  /**
1018   * Remove a CSS class name from an element
1019   * @param {Element} element    Element to remove from class name
1020   * @param {String} classToAdd Classname to remove
1021   * @private
1022   */
1023  vjs.removeClass = function(element, classToRemove){
1024    var classNames, i;
1025  
1026    if (!vjs.hasClass(element, classToRemove)) {return;}
1027  
1028    classNames = element.className.split(' ');
1029  
1030    // no arr.indexOf in ie8, and we don't want to add a big shim
1031    for (i = classNames.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
1032      if (classNames[i] === classToRemove) {
1033        classNames.splice(i,1);
1034      }
1035    }
1036  
1037    element.className = classNames.join(' ');
1038  };
1039  
1040  /**
1041   * Element for testing browser HTML5 video capabilities
1042   * @type {Element}
1043   * @constant
1044   * @private
1045   */
1046  vjs.TEST_VID = vjs.createEl('video');
1047  (function() {
1048    var track = document.createElement('track');
1049    track.kind = 'captions';
1050    track.srclang = 'en';
1051    track.label = 'English';
1052    vjs.TEST_VID.appendChild(track);
1053  })();
1054  
1055  /**
1056   * Useragent for browser testing.
1057   * @type {String}
1058   * @constant
1059   * @private
1060   */
1061  vjs.USER_AGENT = navigator.userAgent;
1062  
1063  /**
1064   * Device is an iPhone
1065   * @type {Boolean}
1066   * @constant
1067   * @private
1068   */
1069  vjs.IS_IPHONE = (/iPhone/i).test(vjs.USER_AGENT);
1070  vjs.IS_IPAD = (/iPad/i).test(vjs.USER_AGENT);
1071  vjs.IS_IPOD = (/iPod/i).test(vjs.USER_AGENT);
1072  vjs.IS_IOS = vjs.IS_IPHONE || vjs.IS_IPAD || vjs.IS_IPOD;
1073  
1074  vjs.IOS_VERSION = (function(){
1075    var match = vjs.USER_AGENT.match(/OS (\d+)_/i);
1076    if (match && match[1]) { return match[1]; }
1077  })();
1078  
1079  vjs.IS_ANDROID = (/Android/i).test(vjs.USER_AGENT);
1080  vjs.ANDROID_VERSION = (function() {
1081    // This matches Android Major.Minor.Patch versions
1082    // ANDROID_VERSION is Major.Minor as a Number, if Minor isn't available, then only Major is returned
1083    var match = vjs.USER_AGENT.match(/Android (\d+)(?:\.(\d+))?(?:\.(\d+))*/i),
1084      major,
1085      minor;
1086  
1087    if (!match) {
1088      return null;
1089    }
1090  
1091    major = match[1] && parseFloat(match[1]);
1092    minor = match[2] && parseFloat(match[2]);
1093  
1094    if (major && minor) {
1095      return parseFloat(match[1] + '.' + match[2]);
1096    } else if (major) {
1097      return major;
1098    } else {
1099      return null;
1100    }
1101  })();
1102  // Old Android is defined as Version older than 2.3, and requiring a webkit version of the android browser
1103  vjs.IS_OLD_ANDROID = vjs.IS_ANDROID && (/webkit/i).test(vjs.USER_AGENT) && vjs.ANDROID_VERSION < 2.3;
1104  
1105  vjs.IS_FIREFOX = (/Firefox/i).test(vjs.USER_AGENT);
1106  vjs.IS_CHROME = (/Chrome/i).test(vjs.USER_AGENT);
1107  vjs.IS_IE8 = (/MSIE\s8\.0/).test(vjs.USER_AGENT);
1108  
1109  vjs.TOUCH_ENABLED = !!(('ontouchstart' in window) || window.DocumentTouch && document instanceof window.DocumentTouch);
1110  vjs.BACKGROUND_SIZE_SUPPORTED = 'backgroundSize' in vjs.TEST_VID.style;
1111  
1112  /**
1113   * Apply attributes to an HTML element.
1114   * @param  {Element} el         Target element.
1115   * @param  {Object=} attributes Element attributes to be applied.
1116   * @private
1117   */
1118  vjs.setElementAttributes = function(el, attributes){
1119    vjs.obj.each(attributes, function(attrName, attrValue) {
1120      if (attrValue === null || typeof attrValue === 'undefined' || attrValue === false) {
1121        el.removeAttribute(attrName);
1122      } else {
1123        el.setAttribute(attrName, (attrValue === true ? '' : attrValue));
1124      }
1125    });
1126  };
1127  
1128  /**
1129   * Get an element's attribute values, as defined on the HTML tag
1130   * Attributes are not the same as properties. They're defined on the tag
1131   * or with setAttribute (which shouldn't be used with HTML)
1132   * This will return true or false for boolean attributes.
1133   * @param  {Element} tag Element from which to get tag attributes
1134   * @return {Object}
1135   * @private
1136   */
1137  vjs.getElementAttributes = function(tag){
1138    var obj, knownBooleans, attrs, attrName, attrVal;
1139  
1140    obj = {};
1141  
1142    // known boolean attributes
1143    // we can check for matching boolean properties, but older browsers
1144    // won't know about HTML5 boolean attributes that we still read from
1145    knownBooleans = ','+'autoplay,controls,loop,muted,default'+',';
1146  
1147    if (tag && tag.attributes && tag.attributes.length > 0) {
1148      attrs = tag.attributes;
1149  
1150      for (var i = attrs.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
1151        attrName = attrs[i].name;
1152        attrVal = attrs[i].value;
1153  
1154        // check for known booleans
1155        // the matching element property will return a value for typeof
1156        if (typeof tag[attrName] === 'boolean' || knownBooleans.indexOf(','+attrName+',') !== -1) {
1157          // the value of an included boolean attribute is typically an empty
1158          // string ('') which would equal false if we just check for a false value.
1159          // we also don't want support bad code like autoplay='false'
1160          attrVal = (attrVal !== null) ? true : false;
1161        }
1162  
1163        obj[attrName] = attrVal;
1164      }
1165    }
1166  
1167    return obj;
1168  };
1169  
1170  /**
1171   * Get the computed style value for an element
1172   * From http://robertnyman.com/2006/04/24/get-the-rendered-style-of-an-element/
1173   * @param  {Element} el        Element to get style value for
1174   * @param  {String} strCssRule Style name
1175   * @return {String}            Style value
1176   * @private
1177   */
1178  vjs.getComputedDimension = function(el, strCssRule){
1179    var strValue = '';
1180    if(document.defaultView && document.defaultView.getComputedStyle){
1181      strValue = document.defaultView.getComputedStyle(el, '').getPropertyValue(strCssRule);
1182  
1183    } else if(el.currentStyle){
1184      // IE8 Width/Height support
1185      strValue = el['client'+strCssRule.substr(0,1).toUpperCase() + strCssRule.substr(1)] + 'px';
1186    }
1187    return strValue;
1188  };
1189  
1190  /**
1191   * Insert an element as the first child node of another
1192   * @param  {Element} child   Element to insert
1193   * @param  {[type]} parent Element to insert child into
1194   * @private
1195   */
1196  vjs.insertFirst = function(child, parent){
1197    if (parent.firstChild) {
1198      parent.insertBefore(child, parent.firstChild);
1199    } else {
1200      parent.appendChild(child);
1201    }
1202  };
1203  
1204  /**
1205   * Object to hold browser support information
1206   * @type {Object}
1207   * @private
1208   */
1209  vjs.browser = {};
1210  
1211  /**
1212   * Shorthand for document.getElementById()
1213   * Also allows for CSS (jQuery) ID syntax. But nothing other than IDs.
1214   * @param  {String} id  Element ID
1215   * @return {Element}    Element with supplied ID
1216   * @private
1217   */
1218  vjs.el = function(id){
1219    if (id.indexOf('#') === 0) {
1220      id = id.slice(1);
1221    }
1222  
1223    return document.getElementById(id);
1224  };
1225  
1226  /**
1227   * Format seconds as a time string, H:MM:SS or M:SS
1228   * Supplying a guide (in seconds) will force a number of leading zeros
1229   * to cover the length of the guide
1230   * @param  {Number} seconds Number of seconds to be turned into a string
1231   * @param  {Number} guide   Number (in seconds) to model the string after
1232   * @return {String}         Time formatted as H:MM:SS or M:SS
1233   * @private
1234   */
1235  vjs.formatTime = function(seconds, guide) {
1236    // Default to using seconds as guide
1237    guide = guide || seconds;
1238    var s = Math.floor(seconds % 60),
1239        m = Math.floor(seconds / 60 % 60),
1240        h = Math.floor(seconds / 3600),
1241        gm = Math.floor(guide / 60 % 60),
1242        gh = Math.floor(guide / 3600);
1243  
1244    // handle invalid times
1245    if (isNaN(seconds) || seconds === Infinity) {
1246      // '-' is false for all relational operators (e.g. <, >=) so this setting
1247      // will add the minimum number of fields specified by the guide
1248      h = m = s = '-';
1249    }
1250  
1251    // Check if we need to show hours
1252    h = (h > 0 || gh > 0) ? h + ':' : '';
1253  
1254    // If hours are showing, we may need to add a leading zero.
1255    // Always show at least one digit of minutes.
1256    m = (((h || gm >= 10) && m < 10) ? '0' + m : m) + ':';
1257  
1258    // Check if leading zero is need for seconds
1259    s = (s < 10) ? '0' + s : s;
1260  
1261    return h + m + s;
1262  };
1263  
1264  // Attempt to block the ability to select text while dragging controls
1265  vjs.blockTextSelection = function(){
1266    document.body.focus();
1267    document.onselectstart = function () { return false; };
1268  };
1269  // Turn off text selection blocking
1270  vjs.unblockTextSelection = function(){ document.onselectstart = function () { return true; }; };
1271  
1272  /**
1273   * Trim whitespace from the ends of a string.
1274   * @param  {String} string String to trim
1275   * @return {String}        Trimmed string
1276   * @private
1277   */
1278  vjs.trim = function(str){
1279    return (str+'').replace(/^\s+|\s+$/g, '');
1280  };
1281  
1282  /**
1283   * Should round off a number to a decimal place
1284   * @param  {Number} num Number to round
1285   * @param  {Number} dec Number of decimal places to round to
1286   * @return {Number}     Rounded number
1287   * @private
1288   */
1289  vjs.round = function(num, dec) {
1290    if (!dec) { dec = 0; }
1291    return Math.round(num*Math.pow(10,dec))/Math.pow(10,dec);
1292  };
1293  
1294  /**
1295   * Should create a fake TimeRange object
1296   * Mimics an HTML5 time range instance, which has functions that
1297   * return the start and end times for a range
1298   * TimeRanges are returned by the buffered() method
1299   * @param  {Number} start Start time in seconds
1300   * @param  {Number} end   End time in seconds
1301   * @return {Object}       Fake TimeRange object
1302   * @private
1303   */
1304  vjs.createTimeRange = function(start, end){
1305    return {
1306      length: 1,
1307      start: function() { return start; },
1308      end: function() { return end; }
1309    };
1310  };
1311  
1312  /**
1313   * Add to local storage (may removable)
1314   * @private
1315   */
1316  vjs.setLocalStorage = function(key, value){
1317    try {
1318      // IE was throwing errors referencing the var anywhere without this
1319      var localStorage = window.localStorage || false;
1320      if (!localStorage) { return; }
1321      localStorage[key] = value;
1322    } catch(e) {
1323      if (e.code == 22 || e.code == 1014) { // Webkit == 22 / Firefox == 1014
1324        vjs.log('LocalStorage Full (VideoJS)', e);
1325      } else {
1326        if (e.code == 18) {
1327          vjs.log('LocalStorage not allowed (VideoJS)', e);
1328        } else {
1329          vjs.log('LocalStorage Error (VideoJS)', e);
1330        }
1331      }
1332    }
1333  };
1334  
1335  /**
1336   * Get absolute version of relative URL. Used to tell flash correct URL.
1337   * http://stackoverflow.com/questions/470832/getting-an-absolute-url-from-a-relative-one-ie6-issue
1338   * @param  {String} url URL to make absolute
1339   * @return {String}     Absolute URL
1340   * @private
1341   */
1342  vjs.getAbsoluteURL = function(url){
1343  
1344    // Check if absolute URL
1345    if (!url.match(/^https?:\/\//)) {
1346      // Convert to absolute URL. Flash hosted off-site needs an absolute URL.
1347      url = vjs.createEl('div', {
1348        innerHTML: '<a href="'+url+'">x</a>'
1349      }).firstChild.href;
1350    }
1351  
1352    return url;
1353  };
1354  
1355  
1356  /**
1357   * Resolve and parse the elements of a URL
1358   * @param  {String} url The url to parse
1359   * @return {Object}     An object of url details
1360   */
1361  vjs.parseUrl = function(url) {
1362    var div, a, addToBody, props, details;
1363  
1364    props = ['protocol', 'hostname', 'port', 'pathname', 'search', 'hash', 'host'];
1365  
1366    // add the url to an anchor and let the browser parse the URL
1367    a = vjs.createEl('a', { href: url });
1368  
1369    // IE8 (and 9?) Fix
1370    // ie8 doesn't parse the URL correctly until the anchor is actually
1371    // added to the body, and an innerHTML is needed to trigger the parsing
1372    addToBody = (a.host === '' && a.protocol !== 'file:');
1373    if (addToBody) {
1374      div = vjs.createEl('div');
1375      div.innerHTML = '<a href="'+url+'"></a>';
1376      a = div.firstChild;
1377      // prevent the div from affecting layout
1378      div.setAttribute('style', 'display:none; position:absolute;');
1379      document.body.appendChild(div);
1380    }
1381  
1382    // Copy the specific URL properties to a new object
1383    // This is also needed for IE8 because the anchor loses its
1384    // properties when it's removed from the dom
1385    details = {};
1386    for (var i = 0; i < props.length; i++) {
1387      details[props[i]] = a[props[i]];
1388    }
1389  
1390    // IE9 adds the port to the host property unlike everyone else. If
1391    // a port identifier is added for standard ports, strip it.
1392    if (details.protocol === 'http:') {
1393      details.host = details.host.replace(/:80$/, '');
1394    }
1395    if (details.protocol === 'https:') {
1396      details.host = details.host.replace(/:443$/, '');
1397    }
1398  
1399    if (addToBody) {
1400      document.body.removeChild(div);
1401    }
1402  
1403    return details;
1404  };
1405  
1406  /**
1407   * Log messages to the console and history based on the type of message
1408   *
1409   * @param  {String} type The type of message, or `null` for `log`
1410   * @param  {[type]} args The args to be passed to the log
1411   * @private
1412   */
1413  function _logType(type, args){
1414    var argsArray, noop, console;
1415  
1416    // convert args to an array to get array functions
1417    argsArray = Array.prototype.slice.call(args);
1418    // if there's no console then don't try to output messages
1419    // they will still be stored in vjs.log.history
1420    // Was setting these once outside of this function, but containing them
1421    // in the function makes it easier to test cases where console doesn't exist
1422    noop = function(){};
1423    console = window['console'] || {
1424      'log': noop,
1425      'warn': noop,
1426      'error': noop
1427    };
1428  
1429    if (type) {
1430      // add the type to the front of the message
1431      argsArray.unshift(type.toUpperCase()+':');
1432    } else {
1433      // default to log with no prefix
1434      type = 'log';
1435    }
1436  
1437    // add to history
1438    vjs.log.history.push(argsArray);
1439  
1440    // add console prefix after adding to history
1441    argsArray.unshift('VIDEOJS:');
1442  
1443    // call appropriate log function
1444    if (console[type].apply) {
1445      console[type].apply(console, argsArray);
1446    } else {
1447      // ie8 doesn't allow error.apply, but it will just join() the array anyway
1448      console[type](argsArray.join(' '));
1449    }
1450  }
1451  
1452  /**
1453   * Log plain debug messages
1454   */
1455  vjs.log = function(){
1456    _logType(null, arguments);
1457  };
1458  
1459  /**
1460   * Keep a history of log messages
1461   * @type {Array}
1462   */
1463  vjs.log.history = [];
1464  
1465  /**
1466   * Log error messages
1467   */
1468  vjs.log.error = function(){
1469    _logType('error', arguments);
1470  };
1471  
1472  /**
1473   * Log warning messages
1474   */
1475  vjs.log.warn = function(){
1476    _logType('warn', arguments);
1477  };
1478  
1479  // Offset Left
1480  // getBoundingClientRect technique from John Resig http://ejohn.org/blog/getboundingclientrect-is-awesome/
1481  vjs.findPosition = function(el) {
1482    var box, docEl, body, clientLeft, scrollLeft, left, clientTop, scrollTop, top;
1483  
1484    if (el.getBoundingClientRect && el.parentNode) {
1485      box = el.getBoundingClientRect();
1486    }
1487  
1488    if (!box) {
1489      return {
1490        left: 0,
1491        top: 0
1492      };
1493    }
1494  
1495    docEl = document.documentElement;
1496    body = document.body;
1497  
1498    clientLeft = docEl.clientLeft || body.clientLeft || 0;
1499    scrollLeft = window.pageXOffset || body.scrollLeft;
1500    left = box.left + scrollLeft - clientLeft;
1501  
1502    clientTop = docEl.clientTop || body.clientTop || 0;
1503    scrollTop = window.pageYOffset || body.scrollTop;
1504    top = box.top + scrollTop - clientTop;
1505  
1506    // Android sometimes returns slightly off decimal values, so need to round
1507    return {
1508      left: vjs.round(left),
1509      top: vjs.round(top)
1510    };
1511  };
1512  
1513  /**
1514   * Array functions container
1515   * @type {Object}
1516   * @private
1517   */
1518  vjs.arr = {};
1519  
1520  /*
1521   * Loops through an array and runs a function for each item inside it.
1522   * @param  {Array}    array       The array
1523   * @param  {Function} callback    The function to be run for each item
1524   * @param  {*}        thisArg     The `this` binding of callback
1525   * @returns {Array}               The array
1526   * @private
1527   */
1528  vjs.arr.forEach = function(array, callback, thisArg) {
1529    if (vjs.obj.isArray(array) && callback instanceof Function) {
1530      for (var i = 0, len = array.length; i < len; ++i) {
1531        callback.call(thisArg || vjs, array[i], i, array);
1532      }
1533    }
1534  
1535    return array;
1536  };
1537  /**
1538   * Simple http request for retrieving external files (e.g. text tracks)
1539   *
1540   * ##### Example
1541   *
1542   *     // using url string
1543   *     videojs.xhr('http://example.com/myfile.vtt', function(error, response, responseBody){});
1544   *
1545   *     // or options block
1546   *     videojs.xhr({
1547   *       uri: 'http://example.com/myfile.vtt',
1548   *       method: 'GET',
1549   *       responseType: 'text'
1550   *     }, function(error, response, responseBody){
1551   *       if (error) {
1552   *         // log the error
1553   *       } else {
1554   *         // successful, do something with the response
1555   *       }
1556   *     });
1557   *
1558   *
1559   * API is modeled after the Raynos/xhr, which we hope to use after
1560   * getting browserify implemented.
1561   * https://github.com/Raynos/xhr/blob/master/index.js
1562   *
1563   * @param  {Object|String}  options   Options block or URL string
1564   * @param  {Function}       callback  The callback function
1565   * @returns {Object}                  The request
1566   */
1567  vjs.xhr = function(options, callback){
1568    var XHR, request, urlInfo, winLoc, fileUrl, crossOrigin, abortTimeout, successHandler, errorHandler;
1569  
1570    // If options is a string it's the url
1571    if (typeof options === 'string') {
1572      options = {
1573        uri: options
1574      };
1575    }
1576  
1577    // Merge with default options
1578    videojs.util.mergeOptions({
1579      method: 'GET',
1580      timeout: 45 * 1000
1581    }, options);
1582  
1583    callback = callback || function(){};
1584  
1585    successHandler = function(){
1586      window.clearTimeout(abortTimeout);
1587      callback(null, request, request.response || request.responseText);
1588    };
1589  
1590    errorHandler = function(err){
1591      window.clearTimeout(abortTimeout);
1592  
1593      if (!err || typeof err === 'string') {
1594        err = new Error(err);
1595      }
1596  
1597      callback(err, request);
1598    };
1599  
1600    XHR = window.XMLHttpRequest;
1601  
1602    if (typeof XHR === 'undefined') {
1603      // Shim XMLHttpRequest for older IEs
1604      XHR = function () {
1605        try { return new window.ActiveXObject('Msxml2.XMLHTTP.6.0'); } catch (e) {}
1606        try { return new window.ActiveXObject('Msxml2.XMLHTTP.3.0'); } catch (f) {}
1607        try { return new window.ActiveXObject('Msxml2.XMLHTTP'); } catch (g) {}
1608        throw new Error('This browser does not support XMLHttpRequest.');
1609      };
1610    }
1611  
1612    request = new XHR();
1613    // Store a reference to the url on the request instance
1614    request.uri = options.uri;
1615  
1616    urlInfo = vjs.parseUrl(options.uri);
1617    winLoc = window.location;
1618    // Check if url is for another domain/origin
1619    // IE8 doesn't know location.origin, so we won't rely on it here
1620    crossOrigin = (urlInfo.protocol + urlInfo.host) !== (winLoc.protocol + winLoc.host);
1621  
1622    // XDomainRequest -- Use for IE if XMLHTTPRequest2 isn't available
1623    // 'withCredentials' is only available in XMLHTTPRequest2
1624    // Also XDomainRequest has a lot of gotchas, so only use if cross domain
1625    if (crossOrigin && window.XDomainRequest && !('withCredentials' in request)) {
1626      request = new window.XDomainRequest();
1627      request.onload = successHandler;
1628      request.onerror = errorHandler;
1629      // These blank handlers need to be set to fix ie9
1630      // http://cypressnorth.com/programming/internet-explorer-aborting-ajax-requests-fixed/
1631      request.onprogress = function(){};
1632      request.ontimeout = function(){};
1633  
1634    // XMLHTTPRequest
1635    } else {
1636      fileUrl = (urlInfo.protocol == 'file:' || winLoc.protocol == 'file:');
1637  
1638      request.onreadystatechange = function() {
1639        if (request.readyState === 4) {
1640          if (request.timedout) {
1641            return errorHandler('timeout');
1642          }
1643  
1644          if (request.status === 200 || fileUrl && request.status === 0) {
1645            successHandler();
1646          } else {
1647            errorHandler();
1648          }
1649        }
1650      };
1651  
1652      if (options.timeout) {
1653        abortTimeout = window.setTimeout(function() {
1654          if (request.readyState !== 4) {
1655            request.timedout = true;
1656            request.abort();
1657          }
1658        }, options.timeout);
1659      }
1660    }
1661  
1662    // open the connection
1663    try {
1664      // Third arg is async, or ignored by XDomainRequest
1665      request.open(options.method || 'GET', options.uri, true);
1666    } catch(err) {
1667      return errorHandler(err);
1668    }
1669  
1670    // withCredentials only supported by XMLHttpRequest2
1671    if(options.withCredentials) {
1672      request.withCredentials = true;
1673    }
1674  
1675    if (options.responseType) {
1676      request.responseType = options.responseType;
1677    }
1678  
1679    // send the request
1680    try {
1681      request.send();
1682    } catch(err) {
1683      return errorHandler(err);
1684    }
1685  
1686    return request;
1687  };
1688  /**
1689   * Utility functions namespace
1690   * @namespace
1691   * @type {Object}
1692   */
1693  vjs.util = {};
1694  
1695  /**
1696   * Merge two options objects, recursively merging any plain object properties as
1697   * well.  Previously `deepMerge`
1698   *
1699   * @param  {Object} obj1 Object to override values in
1700   * @param  {Object} obj2 Overriding object
1701   * @return {Object}      New object -- obj1 and obj2 will be untouched
1702   */
1703  vjs.util.mergeOptions = function(obj1, obj2){
1704    var key, val1, val2;
1705  
1706    // make a copy of obj1 so we're not overwriting original values.
1707    // like prototype.options_ and all sub options objects
1708    obj1 = vjs.obj.copy(obj1);
1709  
1710    for (key in obj2){
1711      if (obj2.hasOwnProperty(key)) {
1712        val1 = obj1[key];
1713        val2 = obj2[key];
1714  
1715        // Check if both properties are pure objects and do a deep merge if so
1716        if (vjs.obj.isPlain(val1) && vjs.obj.isPlain(val2)) {
1717          obj1[key] = vjs.util.mergeOptions(val1, val2);
1718        } else {
1719          obj1[key] = obj2[key];
1720        }
1721      }
1722    }
1723    return obj1;
1724  };vjs.EventEmitter = function() {
1725  };
1726  
1727  vjs.EventEmitter.prototype.allowedEvents_ = {
1728  };
1729  
1730  vjs.EventEmitter.prototype.on = function(type, fn) {
1731    // Remove the addEventListener alias before calling vjs.on
1732    // so we don't get into an infinite type loop
1733    var ael = this.addEventListener;
1734    this.addEventListener = Function.prototype;
1735    vjs.on(this, type, fn);
1736    this.addEventListener = ael;
1737  };
1738  vjs.EventEmitter.prototype.addEventListener = vjs.EventEmitter.prototype.on;
1739  
1740  vjs.EventEmitter.prototype.off = function(type, fn) {
1741    vjs.off(this, type, fn);
1742  };
1743  vjs.EventEmitter.prototype.removeEventListener = vjs.EventEmitter.prototype.off;
1744  
1745  vjs.EventEmitter.prototype.one = function(type, fn) {
1746    vjs.one(this, type, fn);
1747  };
1748  
1749  vjs.EventEmitter.prototype.trigger = function(event) {
1750    var type = event.type || event;
1751  
1752    if (typeof event === 'string') {
1753      event = {
1754        type: type
1755      };
1756    }
1757    event = vjs.fixEvent(event);
1758  
1759    if (this.allowedEvents_[type] && this['on' + type]) {
1760      this['on' + type](event);
1761    }
1762  
1763    vjs.trigger(this, event);
1764  };
1765  // The standard DOM EventTarget.dispatchEvent() is aliased to trigger()
1766  vjs.EventEmitter.prototype.dispatchEvent = vjs.EventEmitter.prototype.trigger;
1767  /**
1768   * @fileoverview Player Component - Base class for all UI objects
1769   *
1770   */
1771  
1772  /**
1773   * Base UI Component class
1774   *
1775   * Components are embeddable UI objects that are represented by both a
1776   * javascript object and an element in the DOM. They can be children of other
1777   * components, and can have many children themselves.
1778   *
1779   *     // adding a button to the player
1780   *     var button = player.addChild('button');
1781   *     button.el(); // -> button element
1782   *
1783   *     <div class="video-js">
1784   *       <div class="vjs-button">Button</div>
1785   *     </div>
1786   *
1787   * Components are also event emitters.
1788   *
1789   *     button.on('click', function(){
1790   *       console.log('Button Clicked!');
1791   *     });
1792   *
1793   *     button.trigger('customevent');
1794   *
1795   * @param {Object} player  Main Player
1796   * @param {Object=} options
1797   * @class
1798   * @constructor
1799   * @extends vjs.CoreObject
1800   */
1801  vjs.Component = vjs.CoreObject.extend({
1802    /**
1803     * the constructor function for the class
1804     *
1805     * @constructor
1806     */
1807    init: function(player, options, ready){
1808      this.player_ = player;
1809  
1810      // Make a copy of prototype.options_ to protect against overriding global defaults
1811      this.options_ = vjs.obj.copy(this.options_);
1812  
1813      // Updated options with supplied options
1814      options = this.options(options);
1815  
1816      // Get ID from options or options element if one is supplied
1817      this.id_ = options['id'] || (options['el'] && options['el']['id']);
1818  
1819      // If there was no ID from the options, generate one
1820      if (!this.id_) {
1821        // Don't require the player ID function in the case of mock players
1822        this.id_ = ((player.id && player.id()) || 'no_player') + '_component_' + vjs.guid++;
1823      }
1824  
1825      this.name_ = options['name'] || null;
1826  
1827      // Create element if one wasn't provided in options
1828      this.el_ = options['el'] || this.createEl();
1829  
1830      this.children_ = [];
1831      this.childIndex_ = {};
1832      this.childNameIndex_ = {};
1833  
1834      // Add any child components in options
1835      this.initChildren();
1836  
1837      this.ready(ready);
1838      // Don't want to trigger ready here or it will before init is actually
1839      // finished for all children that run this constructor
1840  
1841      if (options.reportTouchActivity !== false) {
1842        this.enableTouchActivity();
1843      }
1844    }
1845  });
1846  
1847  /**
1848   * Dispose of the component and all child components
1849   */
1850  vjs.Component.prototype.dispose = function(){
1851    this.trigger({ type: 'dispose', 'bubbles': false });
1852  
1853    // Dispose all children.
1854    if (this.children_) {
1855      for (var i = this.children_.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
1856        if (this.children_[i].dispose) {
1857          this.children_[i].dispose();
1858        }
1859      }
1860    }
1861  
1862    // Delete child references
1863    this.children_ = null;
1864    this.childIndex_ = null;
1865    this.childNameIndex_ = null;
1866  
1867    // Remove all event listeners.
1868    this.off();
1869  
1870    // Remove element from DOM
1871    if (this.el_.parentNode) {
1872      this.el_.parentNode.removeChild(this.el_);
1873    }
1874  
1875    vjs.removeData(this.el_);
1876    this.el_ = null;
1877  };
1878  
1879  /**
1880   * Reference to main player instance
1881   *
1882   * @type {vjs.Player}
1883   * @private
1884   */
1885  vjs.Component.prototype.player_ = true;
1886  
1887  /**
1888   * Return the component's player
1889   *
1890   * @return {vjs.Player}
1891   */
1892  vjs.Component.prototype.player = function(){
1893    return this.player_;
1894  };
1895  
1896  /**
1897   * The component's options object
1898   *
1899   * @type {Object}
1900   * @private
1901   */
1902  vjs.Component.prototype.options_;
1903  
1904  /**
1905   * Deep merge of options objects
1906   *
1907   * Whenever a property is an object on both options objects
1908   * the two properties will be merged using vjs.obj.deepMerge.
1909   *
1910   * This is used for merging options for child components. We
1911   * want it to be easy to override individual options on a child
1912   * component without having to rewrite all the other default options.
1913   *
1914   *     Parent.prototype.options_ = {
1915   *       children: {
1916   *         'childOne': { 'foo': 'bar', 'asdf': 'fdsa' },
1917   *         'childTwo': {},
1918   *         'childThree': {}
1919   *       }
1920   *     }
1921   *     newOptions = {
1922   *       children: {
1923   *         'childOne': { 'foo': 'baz', 'abc': '123' }
1924   *         'childTwo': null,
1925   *         'childFour': {}
1926   *       }
1927   *     }
1928   *
1929   *     this.options(newOptions);
1930   *
1931   * RESULT
1932   *
1933   *     {
1934   *       children: {
1935   *         'childOne': { 'foo': 'baz', 'asdf': 'fdsa', 'abc': '123' },
1936   *         'childTwo': null, // Disabled. Won't be initialized.
1937   *         'childThree': {},
1938   *         'childFour': {}
1939   *       }
1940   *     }
1941   *
1942   * @param  {Object} obj Object of new option values
1943   * @return {Object}     A NEW object of this.options_ and obj merged
1944   */
1945  vjs.Component.prototype.options = function(obj){
1946    if (obj === undefined) return this.options_;
1947  
1948    return this.options_ = vjs.util.mergeOptions(this.options_, obj);
1949  };
1950  
1951  /**
1952   * The DOM element for the component
1953   *
1954   * @type {Element}
1955   * @private
1956   */
1957  vjs.Component.prototype.el_;
1958  
1959  /**
1960   * Create the component's DOM element
1961   *
1962   * @param  {String=} tagName  Element's node type. e.g. 'div'
1963   * @param  {Object=} attributes An object of element attributes that should be set on the element
1964   * @return {Element}
1965   */
1966  vjs.Component.prototype.createEl = function(tagName, attributes){
1967    return vjs.createEl(tagName, attributes);
1968  };
1969  
1970  vjs.Component.prototype.localize = function(string){
1971    var lang = this.player_.language(),
1972        languages = this.player_.languages();
1973    if (languages && languages[lang] && languages[lang][string]) {
1974      return languages[lang][string];
1975    }
1976    return string;
1977  };
1978  
1979  /**
1980   * Get the component's DOM element
1981   *
1982   *     var domEl = myComponent.el();
1983   *
1984   * @return {Element}
1985   */
1986  vjs.Component.prototype.el = function(){
1987    return this.el_;
1988  };
1989  
1990  /**
1991   * An optional element where, if defined, children will be inserted instead of
1992   * directly in `el_`
1993   *
1994   * @type {Element}
1995   * @private
1996   */
1997  vjs.Component.prototype.contentEl_;
1998  
1999  /**
2000   * Return the component's DOM element for embedding content.
2001   * Will either be el_ or a new element defined in createEl.
2002   *
2003   * @return {Element}
2004   */
2005  vjs.Component.prototype.contentEl = function(){
2006    return this.contentEl_ || this.el_;
2007  };
2008  
2009  /**
2010   * The ID for the component
2011   *
2012   * @type {String}
2013   * @private
2014   */
2015  vjs.Component.prototype.id_;
2016  
2017  /**
2018   * Get the component's ID
2019   *
2020   *     var id = myComponent.id();
2021   *
2022   * @return {String}
2023   */
2024  vjs.Component.prototype.id = function(){
2025    return this.id_;
2026  };
2027  
2028  /**
2029   * The name for the component. Often used to reference the component.
2030   *
2031   * @type {String}
2032   * @private
2033   */
2034  vjs.Component.prototype.name_;
2035  
2036  /**
2037   * Get the component's name. The name is often used to reference the component.
2038   *
2039   *     var name = myComponent.name();
2040   *
2041   * @return {String}
2042   */
2043  vjs.Component.prototype.name = function(){
2044    return this.name_;
2045  };
2046  
2047  /**
2048   * Array of child components
2049   *
2050   * @type {Array}
2051   * @private
2052   */
2053  vjs.Component.prototype.children_;
2054  
2055  /**
2056   * Get an array of all child components
2057   *
2058   *     var kids = myComponent.children();
2059   *
2060   * @return {Array} The children
2061   */
2062  vjs.Component.prototype.children = function(){
2063    return this.children_;
2064  };
2065  
2066  /**
2067   * Object of child components by ID
2068   *
2069   * @type {Object}
2070   * @private
2071   */
2072  vjs.Component.prototype.childIndex_;
2073  
2074  /**
2075   * Returns a child component with the provided ID
2076   *
2077   * @return {vjs.Component}
2078   */
2079  vjs.Component.prototype.getChildById = function(id){
2080    return this.childIndex_[id];
2081  };
2082  
2083  /**
2084   * Object of child components by name
2085   *
2086   * @type {Object}
2087   * @private
2088   */
2089  vjs.Component.prototype.childNameIndex_;
2090  
2091  /**
2092   * Returns a child component with the provided name
2093   *
2094   * @return {vjs.Component}
2095   */
2096  vjs.Component.prototype.getChild = function(name){
2097    return this.childNameIndex_[name];
2098  };
2099  
2100  /**
2101   * Adds a child component inside this component
2102   *
2103   *     myComponent.el();
2104   *     // -> <div class='my-component'></div>
2105   *     myComonent.children();
2106   *     // [empty array]
2107   *
2108   *     var myButton = myComponent.addChild('MyButton');
2109   *     // -> <div class='my-component'><div class="my-button">myButton<div></div>
2110   *     // -> myButton === myComonent.children()[0];
2111   *
2112   * Pass in options for child constructors and options for children of the child
2113   *
2114   *     var myButton = myComponent.addChild('MyButton', {
2115   *       text: 'Press Me',
2116   *       children: {
2117   *         buttonChildExample: {
2118   *           buttonChildOption: true
2119   *         }
2120   *       }
2121   *     });
2122   *
2123   * @param {String|vjs.Component} child The class name or instance of a child to add
2124   * @param {Object=} options Options, including options to be passed to children of the child.
2125   * @return {vjs.Component} The child component (created by this process if a string was used)
2126   * @suppress {accessControls|checkRegExp|checkTypes|checkVars|const|constantProperty|deprecated|duplicate|es5Strict|fileoverviewTags|globalThis|invalidCasts|missingProperties|nonStandardJsDocs|strictModuleDepCheck|undefinedNames|undefinedVars|unknownDefines|uselessCode|visibility}
2127   */
2128  vjs.Component.prototype.addChild = function(child, options){
2129    var component, componentClass, componentName;
2130  
2131    // If child is a string, create new component with options
2132    if (typeof child === 'string') {
2133      componentName = child;
2134  
2135      // Make sure options is at least an empty object to protect against errors
2136      options = options || {};
2137  
2138      // If no componentClass in options, assume componentClass is the name lowercased
2139      // (e.g. playButton)
2140      componentClass = options['componentClass'] || vjs.capitalize(componentName);
2141  
2142      // Set name through options
2143      options['name'] = componentName;
2144  
2145      // Create a new object & element for this controls set
2146      // If there's no .player_, this is a player
2147      // Closure Compiler throws an 'incomplete alias' warning if we use the vjs variable directly.
2148      // Every class should be exported, so this should never be a problem here.
2149      component = new window['videojs'][componentClass](this.player_ || this, options);
2150  
2151    // child is a component instance
2152    } else {
2153      component = child;
2154    }
2155  
2156    this.children_.push(component);
2157  
2158    if (typeof component.id === 'function') {
2159      this.childIndex_[component.id()] = component;
2160    }
2161  
2162    // If a name wasn't used to create the component, check if we can use the
2163    // name function of the component
2164    componentName = componentName || (component.name && component.name());
2165  
2166    if (componentName) {
2167      this.childNameIndex_[componentName] = component;
2168    }
2169  
2170    // Add the UI object's element to the container div (box)
2171    // Having an element is not required
2172    if (typeof component['el'] === 'function' && component['el']()) {
2173      this.contentEl().appendChild(component['el']());
2174    }
2175  
2176    // Return so it can stored on parent object if desired.
2177    return component;
2178  };
2179  
2180  /**
2181   * Remove a child component from this component's list of children, and the
2182   * child component's element from this component's element
2183   *
2184   * @param  {vjs.Component} component Component to remove
2185   */
2186  vjs.Component.prototype.removeChild = function(component){
2187    if (typeof component === 'string') {
2188      component = this.getChild(component);
2189    }
2190  
2191    if (!component || !this.children_) return;
2192  
2193    var childFound = false;
2194    for (var i = this.children_.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
2195      if (this.children_[i] === component) {
2196        childFound = true;
2197        this.children_.splice(i,1);
2198        break;
2199      }
2200    }
2201  
2202    if (!childFound) return;
2203  
2204    this.childIndex_[component.id()] = null;
2205    this.childNameIndex_[component.name()] = null;
2206  
2207    var compEl = component.el();
2208    if (compEl && compEl.parentNode === this.contentEl()) {
2209      this.contentEl().removeChild(component.el());
2210    }
2211  };
2212  
2213  /**
2214   * Add and initialize default child components from options
2215   *
2216   *     // when an instance of MyComponent is created, all children in options
2217   *     // will be added to the instance by their name strings and options
2218   *     MyComponent.prototype.options_.children = {
2219   *       myChildComponent: {
2220   *         myChildOption: true
2221   *       }
2222   *     }
2223   *
2224   *     // Or when creating the component
2225   *     var myComp = new MyComponent(player, {
2226   *       children: {
2227   *         myChildComponent: {
2228   *           myChildOption: true
2229   *         }
2230   *       }
2231   *     });
2232   *
2233   * The children option can also be an Array of child names or
2234   * child options objects (that also include a 'name' key).
2235   *
2236   *     var myComp = new MyComponent(player, {
2237   *       children: [
2238   *         'button',
2239   *         {
2240   *           name: 'button',
2241   *           someOtherOption: true
2242   *         }
2243   *       ]
2244   *     });
2245   *
2246   */
2247  vjs.Component.prototype.initChildren = function(){
2248    var parent, parentOptions, children, child, name, opts, handleAdd;
2249  
2250    parent = this;
2251    parentOptions = parent.options();
2252    children = parentOptions['children'];
2253  
2254    if (children) {
2255      handleAdd = function(name, opts){
2256        // Allow options for children to be set at the parent options
2257        // e.g. videojs(id, { controlBar: false });
2258        // instead of videojs(id, { children: { controlBar: false });
2259        if (parentOptions[name] !== undefined) {
2260          opts = parentOptions[name];
2261        }
2262  
2263        // Allow for disabling default components
2264        // e.g. vjs.options['children']['posterImage'] = false
2265        if (opts === false) return;
2266  
2267        // Create and add the child component.
2268        // Add a direct reference to the child by name on the parent instance.
2269        // If two of the same component are used, different names should be supplied
2270        // for each
2271        parent[name] = parent.addChild(name, opts);
2272      };
2273  
2274      // Allow for an array of children details to passed in the options
2275      if (vjs.obj.isArray(children)) {
2276        for (var i = 0; i < children.length; i++) {
2277          child = children[i];
2278  
2279          if (typeof child == 'string') {
2280            // ['myComponent']
2281            name = child;
2282            opts = {};
2283          } else {
2284            // [{ name: 'myComponent', otherOption: true }]
2285            name = child.name;
2286            opts = child;
2287          }
2288  
2289          handleAdd(name, opts);
2290        }
2291      } else {
2292        vjs.obj.each(children, handleAdd);
2293      }
2294    }
2295  };
2296  
2297  /**
2298   * Allows sub components to stack CSS class names
2299   *
2300   * @return {String} The constructed class name
2301   */
2302  vjs.Component.prototype.buildCSSClass = function(){
2303      // Child classes can include a function that does:
2304      // return 'CLASS NAME' + this._super();
2305      return '';
2306  };
2307  
2308  /* Events
2309  ============================================================================= */
2310  
2311  /**
2312   * Add an event listener to this component's element
2313   *
2314   *     var myFunc = function(){
2315   *       var myComponent = this;
2316   *       // Do something when the event is fired
2317   *     };
2318   *
