2319   *     myComponent.on('eventType', myFunc);
2320   *
2321   * The context of myFunc will be myComponent unless previously bound.
2322   *
2323   * Alternatively, you can add a listener to another element or component.
2324   *
2325   *     myComponent.on(otherElement, 'eventName', myFunc);
2326   *     myComponent.on(otherComponent, 'eventName', myFunc);
2327   *
2328   * The benefit of using this over `vjs.on(otherElement, 'eventName', myFunc)`
2329   * and `otherComponent.on('eventName', myFunc)` is that this way the listeners
2330   * will be automatically cleaned up when either component is disposed.
2331   * It will also bind myComponent as the context of myFunc.
2332   *
2333   * **NOTE**: When using this on elements in the page other than window
2334   * and document (both permanent), if you remove the element from the DOM
2335   * you need to call `vjs.trigger(el, 'dispose')` on it to clean up
2336   * references to it and allow the browser to garbage collect it.
2337   *
2338   * @param  {String|vjs.Component} first   The event type or other component
2339   * @param  {Function|String}      second  The event handler or event type
2340   * @param  {Function}             third   The event handler
2341   * @return {vjs.Component}        self
2342   */
2343  vjs.Component.prototype.on = function(first, second, third){
2344    var target, type, fn, removeOnDispose, cleanRemover, thisComponent;
2345  
2346    if (typeof first === 'string' || vjs.obj.isArray(first)) {
2347      vjs.on(this.el_, first, vjs.bind(this, second));
2348  
2349    // Targeting another component or element
2350    } else {
2351      target = first;
2352      type = second;
2353      fn = vjs.bind(this, third);
2354      thisComponent = this;
2355  
2356      // When this component is disposed, remove the listener from the other component
2357      removeOnDispose = function(){
2358        thisComponent.off(target, type, fn);
2359      };
2360      // Use the same function ID so we can remove it later it using the ID
2361      // of the original listener
2362      removeOnDispose.guid = fn.guid;
2363      this.on('dispose', removeOnDispose);
2364  
2365      // If the other component is disposed first we need to clean the reference
2366      // to the other component in this component's removeOnDispose listener
2367      // Otherwise we create a memory leak.
2368      cleanRemover = function(){
2369        thisComponent.off('dispose', removeOnDispose);
2370      };
2371      // Add the same function ID so we can easily remove it later
2372      cleanRemover.guid = fn.guid;
2373  
2374      // Check if this is a DOM node
2375      if (first.nodeName) {
2376        // Add the listener to the other element
2377        vjs.on(target, type, fn);
2378        vjs.on(target, 'dispose', cleanRemover);
2379  
2380      // Should be a component
2381      // Not using `instanceof vjs.Component` because it makes mock players difficult
2382      } else if (typeof first.on === 'function') {
2383        // Add the listener to the other component
2384        target.on(type, fn);
2385        target.on('dispose', cleanRemover);
2386      }
2387    }
2388  
2389    return this;
2390  };
2391  
2392  /**
2393   * Remove an event listener from this component's element
2394   *
2395   *     myComponent.off('eventType', myFunc);
2396   *
2397   * If myFunc is excluded, ALL listeners for the event type will be removed.
2398   * If eventType is excluded, ALL listeners will be removed from the component.
2399   *
2400   * Alternatively you can use `off` to remove listeners that were added to other
2401   * elements or components using `myComponent.on(otherComponent...`.
2402   * In this case both the event type and listener function are REQUIRED.
2403   *
2404   *     myComponent.off(otherElement, 'eventType', myFunc);
2405   *     myComponent.off(otherComponent, 'eventType', myFunc);
2406   *
2407   * @param  {String=|vjs.Component}  first  The event type or other component
2408   * @param  {Function=|String}       second The listener function or event type
2409   * @param  {Function=}              third  The listener for other component
2410   * @return {vjs.Component}
2411   */
2412  vjs.Component.prototype.off = function(first, second, third){
2413    var target, otherComponent, type, fn, otherEl;
2414  
2415    if (!first || typeof first === 'string' || vjs.obj.isArray(first)) {
2416      vjs.off(this.el_, first, second);
2417    } else {
2418      target = first;
2419      type = second;
2420      // Ensure there's at least a guid, even if the function hasn't been used
2421      fn = vjs.bind(this, third);
2422  
2423      // Remove the dispose listener on this component,
2424      // which was given the same guid as the event listener
2425      this.off('dispose', fn);
2426  
2427      if (first.nodeName) {
2428        // Remove the listener
2429        vjs.off(target, type, fn);
2430        // Remove the listener for cleaning the dispose listener
2431        vjs.off(target, 'dispose', fn);
2432      } else {
2433        target.off(type, fn);
2434        target.off('dispose', fn);
2435      }
2436    }
2437  
2438    return this;
2439  };
2440  
2441  /**
2442   * Add an event listener to be triggered only once and then removed
2443   *
2444   *     myComponent.one('eventName', myFunc);
2445   *
2446   * Alternatively you can add a listener to another element or component
2447   * that will be triggered only once.
2448   *
2449   *     myComponent.one(otherElement, 'eventName', myFunc);
2450   *     myComponent.one(otherComponent, 'eventName', myFunc);
2451   *
2452   * @param  {String|vjs.Component}  first   The event type or other component
2453   * @param  {Function|String}       second  The listener function or event type
2454   * @param  {Function=}             third   The listener function for other component
2455   * @return {vjs.Component}
2456   */
2457  vjs.Component.prototype.one = function(first, second, third) {
2458    var target, type, fn, thisComponent, newFunc;
2459  
2460    if (typeof first === 'string' || vjs.obj.isArray(first)) {
2461      vjs.one(this.el_, first, vjs.bind(this, second));
2462    } else {
2463      target = first;
2464      type = second;
2465      fn = vjs.bind(this, third);
2466      thisComponent = this;
2467  
2468      newFunc = function(){
2469        thisComponent.off(target, type, newFunc);
2470        fn.apply(this, arguments);
2471      };
2472      // Keep the same function ID so we can remove it later
2473      newFunc.guid = fn.guid;
2474  
2475      this.on(target, type, newFunc);
2476    }
2477  
2478    return this;
2479  };
2480  
2481  /**
2482   * Trigger an event on an element
2483   *
2484   *     myComponent.trigger('eventName');
2485   *     myComponent.trigger({'type':'eventName'});
2486   *
2487   * @param  {Event|Object|String} event  A string (the type) or an event object with a type attribute
2488   * @return {vjs.Component}       self
2489   */
2490  vjs.Component.prototype.trigger = function(event){
2491    vjs.trigger(this.el_, event);
2492    return this;
2493  };
2494  
2495  /* Ready
2496  ================================================================================ */
2497  /**
2498   * Is the component loaded
2499   * This can mean different things depending on the component.
2500   *
2501   * @private
2502   * @type {Boolean}
2503   */
2504  vjs.Component.prototype.isReady_;
2505  
2506  /**
2507   * Trigger ready as soon as initialization is finished
2508   *
2509   * Allows for delaying ready. Override on a sub class prototype.
2510   * If you set this.isReadyOnInitFinish_ it will affect all components.
2511   * Specially used when waiting for the Flash player to asynchronously load.
2512   *
2513   * @type {Boolean}
2514   * @private
2515   */
2516  vjs.Component.prototype.isReadyOnInitFinish_ = true;
2517  
2518  /**
2519   * List of ready listeners
2520   *
2521   * @type {Array}
2522   * @private
2523   */
2524  vjs.Component.prototype.readyQueue_;
2525  
2526  /**
2527   * Bind a listener to the component's ready state
2528   *
2529   * Different from event listeners in that if the ready event has already happened
2530   * it will trigger the function immediately.
2531   *
2532   * @param  {Function} fn Ready listener
2533   * @return {vjs.Component}
2534   */
2535  vjs.Component.prototype.ready = function(fn){
2536    if (fn) {
2537      if (this.isReady_) {
2538        fn.call(this);
2539      } else {
2540        if (this.readyQueue_ === undefined) {
2541          this.readyQueue_ = [];
2542        }
2543        this.readyQueue_.push(fn);
2544      }
2545    }
2546    return this;
2547  };
2548  
2549  /**
2550   * Trigger the ready listeners
2551   *
2552   * @return {vjs.Component}
2553   */
2554  vjs.Component.prototype.triggerReady = function(){
2555    this.isReady_ = true;
2556  
2557    var readyQueue = this.readyQueue_;
2558  
2559    if (readyQueue && readyQueue.length > 0) {
2560  
2561      for (var i = 0, j = readyQueue.length; i < j; i++) {
2562        readyQueue[i].call(this);
2563      }
2564  
2565      // Reset Ready Queue
2566      this.readyQueue_ = [];
2567  
2568      // Allow for using event listeners also, in case you want to do something everytime a source is ready.
2569      this.trigger('ready');
2570    }
2571  };
2572  
2573  /* Display
2574  ============================================================================= */
2575  
2576  /**
2577   * Check if a component's element has a CSS class name
2578   *
2579   * @param {String} classToCheck Classname to check
2580   * @return {vjs.Component}
2581   */
2582  vjs.Component.prototype.hasClass = function(classToCheck){
2583    return vjs.hasClass(this.el_, classToCheck);
2584  };
2585  
2586  /**
2587   * Add a CSS class name to the component's element
2588   *
2589   * @param {String} classToAdd Classname to add
2590   * @return {vjs.Component}
2591   */
2592  vjs.Component.prototype.addClass = function(classToAdd){
2593    vjs.addClass(this.el_, classToAdd);
2594    return this;
2595  };
2596  
2597  /**
2598   * Remove a CSS class name from the component's element
2599   *
2600   * @param {String} classToRemove Classname to remove
2601   * @return {vjs.Component}
2602   */
2603  vjs.Component.prototype.removeClass = function(classToRemove){
2604    vjs.removeClass(this.el_, classToRemove);
2605    return this;
2606  };
2607  
2608  /**
2609   * Show the component element if hidden
2610   *
2611   * @return {vjs.Component}
2612   */
2613  vjs.Component.prototype.show = function(){
2614    this.removeClass('vjs-hidden');
2615    return this;
2616  };
2617  
2618  /**
2619   * Hide the component element if currently showing
2620   *
2621   * @return {vjs.Component}
2622   */
2623  vjs.Component.prototype.hide = function(){
2624    this.addClass('vjs-hidden');
2625    return this;
2626  };
2627  
2628  /**
2629   * Lock an item in its visible state
2630   * To be used with fadeIn/fadeOut.
2631   *
2632   * @return {vjs.Component}
2633   * @private
2634   */
2635  vjs.Component.prototype.lockShowing = function(){
2636    this.addClass('vjs-lock-showing');
2637    return this;
2638  };
2639  
2640  /**
2641   * Unlock an item to be hidden
2642   * To be used with fadeIn/fadeOut.
2643   *
2644   * @return {vjs.Component}
2645   * @private
2646   */
2647  vjs.Component.prototype.unlockShowing = function(){
2648    this.removeClass('vjs-lock-showing');
2649    return this;
2650  };
2651  
2652  /**
2653   * Disable component by making it unshowable
2654   *
2655   * Currently private because we're moving towards more css-based states.
2656   * @private
2657   */
2658  vjs.Component.prototype.disable = function(){
2659    this.hide();
2660    this.show = function(){};
2661  };
2662  
2663  /**
2664   * Set or get the width of the component (CSS values)
2665   *
2666   * Setting the video tag dimension values only works with values in pixels.
2667   * Percent values will not work.
2668   * Some percents can be used, but width()/height() will return the number + %,
2669   * not the actual computed width/height.
2670   *
2671   * @param  {Number|String=} num   Optional width number
2672   * @param  {Boolean} skipListeners Skip the 'resize' event trigger
2673   * @return {vjs.Component} This component, when setting the width
2674   * @return {Number|String} The width, when getting
2675   */
2676  vjs.Component.prototype.width = function(num, skipListeners){
2677    return this.dimension('width', num, skipListeners);
2678  };
2679  
2680  /**
2681   * Get or set the height of the component (CSS values)
2682   *
2683   * Setting the video tag dimension values only works with values in pixels.
2684   * Percent values will not work.
2685   * Some percents can be used, but width()/height() will return the number + %,
2686   * not the actual computed width/height.
2687   *
2688   * @param  {Number|String=} num     New component height
2689   * @param  {Boolean=} skipListeners Skip the resize event trigger
2690   * @return {vjs.Component} This component, when setting the height
2691   * @return {Number|String} The height, when getting
2692   */
2693  vjs.Component.prototype.height = function(num, skipListeners){
2694    return this.dimension('height', num, skipListeners);
2695  };
2696  
2697  /**
2698   * Set both width and height at the same time
2699   *
2700   * @param  {Number|String} width
2701   * @param  {Number|String} height
2702   * @return {vjs.Component} The component
2703   */
2704  vjs.Component.prototype.dimensions = function(width, height){
2705    // Skip resize listeners on width for optimization
2706    return this.width(width, true).height(height);
2707  };
2708  
2709  /**
2710   * Get or set width or height
2711   *
2712   * This is the shared code for the width() and height() methods.
2713   * All for an integer, integer + 'px' or integer + '%';
2714   *
2715   * Known issue: Hidden elements officially have a width of 0. We're defaulting
2716   * to the style.width value and falling back to computedStyle which has the
2717   * hidden element issue. Info, but probably not an efficient fix:
2718   * http://www.foliotek.com/devblog/getting-the-width-of-a-hidden-element-with-jquery-using-width/
2719   *
2720   * @param  {String} widthOrHeight  'width' or 'height'
2721   * @param  {Number|String=} num     New dimension
2722   * @param  {Boolean=} skipListeners Skip resize event trigger
2723   * @return {vjs.Component} The component if a dimension was set
2724   * @return {Number|String} The dimension if nothing was set
2725   * @private
2726   */
2727  vjs.Component.prototype.dimension = function(widthOrHeight, num, skipListeners){
2728    if (num !== undefined) {
2729      if (num === null || vjs.isNaN(num)) {
2730        num = 0;
2731      }
2732  
2733      // Check if using css width/height (% or px) and adjust
2734      if ((''+num).indexOf('%') !== -1 || (''+num).indexOf('px') !== -1) {
2735        this.el_.style[widthOrHeight] = num;
2736      } else if (num === 'auto') {
2737        this.el_.style[widthOrHeight] = '';
2738      } else {
2739        this.el_.style[widthOrHeight] = num+'px';
2740      }
2741  
2742      // skipListeners allows us to avoid triggering the resize event when setting both width and height
2743      if (!skipListeners) { this.trigger('resize'); }
2744  
2745      // Return component
2746      return this;
2747    }
2748  
2749    // Not setting a value, so getting it
2750    // Make sure element exists
2751    if (!this.el_) return 0;
2752  
2753    // Get dimension value from style
2754    var val = this.el_.style[widthOrHeight];
2755    var pxIndex = val.indexOf('px');
2756    if (pxIndex !== -1) {
2757      // Return the pixel value with no 'px'
2758      return parseInt(val.slice(0,pxIndex), 10);
2759  
2760    // No px so using % or no style was set, so falling back to offsetWidth/height
2761    // If component has display:none, offset will return 0
2762    // TODO: handle display:none and no dimension style using px
2763    } else {
2764  
2765      return parseInt(this.el_['offset'+vjs.capitalize(widthOrHeight)], 10);
2766  
2767      // ComputedStyle version.
2768      // Only difference is if the element is hidden it will return
2769      // the percent value (e.g. '100%'')
2770      // instead of zero like offsetWidth returns.
2771      // var val = vjs.getComputedStyleValue(this.el_, widthOrHeight);
2772      // var pxIndex = val.indexOf('px');
2773  
2774      // if (pxIndex !== -1) {
2775      //   return val.slice(0, pxIndex);
2776      // } else {
2777      //   return val;
2778      // }
2779    }
2780  };
2781  
2782  /**
2783   * Fired when the width and/or height of the component changes
2784   * @event resize
2785   */
2786  vjs.Component.prototype.onResize;
2787  
2788  /**
2789   * Emit 'tap' events when touch events are supported
2790   *
2791   * This is used to support toggling the controls through a tap on the video.
2792   *
2793   * We're requiring them to be enabled because otherwise every component would
2794   * have this extra overhead unnecessarily, on mobile devices where extra
2795   * overhead is especially bad.
2796   * @private
2797   */
2798  vjs.Component.prototype.emitTapEvents = function(){
2799    var touchStart, firstTouch, touchTime, couldBeTap, noTap,
2800        xdiff, ydiff, touchDistance, tapMovementThreshold, touchTimeThreshold;
2801  
2802    // Track the start time so we can determine how long the touch lasted
2803    touchStart = 0;
2804    firstTouch = null;
2805  
2806    // Maximum movement allowed during a touch event to still be considered a tap
2807    // Other popular libs use anywhere from 2 (hammer.js) to 15, so 10 seems like a nice, round number.
2808    tapMovementThreshold = 10;
2809  
2810    // The maximum length a touch can be while still being considered a tap
2811    touchTimeThreshold = 200;
2812  
2813    this.on('touchstart', function(event) {
2814      // If more than one finger, don't consider treating this as a click
2815      if (event.touches.length === 1) {
2816        firstTouch = vjs.obj.copy(event.touches[0]);
2817        // Record start time so we can detect a tap vs. "touch and hold"
2818        touchStart = new Date().getTime();
2819        // Reset couldBeTap tracking
2820        couldBeTap = true;
2821      }
2822    });
2823  
2824    this.on('touchmove', function(event) {
2825      // If more than one finger, don't consider treating this as a click
2826      if (event.touches.length > 1) {
2827        couldBeTap = false;
2828      } else if (firstTouch) {
2829        // Some devices will throw touchmoves for all but the slightest of taps.
2830        // So, if we moved only a small distance, this could still be a tap
2831        xdiff = event.touches[0].pageX - firstTouch.pageX;
2832        ydiff = event.touches[0].pageY - firstTouch.pageY;
2833        touchDistance = Math.sqrt(xdiff * xdiff + ydiff * ydiff);
2834        if (touchDistance > tapMovementThreshold) {
2835          couldBeTap = false;
2836        }
2837      }
2838    });
2839  
2840    noTap = function(){
2841      couldBeTap = false;
2842    };
2843    // TODO: Listen to the original target. http://youtu.be/DujfpXOKUp8?t=13m8s
2844    this.on('touchleave', noTap);
2845    this.on('touchcancel', noTap);
2846  
2847    // When the touch ends, measure how long it took and trigger the appropriate
2848    // event
2849    this.on('touchend', function(event) {
2850      firstTouch = null;
2851      // Proceed only if the touchmove/leave/cancel event didn't happen
2852      if (couldBeTap === true) {
2853        // Measure how long the touch lasted
2854        touchTime = new Date().getTime() - touchStart;
2855        // Make sure the touch was less than the threshold to be considered a tap
2856        if (touchTime < touchTimeThreshold) {
2857          event.preventDefault(); // Don't let browser turn this into a click
2858          this.trigger('tap');
2859          // It may be good to copy the touchend event object and change the
2860          // type to tap, if the other event properties aren't exact after
2861          // vjs.fixEvent runs (e.g. event.target)
2862        }
2863      }
2864    });
2865  };
2866  
2867  /**
2868   * Report user touch activity when touch events occur
2869   *
2870   * User activity is used to determine when controls should show/hide. It's
2871   * relatively simple when it comes to mouse events, because any mouse event
2872   * should show the controls. So we capture mouse events that bubble up to the
2873   * player and report activity when that happens.
2874   *
2875   * With touch events it isn't as easy. We can't rely on touch events at the
2876   * player level, because a tap (touchstart + touchend) on the video itself on
2877   * mobile devices is meant to turn controls off (and on). User activity is
2878   * checked asynchronously, so what could happen is a tap event on the video
2879   * turns the controls off, then the touchend event bubbles up to the player,
2880   * which if it reported user activity, would turn the controls right back on.
2881   * (We also don't want to completely block touch events from bubbling up)
2882   *
2883   * Also a touchmove, touch+hold, and anything other than a tap is not supposed
2884   * to turn the controls back on on a mobile device.
2885   *
2886   * Here we're setting the default component behavior to report user activity
2887   * whenever touch events happen, and this can be turned off by components that
2888   * want touch events to act differently.
2889   */
2890  vjs.Component.prototype.enableTouchActivity = function() {
2891    var report, touchHolding, touchEnd;
2892  
2893    // Don't continue if the root player doesn't support reporting user activity
2894    if (!this.player().reportUserActivity) {
2895      return;
2896    }
2897  
2898    // listener for reporting that the user is active
2899    report = vjs.bind(this.player(), this.player().reportUserActivity);
2900  
2901    this.on('touchstart', function() {
2902      report();
2903      // For as long as the they are touching the device or have their mouse down,
2904      // we consider them active even if they're not moving their finger or mouse.
2905      // So we want to continue to update that they are active
2906      this.clearInterval(touchHolding);
2907      // report at the same interval as activityCheck
2908      touchHolding = this.setInterval(report, 250);
2909    });
2910  
2911    touchEnd = function(event) {
2912      report();
2913      // stop the interval that maintains activity if the touch is holding
2914      this.clearInterval(touchHolding);
2915    };
2916  
2917    this.on('touchmove', report);
2918    this.on('touchend', touchEnd);
2919    this.on('touchcancel', touchEnd);
2920  };
2921  
2922  /**
2923   * Creates timeout and sets up disposal automatically.
2924   * @param {Function} fn The function to run after the timeout.
2925   * @param {Number} timeout Number of ms to delay before executing specified function.
2926   * @return {Number} Returns the timeout ID
2927   */
2928  vjs.Component.prototype.setTimeout = function(fn, timeout) {
2929    fn = vjs.bind(this, fn);
2930  
2931    // window.setTimeout would be preferable here, but due to some bizarre issue with Sinon and/or Phantomjs, we can't.
2932    var timeoutId = setTimeout(fn, timeout);
2933  
2934    var disposeFn = function() {
2935      this.clearTimeout(timeoutId);
2936    };
2937  
2938    disposeFn.guid = 'vjs-timeout-'+ timeoutId;
2939  
2940    this.on('dispose', disposeFn);
2941  
2942    return timeoutId;
2943  };
2944  
2945  
2946  /**
2947   * Clears a timeout and removes the associated dispose listener
2948   * @param {Number} timeoutId The id of the timeout to clear
2949   * @return {Number} Returns the timeout ID
2950   */
2951  vjs.Component.prototype.clearTimeout = function(timeoutId) {
2952    clearTimeout(timeoutId);
2953  
2954    var disposeFn = function(){};
2955    disposeFn.guid = 'vjs-timeout-'+ timeoutId;
2956  
2957    this.off('dispose', disposeFn);
2958  
2959    return timeoutId;
2960  };
2961  
2962  /**
2963   * Creates an interval and sets up disposal automatically.
2964   * @param {Function} fn The function to run every N seconds.
2965   * @param {Number} interval Number of ms to delay before executing specified function.
2966   * @return {Number} Returns the interval ID
2967   */
2968  vjs.Component.prototype.setInterval = function(fn, interval) {
2969    fn = vjs.bind(this, fn);
2970  
2971    var intervalId = setInterval(fn, interval);
2972  
2973    var disposeFn = function() {
2974      this.clearInterval(intervalId);
2975    };
2976  
2977    disposeFn.guid = 'vjs-interval-'+ intervalId;
2978  
2979    this.on('dispose', disposeFn);
2980  
2981    return intervalId;
2982  };
2983  
2984  /**
2985   * Clears an interval and removes the associated dispose listener
2986   * @param {Number} intervalId The id of the interval to clear
2987   * @return {Number} Returns the interval ID
2988   */
2989  vjs.Component.prototype.clearInterval = function(intervalId) {
2990    clearInterval(intervalId);
2991  
2992    var disposeFn = function(){};
2993    disposeFn.guid = 'vjs-interval-'+ intervalId;
2994  
2995    this.off('dispose', disposeFn);
2996  
2997    return intervalId;
2998  };
2999  /* Button - Base class for all buttons
3000  ================================================================================ */
3001  /**
3002   * Base class for all buttons
3003   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
3004   * @param {Object=} options
3005   * @class
3006   * @constructor
3007   */
3008  vjs.Button = vjs.Component.extend({
3009    /**
3010     * @constructor
3011     * @inheritDoc
3012     */
3013    init: function(player, options){
3014      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options);
3015  
3016      this.emitTapEvents();
3017  
3018      this.on('tap', this.onClick);
3019      this.on('click', this.onClick);
3020      this.on('focus', this.onFocus);
3021      this.on('blur', this.onBlur);
3022    }
3023  });
3024  
3025  vjs.Button.prototype.createEl = function(type, props){
3026    var el;
3027  
3028    // Add standard Aria and Tabindex info
3029    props = vjs.obj.merge({
3030      className: this.buildCSSClass(),
3031      'role': 'button',
3032      'aria-live': 'polite', // let the screen reader user know that the text of the button may change
3033      tabIndex: 0
3034    }, props);
3035  
3036    el = vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, type, props);
3037  
3038    // if innerHTML hasn't been overridden (bigPlayButton), add content elements
3039    if (!props.innerHTML) {
3040      this.contentEl_ = vjs.createEl('div', {
3041        className: 'vjs-control-content'
3042      });
3043  
3044      this.controlText_ = vjs.createEl('span', {
3045        className: 'vjs-control-text',
3046        innerHTML: this.localize(this.buttonText) || 'Need Text'
3047      });
3048  
3049      this.contentEl_.appendChild(this.controlText_);
3050      el.appendChild(this.contentEl_);
3051    }
3052  
3053    return el;
3054  };
3055  
3056  vjs.Button.prototype.buildCSSClass = function(){
3057    // TODO: Change vjs-control to vjs-button?
3058    return 'vjs-control ' + vjs.Component.prototype.buildCSSClass.call(this);
3059  };
3060  
3061    // Click - Override with specific functionality for button
3062  vjs.Button.prototype.onClick = function(){};
3063  
3064    // Focus - Add keyboard functionality to element
3065  vjs.Button.prototype.onFocus = function(){
3066    vjs.on(document, 'keydown', vjs.bind(this, this.onKeyPress));
3067  };
3068  
3069    // KeyPress (document level) - Trigger click when keys are pressed
3070  vjs.Button.prototype.onKeyPress = function(event){
3071    // Check for space bar (32) or enter (13) keys
3072    if (event.which == 32 || event.which == 13) {
3073      event.preventDefault();
3074      this.onClick();
3075    }
3076  };
3077  
3078  // Blur - Remove keyboard triggers
3079  vjs.Button.prototype.onBlur = function(){
3080    vjs.off(document, 'keydown', vjs.bind(this, this.onKeyPress));
3081  };
3082  /* Slider
3083  ================================================================================ */
3084  /**
3085   * The base functionality for sliders like the volume bar and seek bar
3086   *
3087   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
3088   * @param {Object=} options
3089   * @constructor
3090   */
3091  vjs.Slider = vjs.Component.extend({
3092    /** @constructor */
3093    init: function(player, options){
3094      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options);
3095  
3096      // Set property names to bar and handle to match with the child Slider class is looking for
3097      this.bar = this.getChild(this.options_['barName']);
3098      this.handle = this.getChild(this.options_['handleName']);
3099  
3100      this.on('mousedown', this.onMouseDown);
3101      this.on('touchstart', this.onMouseDown);
3102      this.on('focus', this.onFocus);
3103      this.on('blur', this.onBlur);
3104      this.on('click', this.onClick);
3105  
3106      this.on(player, 'controlsvisible', this.update);
3107      this.on(player, this.playerEvent, this.update);
3108    }
3109  });
3110  
3111  vjs.Slider.prototype.createEl = function(type, props) {
3112    props = props || {};
3113    // Add the slider element class to all sub classes
3114    props.className = props.className + ' vjs-slider';
3115    props = vjs.obj.merge({
3116      'role': 'slider',
3117      'aria-valuenow': 0,
3118      'aria-valuemin': 0,
3119      'aria-valuemax': 100,
3120      tabIndex: 0
3121    }, props);
3122  
3123    return vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, type, props);
3124  };
3125  
3126  vjs.Slider.prototype.onMouseDown = function(event){
3127    event.preventDefault();
3128    vjs.blockTextSelection();
3129    this.addClass('vjs-sliding');
3130  
3131    this.on(document, 'mousemove', this.onMouseMove);
3132    this.on(document, 'mouseup', this.onMouseUp);
3133    this.on(document, 'touchmove', this.onMouseMove);
3134    this.on(document, 'touchend', this.onMouseUp);
3135  
3136    this.onMouseMove(event);
3137  };
3138  
3139  // To be overridden by a subclass
3140  vjs.Slider.prototype.onMouseMove = function(){};
3141  
3142  vjs.Slider.prototype.onMouseUp = function() {
3143    vjs.unblockTextSelection();
3144    this.removeClass('vjs-sliding');
3145  
3146    this.off(document, 'mousemove', this.onMouseMove);
3147    this.off(document, 'mouseup', this.onMouseUp);
3148    this.off(document, 'touchmove', this.onMouseMove);
3149    this.off(document, 'touchend', this.onMouseUp);
3150  
3151    this.update();
3152  };
3153  
3154  vjs.Slider.prototype.update = function(){
3155    // In VolumeBar init we have a setTimeout for update that pops and update to the end of the
3156    // execution stack. The player is destroyed before then update will cause an error
3157    if (!this.el_) return;
3158  
3159    // If scrubbing, we could use a cached value to make the handle keep up with the user's mouse.
3160    // On HTML5 browsers scrubbing is really smooth, but some flash players are slow, so we might want to utilize this later.
3161    // var progress =  (this.player_.scrubbing) ? this.player_.getCache().currentTime / this.player_.duration() : this.player_.currentTime() / this.player_.duration();
3162  
3163    var barProgress,
3164        progress = this.getPercent(),
3165        handle = this.handle,
3166        bar = this.bar;
3167  
3168    // Protect against no duration and other division issues
3169    if (typeof progress !== 'number' ||
3170        progress !== progress ||
3171        progress < 0 ||
3172        progress === Infinity) {
3173          progress = 0;
3174    }
3175  
3176    barProgress = progress;
3177  
3178    // If there is a handle, we need to account for the handle in our calculation for progress bar
3179    // so that it doesn't fall short of or extend past the handle.
3180    if (handle) {
3181  
3182      var box = this.el_,
3183          boxWidth = box.offsetWidth,
3184  
3185          handleWidth = handle.el().offsetWidth,
3186  
3187          // The width of the handle in percent of the containing box
3188          // In IE, widths may not be ready yet causing NaN
3189          handlePercent = (handleWidth) ? handleWidth / boxWidth : 0,
3190  
3191          // Get the adjusted size of the box, considering that the handle's center never touches the left or right side.
3192          // There is a margin of half the handle's width on both sides.
3193          boxAdjustedPercent = 1 - handlePercent,
3194  
3195          // Adjust the progress that we'll use to set widths to the new adjusted box width
3196          adjustedProgress = progress * boxAdjustedPercent;
3197  
3198      // The bar does reach the left side, so we need to account for this in the bar's width
3199      barProgress = adjustedProgress + (handlePercent / 2);
3200  
3201      // Move the handle from the left based on the adjected progress
3202      handle.el().style.left = vjs.round(adjustedProgress * 100, 2) + '%';
3203    }
3204  
3205    // Set the new bar width
3206    if (bar) {
3207      bar.el().style.width = vjs.round(barProgress * 100, 2) + '%';
3208    }
3209  };
3210  
3211  vjs.Slider.prototype.calculateDistance = function(event){
3212    var el, box, boxX, boxY, boxW, boxH, handle, pageX, pageY;
3213  
3214    el = this.el_;
3215    box = vjs.findPosition(el);
3216    boxW = boxH = el.offsetWidth;
3217    handle = this.handle;
3218  
3219    if (this.options()['vertical']) {
3220      boxY = box.top;
3221  
3222      if (event.changedTouches) {
3223        pageY = event.changedTouches[0].pageY;
3224      } else {
3225        pageY = event.pageY;
3226      }
3227  
3228      if (handle) {
3229        var handleH = handle.el().offsetHeight;
3230        // Adjusted X and Width, so handle doesn't go outside the bar
3231        boxY = boxY + (handleH / 2);
3232        boxH = boxH - handleH;
3233      }
3234  
3235      // Percent that the click is through the adjusted area
3236      return Math.max(0, Math.min(1, ((boxY - pageY) + boxH) / boxH));
3237  
3238    } else {
3239      boxX = box.left;
3240  
3241      if (event.changedTouches) {
3242        pageX = event.changedTouches[0].pageX;
3243      } else {
3244        pageX = event.pageX;
3245      }
3246  
3247      if (handle) {
3248        var handleW = handle.el().offsetWidth;
3249  
3250        // Adjusted X and Width, so handle doesn't go outside the bar
3251        boxX = boxX + (handleW / 2);
3252        boxW = boxW - handleW;
3253      }
3254  
3255      // Percent that the click is through the adjusted area
3256      return Math.max(0, Math.min(1, (pageX - boxX) / boxW));
3257    }
3258  };
3259  
3260  vjs.Slider.prototype.onFocus = function(){
3261    this.on(document, 'keydown', this.onKeyPress);
3262  };
3263  
3264  vjs.Slider.prototype.onKeyPress = function(event){
3265    if (event.which == 37 || event.which == 40) { // Left and Down Arrows
3266      event.preventDefault();
3267      this.stepBack();
3268    } else if (event.which == 38 || event.which == 39) { // Up and Right Arrows
3269      event.preventDefault();
3270      this.stepForward();
3271    }
3272  };
3273  
3274  vjs.Slider.prototype.onBlur = function(){
3275    this.off(document, 'keydown', this.onKeyPress);
3276  };
3277  
3278  /**
3279   * Listener for click events on slider, used to prevent clicks
3280   *   from bubbling up to parent elements like button menus.
3281   * @param  {Object} event Event object
3282   */
3283  vjs.Slider.prototype.onClick = function(event){
3284    event.stopImmediatePropagation();
3285    event.preventDefault();
3286  };
3287  
3288  /**
3289   * SeekBar Behavior includes play progress bar, and seek handle
3290   * Needed so it can determine seek position based on handle position/size
3291   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
3292   * @param {Object=} options
3293   * @constructor
3294   */
3295  vjs.SliderHandle = vjs.Component.extend();
3296  
3297  /**
3298   * Default value of the slider
3299   *
3300   * @type {Number}
3301   * @private
3302   */
3303  vjs.SliderHandle.prototype.defaultValue = 0;
3304  
3305  /** @inheritDoc */
3306  vjs.SliderHandle.prototype.createEl = function(type, props) {
3307    props = props || {};
3308    // Add the slider element class to all sub classes
3309    props.className = props.className + ' vjs-slider-handle';
3310    props = vjs.obj.merge({
3311      innerHTML: '<span class="vjs-control-text">'+this.defaultValue+'</span>'
3312    }, props);
3313  
3314    return vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', props);
3315  };
3316  /* Menu
3317  ================================================================================ */
3318  /**
3319   * The Menu component is used to build pop up menus, including subtitle and
3320   * captions selection menus.
3321   *
3322   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
3323   * @param {Object=} options
3324   * @class
3325   * @constructor
3326   */
3327  vjs.Menu = vjs.Component.extend();
3328  
3329  /**
3330   * Add a menu item to the menu
3331   * @param {Object|String} component Component or component type to add
3332   */
3333  vjs.Menu.prototype.addItem = function(component){
3334    this.addChild(component);
3335    component.on('click', vjs.bind(this, function(){
3336      this.unlockShowing();
3337    }));
3338  };
3339  
3340  /** @inheritDoc */
3341  vjs.Menu.prototype.createEl = function(){
3342    var contentElType = this.options().contentElType || 'ul';
3343    this.contentEl_ = vjs.createEl(contentElType, {
3344      className: 'vjs-menu-content'
3345    });
3346    var el = vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
3347      append: this.contentEl_,
3348      className: 'vjs-menu'
3349    });
3350    el.appendChild(this.contentEl_);
3351  
3352    // Prevent clicks from bubbling up. Needed for Menu Buttons,
3353    // where a click on the parent is significant
3354    vjs.on(el, 'click', function(event){
3355      event.preventDefault();
3356      event.stopImmediatePropagation();
3357    });
3358  
3359    return el;
3360  };
3361  
3362  /**
3363   * The component for a menu item. `<li>`
3364   *
3365   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
3366   * @param {Object=} options
3367   * @class
3368   * @constructor
3369   */
3370  vjs.MenuItem = vjs.Button.extend({
3371    /** @constructor */
3372    init: function(player, options){
3373      vjs.Button.call(this, player, options);
3374      this.selected(options['selected']);
3375    }
3376  });
3377  
3378  /** @inheritDoc */
3379  vjs.MenuItem.prototype.createEl = function(type, props){
3380    return vjs.Button.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'li', vjs.obj.merge({
3381      className: 'vjs-menu-item',
3382      innerHTML: this.localize(this.options_['label'])
3383    }, props));
3384  };
3385  
3386  /**
3387   * Handle a click on the menu item, and set it to selected
3388   */
3389  vjs.MenuItem.prototype.onClick = function(){
3390    this.selected(true);
3391  };
3392  
3393  /**
3394   * Set this menu item as selected or not
3395   * @param  {Boolean} selected
3396   */
3397  vjs.MenuItem.prototype.selected = function(selected){
3398    if (selected) {
3399      this.addClass('vjs-selected');
3400      this.el_.setAttribute('aria-selected',true);
3401    } else {
3402      this.removeClass('vjs-selected');
3403      this.el_.setAttribute('aria-selected',false);
3404    }
3405  };
3406  
3407  
3408  /**
3409   * A button class with a popup menu
3410   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
3411   * @param {Object=} options
3412   * @constructor
3413   */
3414  vjs.MenuButton = vjs.Button.extend({
3415    /** @constructor */
3416    init: function(player, options){
3417      vjs.Button.call(this, player, options);
3418  
3419      this.update();
3420  
3421      this.on('keydown', this.onKeyPress);
3422      this.el_.setAttribute('aria-haspopup', true);
3423      this.el_.setAttribute('role', 'button');
3424    }
3425  });
3426  
3427  vjs.MenuButton.prototype.update = function() {
3428    var menu = this.createMenu();
3429  
3430    if (this.menu) {
3431      this.removeChild(this.menu);
3432    }
3433  
3434    this.menu = menu;
3435    this.addChild(menu);
3436  
3437    if (this.items && this.items.length === 0) {
3438      this.hide();
3439    } else if (this.items && this.items.length > 1) {
3440      this.show();
3441    }
3442  };
3443  
3444  /**
3445   * Track the state of the menu button
3446   * @type {Boolean}
3447   * @private
3448   */
3449  vjs.MenuButton.prototype.buttonPressed_ = false;
3450  
3451  vjs.MenuButton.prototype.createMenu = function(){
3452    var menu = new vjs.Menu(this.player_);
3453  
3454    // Add a title list item to the top
3455    if (this.options().title) {
3456      menu.contentEl().appendChild(vjs.createEl('li', {
3457        className: 'vjs-menu-title',
3458        innerHTML: vjs.capitalize(this.options().title),
3459        tabindex: -1
3460      }));
3461    }
3462  
3463    this.items = this['createItems']();
3464  
3465    if (this.items) {
3466      // Add menu items to the menu
3467      for (var i = 0; i < this.items.length; i++) {
3468        menu.addItem(this.items[i]);
3469      }
3470    }
3471  
3472    return menu;
3473  };
3474  
3475  /**
3476   * Create the list of menu items. Specific to each subclass.
3477   */
3478  vjs.MenuButton.prototype.createItems = function(){};
3479  
3480  /** @inheritDoc */
3481  vjs.MenuButton.prototype.buildCSSClass = function(){
3482    return this.className + ' vjs-menu-button ' + vjs.Button.prototype.buildCSSClass.call(this);
3483  };
3484  
3485  // Focus - Add keyboard functionality to element
3486  // This function is not needed anymore. Instead, the keyboard functionality is handled by
3487  // treating the button as triggering a submenu. When the button is pressed, the submenu
3488  // appears. Pressing the button again makes the submenu disappear.
3489  vjs.MenuButton.prototype.onFocus = function(){};
3490  // Can't turn off list display that we turned on with focus, because list would go away.
3491  vjs.MenuButton.prototype.onBlur = function(){};
3492  
3493  vjs.MenuButton.prototype.onClick = function(){
3494    // When you click the button it adds focus, which will show the menu indefinitely.
3495    // So we'll remove focus when the mouse leaves the button.
3496    // Focus is needed for tab navigation.
3497    this.one('mouseout', vjs.bind(this, function(){
3498      this.menu.unlockShowing();
3499      this.el_.blur();
3500    }));
3501    if (this.buttonPressed_){
3502      this.unpressButton();
3503    } else {
3504      this.pressButton();
3505    }
3506  };
3507  
3508  vjs.MenuButton.prototype.onKeyPress = function(event){
3509  
3510    // Check for space bar (32) or enter (13) keys
3511    if (event.which == 32 || event.which == 13) {
3512      if (this.buttonPressed_){
3513        this.unpressButton();
3514      } else {
3515        this.pressButton();
3516      }
3517      event.preventDefault();
3518    // Check for escape (27) key
3519    } else if (event.which == 27){
3520      if (this.buttonPressed_){
3521        this.unpressButton();
3522      }
3523      event.preventDefault();
3524    }
3525  };
3526  
3527  vjs.MenuButton.prototype.pressButton = function(){
3528    this.buttonPressed_ = true;
3529    this.menu.lockShowing();
3530    this.el_.setAttribute('aria-pressed', true);
3531    if (this.items && this.items.length > 0) {
3532      this.items[0].el().focus(); // set the focus to the title of the submenu
3533    }
3534  };
3535  
3536  vjs.MenuButton.prototype.unpressButton = function(){
3537    this.buttonPressed_ = false;
3538    this.menu.unlockShowing();
3539    this.el_.setAttribute('aria-pressed', false);
3540  };
3541  /**
3542   * Custom MediaError to mimic the HTML5 MediaError
3543   * @param {Number} code The media error code
3544   */
3545  vjs.MediaError = function(code){
3546    if (typeof code === 'number') {
3547      this.code = code;
3548    } else if (typeof code === 'string') {
3549      // default code is zero, so this is a custom error
3550      this.message = code;
3551    } else if (typeof code === 'object') { // object
3552      vjs.obj.merge(this, code);
3553    }
3554  
3555    if (!this.message) {
3556      this.message = vjs.MediaError.defaultMessages[this.code] || '';
3557    }
3558  };
3559  
3560  /**
3561   * The error code that refers two one of the defined
3562   * MediaError types
3563   * @type {Number}
3564   */
3565  vjs.MediaError.prototype.code = 0;
3566  
3567  /**
3568   * An optional message to be shown with the error.
3569   * Message is not part of the HTML5 video spec
3570   * but allows for more informative custom errors.
3571   * @type {String}
3572   */
3573  vjs.MediaError.prototype.message = '';
3574  
3575  /**
3576   * An optional status code that can be set by plugins
3577   * to allow even more detail about the error.
3578   * For example the HLS plugin might provide the specific
3579   * HTTP status code that was returned when the error
3580   * occurred, then allowing a custom error overlay
3581   * to display more information.
3582   * @type {[type]}
3583   */
3584  vjs.MediaError.prototype.status = null;
3585  
3586  vjs.MediaError.errorTypes = [
3587    'MEDIA_ERR_CUSTOM',            // = 0
3588    'MEDIA_ERR_ABORTED',           // = 1
3589    'MEDIA_ERR_NETWORK',           // = 2
3590    'MEDIA_ERR_DECODE',            // = 3
3591    'MEDIA_ERR_SRC_NOT_SUPPORTED', // = 4
3592    'MEDIA_ERR_ENCRYPTED'          // = 5
3593  ];
3594  
3595  vjs.MediaError.defaultMessages = {
3596    1: 'You aborted the video playback',
3597    2: 'A network error caused the video download to fail part-way.',
3598    3: 'The video playback was aborted due to a corruption problem or because the video used features your browser did not support.',
3599    4: 'The video could not be loaded, either because the server or network failed or because the format is not supported.',
3600    5: 'The video is encrypted and we do not have the keys to decrypt it.'
3601  };
3602  
3603  // Add types as properties on MediaError
3604  // e.g. MediaError.MEDIA_ERR_SRC_NOT_SUPPORTED = 4;
3605  for (var errNum = 0; errNum < vjs.MediaError.errorTypes.length; errNum++) {
3606    vjs.MediaError[vjs.MediaError.errorTypes[errNum]] = errNum;
3607    // values should be accessible on both the class and instance
3608    vjs.MediaError.prototype[vjs.MediaError.errorTypes[errNum]] = errNum;
3609  }
3610  (function(){
3611    var apiMap, specApi, browserApi, i;
3612  
3613    /**
3614     * Store the browser-specific methods for the fullscreen API
3615     * @type {Object|undefined}
3616     * @private
3617     */
3618    vjs.browser.fullscreenAPI;
3619  
3620    // browser API methods
3621    // map approach from Screenful.js - https://github.com/sindresorhus/screenfull.js
3622    apiMap = [
3623      // Spec: https://dvcs.w3.org/hg/fullscreen/raw-file/tip/Overview.html
3624      [
3625        'requestFullscreen',
3626        'exitFullscreen',
3627        'fullscreenElement',
3628        'fullscreenEnabled',
3629        'fullscreenchange',
3630        'fullscreenerror'
3631      ],
3632      // WebKit
3633      [
3634        'webkitRequestFullscreen',
3635        'webkitExitFullscreen',
3636        'webkitFullscreenElement',
3637        'webkitFullscreenEnabled',
3638        'webkitfullscreenchange',
3639        'webkitfullscreenerror'
3640      ],
3641      // Old WebKit (Safari 5.1)
3642      [
3643        'webkitRequestFullScreen',
3644        'webkitCancelFullScreen',
3645        'webkitCurrentFullScreenElement',
3646        'webkitCancelFullScreen',
3647        'webkitfullscreenchange',
3648        'webkitfullscreenerror'
3649      ],
3650      // Mozilla
3651      [
3652        'mozRequestFullScreen',
3653        'mozCancelFullScreen',
3654        'mozFullScreenElement',
3655        'mozFullScreenEnabled',
3656        'mozfullscreenchange',
3657        'mozfullscreenerror'
3658      ],
3659      // Microsoft
3660      [
3661        'msRequestFullscreen',
3662        'msExitFullscreen',
3663        'msFullscreenElement',
3664        'msFullscreenEnabled',
3665        'MSFullscreenChange',
3666        'MSFullscreenError'
3667      ]
3668    ];
3669  
3670    specApi = apiMap[0];
3671  
3672    // determine the supported set of functions
3673    for (i=0; i<apiMap.length; i++) {
3674      // check for exitFullscreen function
3675      if (apiMap[i][1] in document) {
3676        browserApi = apiMap[i];
3677        break;
3678      }
3679    }
3680  
3681    // map the browser API names to the spec API names
3682    // or leave vjs.browser.fullscreenAPI undefined
3683    if (browserApi) {
3684      vjs.browser.fullscreenAPI = {};
3685  
3686      for (i=0; i<browserApi.length; i++) {
3687        vjs.browser.fullscreenAPI[specApi[i]] = browserApi[i];
3688      }
3689    }
3690  
3691  })();
3692  /**
3693   * An instance of the `vjs.Player` class is created when any of the Video.js setup methods are used to initialize a video.
3694   *
3695   * ```js
3696   * var myPlayer = videojs('example_video_1');
3697   * ```
3698   *
3699   * In the following example, the `data-setup` attribute tells the Video.js library to create a player instance when the library is ready.
3700   *
3701   * ```html
3702   * <video id="example_video_1" data-setup='{}' controls>
3703   *   <source src="my-source.mp4" type="video/mp4">
3704   * </video>
3705   * ```
3706   *
3707   * After an instance has been created it can be accessed globally using `Video('example_video_1')`.
3708   *
3709   * @class
3710   * @extends vjs.Component
3711   */
3712  vjs.Player = vjs.Component.extend({
3713  
3714    /**
3715     * player's constructor function
3716     *
3717     * @constructs
3718     * @method init
3719     * @param {Element} tag        The original video tag used for configuring options
3720     * @param {Object=} options    Player options
3721     * @param {Function=} ready    Ready callback function
3722     */
3723    init: function(tag, options, ready){
3724      this.tag = tag; // Store the original tag used to set options
3725  
3726      // Make sure tag ID exists
3727      tag.id = tag.id || 'vjs_video_' + vjs.guid++;
3728  
3729      // Store the tag attributes used to restore html5 element
3730      this.tagAttributes = tag && vjs.getElementAttributes(tag);
3731  
3732      // Set Options
3733      // The options argument overrides options set in the video tag
3734      // which overrides globally set options.
3735      // This latter part coincides with the load order
3736      // (tag must exist before Player)
3737      options = vjs.obj.merge(this.getTagSettings(tag), options);
3738  
3739      // Update Current Language
3740      this.language_ = options['language'] || vjs.options['language'];
3741  
3742      // Update Supported Languages
3743      this.languages_ = options['languages'] || vjs.options['languages'];
3744  
3745      // Cache for video property values.
3746      this.cache_ = {};
3747  
3748      // Set poster
3749      this.poster_ = options['poster'] || '';
3750  
3751      // Set controls
3752      this.controls_ = !!options['controls'];
3753      // Original tag settings stored in options
3754      // now remove immediately so native controls don't flash.
3755      // May be turned back on by HTML5 tech if nativeControlsForTouch is true
3756      tag.controls = false;
3757  
3758      // we don't want the player to report touch activity on itself
3759      // see enableTouchActivity in Component
3760      options.reportTouchActivity = false;
3761  
3762      // Set isAudio based on whether or not an audio tag was used
3763      this.isAudio(this.tag.nodeName.toLowerCase() === 'audio');
3764  
3765      // Run base component initializing with new options.
3766      // Builds the element through createEl()
3767      // Inits and embeds any child components in opts
3768      vjs.Component.call(this, this, options, ready);
3769  
3770      // Update controls className. Can't do this when the controls are initially
3771      // set because the element doesn't exist yet.
3772      if (this.controls()) {
3773        this.addClass('vjs-controls-enabled');
3774      } else {
3775        this.addClass('vjs-controls-disabled');
3776      }
3777  
3778      if (this.isAudio()) {
3779        this.addClass('vjs-audio');
3780      }
3781  
3782      // TODO: Make this smarter. Toggle user state between touching/mousing
3783      // using events, since devices can have both touch and mouse events.
3784      // if (vjs.TOUCH_ENABLED) {
3785      //   this.addClass('vjs-touch-enabled');
3786      // }
3787  
3788      // Make player easily findable by ID
3789      vjs.players[this.id_] = this;
3790  
3791      if (options['plugins']) {
3792        vjs.obj.each(options['plugins'], function(key, val){
3793          this[key](val);
3794        }, this);
3795      }
3796  
3797      this.listenForUserActivity();
3798    }
3799  });
3800  
3801  /**
3802   * The player's stored language code
3803   *
3804   * @type {String}
3805   * @private
3806   */
3807  vjs.Player.prototype.language_;
3808  
3809  /**
3810   * The player's language code
3811   * @param  {String} languageCode  The locale string
3812   * @return {String}             The locale string when getting
3813   * @return {vjs.Player}         self, when setting
3814   */
3815  vjs.Player.prototype.language = function (languageCode) {
3816    if (languageCode === undefined) {
3817      return this.language_;
3818    }
3819  
3820    this.language_ = languageCode;
3821    return this;
3822  };
3823  
3824  /**
3825   * The player's stored language dictionary
3826   *
3827   * @type {Object}
3828   * @private
3829   */
3830  vjs.Player.prototype.languages_;
3831  
3832  vjs.Player.prototype.languages = function(){
3833    return this.languages_;
3834  };
3835  
3836  /**
3837   * Player instance options, surfaced using vjs.options
3838   * vjs.options = vjs.Player.prototype.options_
3839   * Make changes in vjs.options, not here.
3840   * All options should use string keys so they avoid
3841   * renaming by closure compiler
3842   * @type {Object}
3843   * @private
3844   */
3845  vjs.Player.prototype.options_ = vjs.options;
3846  
3847  /**
3848   * Destroys the video player and does any necessary cleanup
3849   *
3850   *     myPlayer.dispose();
3851   *
3852   * This is especially helpful if you are dynamically adding and removing videos
3853   * to/from the DOM.
3854   */
3855  vjs.Player.prototype.dispose = function(){
3856    this.trigger('dispose');
3857    // prevent dispose from being called twice
3858    this.off('dispose');
3859  
3860    // Kill reference to this player
3861    vjs.players[this.id_] = null;
3862    if (this.tag && this.tag['player']) { this.tag['player'] = null; }
3863    if (this.el_ && this.el_['player']) { this.el_['player'] = null; }
3864  
3865    if (this.tech) { this.tech.dispose(); }
3866  
3867    // Component dispose
3868    vjs.Component.prototype.dispose.call(this);
3869  };
3870  
3871  vjs.Player.prototype.getTagSettings = function(tag){
3872    var tagOptions,
3873        dataSetup,
3874        options = {
3875          'sources': [],
3876          'tracks': []
3877        };
3878  
3879    tagOptions = vjs.getElementAttributes(tag);
3880    dataSetup = tagOptions['data-setup'];
3881  
3882    // Check if data-setup attr exists.
3883    if (dataSetup !== null){
3884      // Parse options JSON
3885      // If empty string, make it a parsable json object.
3886      vjs.obj.merge(tagOptions, vjs.JSON.parse(dataSetup || '{}'));
3887    }
3888  
3889    vjs.obj.merge(options, tagOptions);
3890  
3891    // Get tag children settings
3892    if (tag.hasChildNodes()) {
3893      var children, child, childName, i, j;
3894  
3895      children = tag.childNodes;
3896  
3897      for (i=0,j=children.length; i<j; i++) {
3898        child = children[i];
3899        // Change case needed: http://ejohn.org/blog/nodename-case-sensitivity/
3900        childName = child.nodeName.toLowerCase();
3901        if (childName === 'source') {
3902          options['sources'].push(vjs.getElementAttributes(child));
3903        } else if (childName === 'track') {
3904          options['tracks'].push(vjs.getElementAttributes(child));
3905        }
3906      }
3907    }
3908  
3909    return options;
3910  };
3911  
3912  vjs.Player.prototype.createEl = function(){
3913    var
3914      el = this.el_ = vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div'),
3915      tag = this.tag,
3916      attrs;
3917  
3918    // Remove width/height attrs from tag so CSS can make it 100% width/height
3919    tag.removeAttribute('width');
3920    tag.removeAttribute('height');
3921  
3922    // Copy over all the attributes from the tag, including ID and class
3923    // ID will now reference player box, not the video tag
3924    attrs = vjs.getElementAttributes(tag);
3925    vjs.obj.each(attrs, function(attr) {
3926      // workaround so we don't totally break IE7
3927      // http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3653444/css-styles-not-applied-on-dynamic-elements-in-internet-explorer-7
3928      if (attr == 'class') {
3929        el.className = attrs[attr];
3930      } else {
3931        el.setAttribute(attr, attrs[attr]);
3932      }
3933    });
3934  
3935    // Update tag id/class for use as HTML5 playback tech
3936    // Might think we should do this after embedding in container so .vjs-tech class
3937    // doesn't flash 100% width/height, but class only applies with .video-js parent
3938    tag.id += '_html5_api';
3939    tag.className = 'vjs-tech';
3940  
3941    // Make player findable on elements
3942    tag['player'] = el['player'] = this;
3943    // Default state of video is paused
3944    this.addClass('vjs-paused');
3945  
3946    // Make box use width/height of tag, or rely on default implementation
3947    // Enforce with CSS since width/height attrs don't work on divs
3948    this.width(this.options_['width'], true); // (true) Skip resize listener on load
3949    this.height(this.options_['height'], true);
3950  
3951    // vjs.insertFirst seems to cause the networkState to flicker from 3 to 2, so
3952    // keep track of the original for later so we can know if the source originally failed
3953    tag.initNetworkState_ = tag.networkState;
3954  
3955    // Wrap video tag in div (el/box) container
3956    if (tag.parentNode) {
3957      tag.parentNode.insertBefore(el, tag);
3958    }
3959    vjs.insertFirst(tag, el); // Breaks iPhone, fixed in HTML5 setup.
3960  
3961    // The event listeners need to be added before the children are added
3962    // in the component init because the tech (loaded with mediaLoader) may
3963    // fire events, like loadstart, that these events need to capture.
3964    // Long term it might be better to expose a way to do this in component.init
3965    // like component.initEventListeners() that runs between el creation and
3966    // adding children
3967    this.el_ = el;
3968    this.on('loadstart', this.onLoadStart);
3969    this.on('waiting', this.onWaiting);
3970    this.on(['canplay', 'canplaythrough', 'playing', 'ended'], this.onWaitEnd);
3971    this.on('seeking', this.onSeeking);
3972    this.on('seeked', this.onSeeked);
3973    this.on('ended', this.onEnded);
3974    this.on('play', this.onPlay);
3975    this.on('firstplay', this.onFirstPlay);
3976    this.on('pause', this.onPause);
3977    this.on('progress', this.onProgress);
3978    this.on('durationchange', this.onDurationChange);
3979    this.on('fullscreenchange', this.onFullscreenChange);
3980  
3981    return el;
3982  };
3983  
3984  // /* Media Technology (tech)
3985  // ================================================================================ */
3986  // Load/Create an instance of playback technology including element and API methods
3987  // And append playback element in player div.
3988  vjs.Player.prototype.loadTech = function(techName, source){
3989  
3990    // Pause and remove current playback technology
3991    if (this.tech) {
3992      this.unloadTech();
3993    }
3994  
3995    // get rid of the HTML5 video tag as soon as we are using another tech
3996    if (techName !== 'Html5' && this.tag) {
3997      vjs.Html5.disposeMediaElement(this.tag);
3998      this.tag = null;
3999    }
4000  
4001    this.techName = techName;
4002  
4003    // Turn off API access because we're loading a new tech that might load asynchronously
4004    this.isReady_ = false;
4005  
4006    var techReady = function(){
4007      this.player_.triggerReady();
4008    };
4009  
4010    // Grab tech-specific options from player options and add source and parent element to use.
4011    var techOptions = vjs.obj.merge({ 'source': source, 'parentEl': this.el_ }, this.options_[techName.toLowerCase()]);
4012  
4013    if (source) {
4014      this.currentType_ = source.type;
4015      if (source.src == this.cache_.src && this.cache_.currentTime > 0) {
4016        techOptions['startTime'] = this.cache_.currentTime;
4017      }
4018  
4019      this.cache_.src = source.src;
4020    }
4021  
4022    // Initialize tech instance
4023    this.tech = new window['videojs'][techName](this, techOptions);
4024  
4025    this.tech.ready(techReady);
4026  };
4027  
4028  vjs.Player.prototype.unloadTech = function(){
4029    this.isReady_ = false;
4030  
4031    this.tech.dispose();
4032  
4033    this.tech = false;
4034  };
4035  
4036  // There's many issues around changing the size of a Flash (or other plugin) object.
4037  // First is a plugin reload issue in Firefox that has been around for 11 years: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=90268
4038  // Then with the new fullscreen API, Mozilla and webkit browsers will reload the flash object after going to fullscreen.
4039  // To get around this, we're unloading the tech, caching source and currentTime values, and reloading the tech once the plugin is resized.
4040  // reloadTech: function(betweenFn){
4041  //   vjs.log('unloadingTech')
4042  //   this.unloadTech();
4043  //   vjs.log('unloadedTech')
4044  //   if (betweenFn) { betweenFn.call(); }
4045  //   vjs.log('LoadingTech')
4046  //   this.loadTech(this.techName, { src: this.cache_.src })
4047  //   vjs.log('loadedTech')
4048  // },
4049  
4050  // /* Player event handlers (how the player reacts to certain events)
4051  // ================================================================================ */
4052  
4053  /**
4054   * Fired when the user agent begins looking for media data
4055   * @event loadstart
4056   */
4057  vjs.Player.prototype.onLoadStart = function() {
4058    // TODO: Update to use `emptied` event instead. See #1277.
4059  
4060    this.removeClass('vjs-ended');
4061  
4062    // reset the error state
4063    this.error(null);
4064  
4065    // If it's already playing we want to trigger a firstplay event now.
4066    // The firstplay event relies on both the play and loadstart events
4067    // which can happen in any order for a new source
4068    if (!this.paused()) {
4069      this.trigger('firstplay');
4070    } else {
4071      // reset the hasStarted state
4072      this.hasStarted(false);
4073    }
4074  };
4075  
4076  vjs.Player.prototype.hasStarted_ = false;
4077  
4078  vjs.Player.prototype.hasStarted = function(hasStarted){
4079    if (hasStarted !== undefined) {
4080      // only update if this is a new value
4081      if (this.hasStarted_ !== hasStarted) {
4082        this.hasStarted_ = hasStarted;
4083        if (hasStarted) {
4084          this.addClass('vjs-has-started');
4085          // trigger the firstplay event if this newly has played
4086          this.trigger('firstplay');
4087        } else {
4088          this.removeClass('vjs-has-started');
4089        }
4090      }
4091      return this;
4092    }
4093    return this.hasStarted_;
4094  };
4095  
4096  /**
4097   * Fired when the player has initial duration and dimension information
4098   * @event loadedmetadata
4099   */
4100  vjs.Player.prototype.onLoadedMetaData;
4101  
4102  /**
4103   * Fired when the player has downloaded data at the current playback position
4104   * @event loadeddata
4105   */
4106  vjs.Player.prototype.onLoadedData;
4107  
4108  /**
4109   * Fired when the player has finished downloading the source data
4110   * @event loadedalldata
4111   */
4112  vjs.Player.prototype.onLoadedAllData;
4113  
4114  /**
4115   * Fired whenever the media begins or resumes playback
4116   * @event play
4117   */
4118  vjs.Player.prototype.onPlay = function(){
4119    this.removeClass('vjs-ended');
4120    this.removeClass('vjs-paused');
4121    this.addClass('vjs-playing');
4122  
4123    // hide the poster when the user hits play
4124    // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/embedded-content.html#dom-media-play
4125    this.hasStarted(true);
4126  };
4127  
4128  /**
4129   * Fired whenever the media begins waiting
4130   * @event waiting
4131   */
4132  vjs.Player.prototype.onWaiting = function(){
4133    this.addClass('vjs-waiting');
4134  };
4135  
4136  /**
4137   * A handler for events that signal that waiting has ended
4138   * which is not consistent between browsers. See #1351
4139   * @private
4140   */
4141  vjs.Player.prototype.onWaitEnd = function(){
4142    this.removeClass('vjs-waiting');
4143  };
4144  
4145  /**
4146   * Fired whenever the player is jumping to a new time
4147   * @event seeking
4148   */
4149  vjs.Player.prototype.onSeeking = function(){
4150    this.addClass('vjs-seeking');
4151  };
4152  
4153  /**
4154   * Fired when the player has finished jumping to a new time
4155   * @event seeked
4156   */
4157  vjs.Player.prototype.onSeeked = function(){
4158    this.removeClass('vjs-seeking');
4159  };
4160  
4161  /**
4162   * Fired the first time a video is played
4163   *
4164   * Not part of the HLS spec, and we're not sure if this is the best
4165   * implementation yet, so use sparingly. If you don't have a reason to
4166   * prevent playback, use `myPlayer.one('play');` instead.
4167   *
4168   * @event firstplay
4169   */
4170  vjs.Player.prototype.onFirstPlay = function(){
4171      //If the first starttime attribute is specified
4172      //then we will start at the given offset in seconds
4173      if(this.options_['starttime']){
4174        this.currentTime(this.options_['starttime']);
4175      }
4176  
4177      this.addClass('vjs-has-started');
4178  };
4179  
4180  /**
4181   * Fired whenever the media has been paused
4182   * @event pause
4183   */
4184  vjs.Player.prototype.onPause = function(){
4185    this.removeClass('vjs-playing');
4186    this.addClass('vjs-paused');
4187  };
4188  
4189  /**
4190   * Fired when the current playback position has changed
4191   *
4192   * During playback this is fired every 15-250 milliseconds, depending on the
4193   * playback technology in use.
4194   * @event timeupdate
4195   */
4196  vjs.Player.prototype.onTimeUpdate;
4197  
4198  /**
4199   * Fired while the user agent is downloading media data
4200   * @event progress
4201   */
4202  vjs.Player.prototype.onProgress = function(){
4203    // Add custom event for when source is finished downloading.
4204    if (this.bufferedPercent() == 1) {
4205      this.trigger('loadedalldata');
4206    }
4207  };
4208  
4209  /**
4210   * Fired when the end of the media resource is reached (currentTime == duration)
4211   * @event ended
4212   */
4213  vjs.Player.prototype.onEnded = function(){
4214    this.addClass('vjs-ended');
4215    if (this.options_['loop']) {
4216      this.currentTime(0);
4217      this.play();
4218    } else if (!this.paused()) {
4219      this.pause();
4220    }
4221  };
4222  
4223  /**
4224   * Fired when the duration of the media resource is first known or changed
4225   * @event durationchange
4226   */
4227  vjs.Player.prototype.onDurationChange = function(){
4228    // Allows for caching value instead of asking player each time.
4229    // We need to get the techGet response and check for a value so we don't
4230    // accidentally cause the stack to blow up.
4231    var duration = this.techGet('duration');
4232    if (duration) {
4233      if (duration < 0) {
4234        duration = Infinity;
4235      }
4236      this.duration(duration);
4237      // Determine if the stream is live and propagate styles down to UI.
4238      if (duration === Infinity) {
4239        this.addClass('vjs-live');
4240      } else {
4241        this.removeClass('vjs-live');
4242      }
4243    }
4244  };
4245  
4246  /**
4247   * Fired when the volume changes
4248   * @event volumechange
4249   */
4250  vjs.Player.prototype.onVolumeChange;
4251  
4252  /**
4253   * Fired when the player switches in or out of fullscreen mode
4254   * @event fullscreenchange
4255   */
4256  vjs.Player.prototype.onFullscreenChange = function() {
4257    if (this.isFullscreen()) {
4258      this.addClass('vjs-fullscreen');
4259    } else {
4260      this.removeClass('vjs-fullscreen');
4261    }
4262  };
4263  
4264  /**
4265   * Fired when an error occurs
4266   * @event error
4267   */
4268  vjs.Player.prototype.onError;
4269  
4270  // /* Player API
4271  // ================================================================================ */
4272  
4273  /**
4274   * Object for cached values.
4275   * @private
4276   */
4277  vjs.Player.prototype.cache_;
4278  
4279  vjs.Player.prototype.getCache = function(){
4280    return this.cache_;
4281  };
4282  
4283  // Pass values to the playback tech
4284  vjs.Player.prototype.techCall = function(method, arg){
4285    // If it's not ready yet, call method when it is
4286    if (this.tech && !this.tech.isReady_) {
4287      this.tech.ready(function(){
4288        this[method](arg);
4289      });
4290  
4291    // Otherwise call method now
4292    } else {
4293      try {
4294        this.tech[method](arg);
4295      } catch(e) {
4296        vjs.log(e);
4297        throw e;
4298      }
4299    }
4300  };
4301  
4302  // Get calls can't wait for the tech, and sometimes don't need to.
4303  vjs.Player.prototype.techGet = function(method){
4304    if (this.tech && this.tech.isReady_) {
4305  
4306      // Flash likes to die and reload when you hide or reposition it.
4307      // In these cases the object methods go away and we get errors.
4308      // When that happens we'll catch the errors and inform tech that it's not ready any more.
4309      try {
4310        return this.tech[method]();
4311      } catch(e) {
4312        // When building additional tech libs, an expected method may not be defined yet
4313        if (this.tech[method] === undefined) {
4314          vjs.log('Video.js: ' + method + ' method not defined for '+this.techName+' playback technology.', e);
4315        } else {
4316          // When a method isn't available on the object it throws a TypeError
4317          if (e.name == 'TypeError') {
4318            vjs.log('Video.js: ' + method + ' unavailable on '+this.techName+' playback technology element.', e);
4319            this.tech.isReady_ = false;
4320          } else {
4321            vjs.log(e);
4322          }
4323        }
4324        throw e;
4325      }
4326    }
4327  
4328    return;
4329  };
4330  
4331  /**
4332   * start media playback
4333   *
4334   *     myPlayer.play();
4335   *
4336   * @return {vjs.Player} self
4337   */
4338  vjs.Player.prototype.play = function(){
4339    this.techCall('play');
4340    return this;
4341  };
4342  
4343  /**
4344   * Pause the video playback
4345   *
4346   *     myPlayer.pause();
4347   *
4348   * @return {vjs.Player} self
4349   */
4350  vjs.Player.prototype.pause = function(){
4351    this.techCall('pause');
4352    return this;
4353  };
4354  
4355  /**
4356   * Check if the player is paused
4357   *
4358   *     var isPaused = myPlayer.paused();
4359   *     var isPlaying = !myPlayer.paused();
4360   *
4361   * @return {Boolean} false if the media is currently playing, or true otherwise
4362   */
4363  vjs.Player.prototype.paused = function(){
4364    // The initial state of paused should be true (in Safari it's actually false)
4365    return (this.techGet('paused') === false) ? false : true;
4366  };
4367  
4368  /**
4369   * Get or set the current time (in seconds)
4370   *
4371   *     // get
4372   *     var whereYouAt = myPlayer.currentTime();
4373   *
4374   *     // set
4375   *     myPlayer.currentTime(120); // 2 minutes into the video
4376   *
4377   * @param  {Number|String=} seconds The time to seek to
4378   * @return {Number}        The time in seconds, when not setting
4379   * @return {vjs.Player}    self, when the current time is set
4380   */
4381  vjs.Player.prototype.currentTime = function(seconds){
4382    if (seconds !== undefined) {
4383  
4384      this.techCall('setCurrentTime', seconds);
4385  
4386      return this;
4387    }
4388  
4389    // cache last currentTime and return. default to 0 seconds
4390    //
4391    // Caching the currentTime is meant to prevent a massive amount of reads on the tech's
4392    // currentTime when scrubbing, but may not provide much performance benefit afterall.
4393    // Should be tested. Also something has to read the actual current time or the cache will
4394    // never get updated.
4395    return this.cache_.currentTime = (this.techGet('currentTime') || 0);
4396  };
4397  
4398  /**
4399   * Get the length in time of the video in seconds
4400   *
4401   *     var lengthOfVideo = myPlayer.duration();
4402   *
4403   * **NOTE**: The video must have started loading before the duration can be
4404   * known, and in the case of Flash, may not be known until the video starts
4405   * playing.
4406   *
4407   * @return {Number} The duration of the video in seconds
4408   */
4409  vjs.Player.prototype.duration = function(seconds){
4410    if (seconds !== undefined) {
4411  
4412      // cache the last set value for optimized scrubbing (esp. Flash)
4413      this.cache_.duration = parseFloat(seconds);
4414  
4415      return this;
4416    }
4417  
4418    if (this.cache_.duration === undefined) {
4419      this.onDurationChange();
4420    }
4421  
4422    return this.cache_.duration || 0;
4423  };
4424  
4425  /**
4426   * Calculates how much time is left.
4427   *
4428   *     var timeLeft = myPlayer.remainingTime();
4429   *
4430   * Not a native video element function, but useful
4431   * @return {Number} The time remaining in seconds
4432   */
4433  vjs.Player.prototype.remainingTime = function(){
4434    return this.duration() - this.currentTime();
4435  };
4436  
4437  // http://dev.w3.org/html5/spec/video.html#dom-media-buffered
4438  // Buffered returns a timerange object.
4439  // Kind of like an array of portions of the video that have been downloaded.
4440  
4441  /**
4442   * Get a TimeRange object with the times of the video that have been downloaded
4443   *
4444   * If you just want the percent of the video that's been downloaded,
4445   * use bufferedPercent.
4446   *
4447   *     // Number of different ranges of time have been buffered. Usually 1.
4448   *     numberOfRanges = bufferedTimeRange.length,
4449   *
4450   *     // Time in seconds when the first range starts. Usually 0.
4451   *     firstRangeStart = bufferedTimeRange.start(0),
4452   *
4453   *     // Time in seconds when the first range ends
4454   *     firstRangeEnd = bufferedTimeRange.end(0),
4455   *
4456   *     // Length in seconds of the first time range
4457   *     firstRangeLength = firstRangeEnd - firstRangeStart;
4458   *
4459   * @return {Object} A mock TimeRange object (following HTML spec)
4460   */
4461  vjs.Player.prototype.buffered = function(){
4462    var buffered = this.techGet('buffered');
4463  
4464    if (!buffered || !buffered.length) {
4465      buffered = vjs.createTimeRange(0,0);
4466    }
4467  
4468    return buffered;
4469  };
4470  
4471  /**
4472   * Get the percent (as a decimal) of the video that's been downloaded
4473   *
4474   *     var howMuchIsDownloaded = myPlayer.bufferedPercent();
4475   *
4476   * 0 means none, 1 means all.
4477   * (This method isn't in the HTML5 spec, but it's very convenient)
4478   *
4479   * @return {Number} A decimal between 0 and 1 representing the percent
4480   */
4481  vjs.Player.prototype.bufferedPercent = function(){
4482    var duration = this.duration(),
4483        buffered = this.buffered(),
4484        bufferedDuration = 0,
4485        start, end;
4486  
4487    if (!duration) {
4488      return 0;
4489    }
4490  
4491    for (var i=0; i<buffered.length; i++){
4492      start = buffered.start(i);
4493      end   = buffered.end(i);
4494  
4495      // buffered end can be bigger than duration by a very small fraction
4496      if (end > duration) {
4497        end = duration;
4498      }
4499  
4500      bufferedDuration += end - start;
4501    }
4502  
4503    return bufferedDuration / duration;
4504  };
4505  
4506  /**
4507   * Get the ending time of the last buffered time range
4508   *
4509   * This is used in the progress bar to encapsulate all time ranges.
4510   * @return {Number} The end of the last buffered time range
4511   */
4512  vjs.Player.prototype.bufferedEnd = function(){
4513    var buffered = this.buffered(),
4514        duration = this.duration(),
4515        end = buffered.end(buffered.length-1);
4516  
4517    if (end > duration) {
4518      end = duration;
4519    }
4520  
4521    return end;
4522  };
4523  
4524  /**
4525   * Get or set the current volume of the media
4526   *
4527   *     // get
4528   *     var howLoudIsIt = myPlayer.volume();
4529   *
4530   *     // set
4531   *     myPlayer.volume(0.5); // Set volume to half
4532   *
4533   * 0 is off (muted), 1.0 is all the way up, 0.5 is half way.
4534   *
4535   * @param  {Number} percentAsDecimal The new volume as a decimal percent
4536   * @return {Number}                  The current volume, when getting
4537   * @return {vjs.Player}              self, when setting
4538   */
4539  vjs.Player.prototype.volume = function(percentAsDecimal){
4540    var vol;
4541  
4542    if (percentAsDecimal !== undefined) {
4543      vol = Math.max(0, Math.min(1, parseFloat(percentAsDecimal))); // Force value to between 0 and 1
4544      this.cache_.volume = vol;
4545      this.techCall('setVolume', vol);
4546      vjs.setLocalStorage('volume', vol);
4547      return this;
4548    }
4549  
4550    // Default to 1 when returning current volume.
4551    vol = parseFloat(this.techGet('volume'));
4552    return (isNaN(vol)) ? 1 : vol;
4553  };
4554  
4555  
4556  /**
4557   * Get the current muted state, or turn mute on or off
4558   *
4559   *     // get
4560   *     var isVolumeMuted = myPlayer.muted();
4561   *
4562   *     // set
4563   *     myPlayer.muted(true); // mute the volume
4564   *
4565   * @param  {Boolean=} muted True to mute, false to unmute
4566   * @return {Boolean} True if mute is on, false if not, when getting
4567   * @return {vjs.Player} self, when setting mute
4568   */
4569  vjs.Player.prototype.muted = function(muted){
4570    if (muted !== undefined) {
4571      this.techCall('setMuted', muted);
4572      return this;
4573    }
4574    return this.techGet('muted') || false; // Default to false
4575  };
4576  
4577  // Check if current tech can support native fullscreen
4578  // (e.g. with built in controls like iOS, so not our flash swf)
4579  vjs.Player.prototype.supportsFullScreen = function(){
4580    return this.techGet('supportsFullScreen') || false;
4581  };
4582  
4583  /**
4584   * is the player in fullscreen
4585   * @type {Boolean}
4586   * @private
4587   */
