4588  vjs.Player.prototype.isFullscreen_ = false;
4589  
4590  /**
4591   * Check if the player is in fullscreen mode
4592   *
4593   *     // get
4594   *     var fullscreenOrNot = myPlayer.isFullscreen();
4595   *
4596   *     // set
4597   *     myPlayer.isFullscreen(true); // tell the player it's in fullscreen
4598   *
4599   * NOTE: As of the latest HTML5 spec, isFullscreen is no longer an official
4600   * property and instead document.fullscreenElement is used. But isFullscreen is
4601   * still a valuable property for internal player workings.
4602   *
4603   * @param  {Boolean=} isFS Update the player's fullscreen state
4604   * @return {Boolean} true if fullscreen, false if not
4605   * @return {vjs.Player} self, when setting
4606   */
4607  vjs.Player.prototype.isFullscreen = function(isFS){
4608    if (isFS !== undefined) {
4609      this.isFullscreen_ = !!isFS;
4610      return this;
4611    }
4612    return this.isFullscreen_;
4613  };
4614  
4615  /**
4616   * Old naming for isFullscreen()
4617   * @deprecated for lowercase 's' version
4618   */
4619  vjs.Player.prototype.isFullScreen = function(isFS){
4620    vjs.log.warn('player.isFullScreen() has been deprecated, use player.isFullscreen() with a lowercase "s")');
4621    return this.isFullscreen(isFS);
4622  };
4623  
4624  /**
4625   * Increase the size of the video to full screen
4626   *
4627   *     myPlayer.requestFullscreen();
4628   *
4629   * In some browsers, full screen is not supported natively, so it enters
4630   * "full window mode", where the video fills the browser window.
4631   * In browsers and devices that support native full screen, sometimes the
4632   * browser's default controls will be shown, and not the Video.js custom skin.
4633   * This includes most mobile devices (iOS, Android) and older versions of
4634   * Safari.
4635   *
4636   * @return {vjs.Player} self
4637   */
4638  vjs.Player.prototype.requestFullscreen = function(){
4639    var fsApi = vjs.browser.fullscreenAPI;
4640  
4641    this.isFullscreen(true);
4642  
4643    if (fsApi) {
4644      // the browser supports going fullscreen at the element level so we can
4645      // take the controls fullscreen as well as the video
4646  
4647      // Trigger fullscreenchange event after change
4648      // We have to specifically add this each time, and remove
4649      // when canceling fullscreen. Otherwise if there's multiple
4650      // players on a page, they would all be reacting to the same fullscreen
4651      // events
4652      vjs.on(document, fsApi['fullscreenchange'], vjs.bind(this, function(e){
4653        this.isFullscreen(document[fsApi.fullscreenElement]);
4654  
4655        // If cancelling fullscreen, remove event listener.
4656        if (this.isFullscreen() === false) {
4657          vjs.off(document, fsApi['fullscreenchange'], arguments.callee);
4658        }
4659  
4660        this.trigger('fullscreenchange');
4661      }));
4662  
4663      this.el_[fsApi.requestFullscreen]();
4664  
4665    } else if (this.tech.supportsFullScreen()) {
4666      // we can't take the video.js controls fullscreen but we can go fullscreen
4667      // with native controls
4668      this.techCall('enterFullScreen');
4669    } else {
4670      // fullscreen isn't supported so we'll just stretch the video element to
4671      // fill the viewport
4672      this.enterFullWindow();
4673      this.trigger('fullscreenchange');
4674    }
4675  
4676    return this;
4677  };
4678  
4679  /**
4680   * Old naming for requestFullscreen
4681   * @deprecated for lower case 's' version
4682   */
4683  vjs.Player.prototype.requestFullScreen = function(){
4684    vjs.log.warn('player.requestFullScreen() has been deprecated, use player.requestFullscreen() with a lowercase "s")');
4685    return this.requestFullscreen();
4686  };
4687  
4688  
4689  /**
4690   * Return the video to its normal size after having been in full screen mode
4691   *
4692   *     myPlayer.exitFullscreen();
4693   *
4694   * @return {vjs.Player} self
4695   */
4696  vjs.Player.prototype.exitFullscreen = function(){
4697    var fsApi = vjs.browser.fullscreenAPI;
4698    this.isFullscreen(false);
4699  
4700    // Check for browser element fullscreen support
4701    if (fsApi) {
4702      document[fsApi.exitFullscreen]();
4703    } else if (this.tech.supportsFullScreen()) {
4704     this.techCall('exitFullScreen');
4705    } else {
4706     this.exitFullWindow();
4707     this.trigger('fullscreenchange');
4708    }
4709  
4710    return this;
4711  };
4712  
4713  /**
4714   * Old naming for exitFullscreen
4715   * @deprecated for exitFullscreen
4716   */
4717  vjs.Player.prototype.cancelFullScreen = function(){
4718    vjs.log.warn('player.cancelFullScreen() has been deprecated, use player.exitFullscreen()');
4719    return this.exitFullscreen();
4720  };
4721  
4722  // When fullscreen isn't supported we can stretch the video container to as wide as the browser will let us.
4723  vjs.Player.prototype.enterFullWindow = function(){
4724    this.isFullWindow = true;
4725  
4726    // Storing original doc overflow value to return to when fullscreen is off
4727    this.docOrigOverflow = document.documentElement.style.overflow;
4728  
4729    // Add listener for esc key to exit fullscreen
4730    vjs.on(document, 'keydown', vjs.bind(this, this.fullWindowOnEscKey));
4731  
4732    // Hide any scroll bars
4733    document.documentElement.style.overflow = 'hidden';
4734  
4735    // Apply fullscreen styles
4736    vjs.addClass(document.body, 'vjs-full-window');
4737  
4738    this.trigger('enterFullWindow');
4739  };
4740  vjs.Player.prototype.fullWindowOnEscKey = function(event){
4741    if (event.keyCode === 27) {
4742      if (this.isFullscreen() === true) {
4743        this.exitFullscreen();
4744      } else {
4745        this.exitFullWindow();
4746      }
4747    }
4748  };
4749  
4750  vjs.Player.prototype.exitFullWindow = function(){
4751    this.isFullWindow = false;
4752    vjs.off(document, 'keydown', this.fullWindowOnEscKey);
4753  
4754    // Unhide scroll bars.
4755    document.documentElement.style.overflow = this.docOrigOverflow;
4756  
4757    // Remove fullscreen styles
4758    vjs.removeClass(document.body, 'vjs-full-window');
4759  
4760    // Resize the box, controller, and poster to original sizes
4761    // this.positionAll();
4762    this.trigger('exitFullWindow');
4763  };
4764  
4765  vjs.Player.prototype.selectSource = function(sources){
4766    // Loop through each playback technology in the options order
4767    for (var i=0,j=this.options_['techOrder'];i<j.length;i++) {
4768      var techName = vjs.capitalize(j[i]),
4769          tech = window['videojs'][techName];
4770  
4771      // Check if the current tech is defined before continuing
4772      if (!tech) {
4773        vjs.log.error('The "' + techName + '" tech is undefined. Skipped browser support check for that tech.');
4774        continue;
4775      }
4776  
4777      // Check if the browser supports this technology
4778      if (tech.isSupported()) {
4779        // Loop through each source object
4780        for (var a=0,b=sources;a<b.length;a++) {
4781          var source = b[a];
4782  
4783          // Check if source can be played with this technology
4784          if (tech['canPlaySource'](source)) {
4785            return { source: source, tech: techName };
4786          }
4787        }
4788      }
4789    }
4790  
4791    return false;
4792  };
4793  
4794  /**
4795   * The source function updates the video source
4796   *
4797   * There are three types of variables you can pass as the argument.
4798   *
4799   * **URL String**: A URL to the the video file. Use this method if you are sure
4800   * the current playback technology (HTML5/Flash) can support the source you
4801   * provide. Currently only MP4 files can be used in both HTML5 and Flash.
4802   *
4803   *     myPlayer.src("http://www.example.com/path/to/video.mp4");
4804   *
4805   * **Source Object (or element):** A javascript object containing information
4806   * about the source file. Use this method if you want the player to determine if
4807   * it can support the file using the type information.
4808   *
4809   *     myPlayer.src({ type: "video/mp4", src: "http://www.example.com/path/to/video.mp4" });
4810   *
4811   * **Array of Source Objects:** To provide multiple versions of the source so
4812   * that it can be played using HTML5 across browsers you can use an array of
4813   * source objects. Video.js will detect which version is supported and load that
4814   * file.
4815   *
4816   *     myPlayer.src([
4817   *       { type: "video/mp4", src: "http://www.example.com/path/to/video.mp4" },
4818   *       { type: "video/webm", src: "http://www.example.com/path/to/video.webm" },
4819   *       { type: "video/ogg", src: "http://www.example.com/path/to/video.ogv" }
4820   *     ]);
4821   *
4822   * @param  {String|Object|Array=} source The source URL, object, or array of sources
4823   * @return {String} The current video source when getting
4824   * @return {String} The player when setting
4825   */
4826  vjs.Player.prototype.src = function(source){
4827    if (source === undefined) {
4828      return this.techGet('src');
4829    }
4830  
4831    // case: Array of source objects to choose from and pick the best to play
4832    if (vjs.obj.isArray(source)) {
4833      this.sourceList_(source);
4834  
4835    // case: URL String (http://myvideo...)
4836    } else if (typeof source === 'string') {
4837      // create a source object from the string
4838      this.src({ src: source });
4839  
4840    // case: Source object { src: '', type: '' ... }
4841    } else if (source instanceof Object) {
4842      // check if the source has a type and the loaded tech cannot play the source
4843      // if there's no type we'll just try the current tech
4844      if (source.type && !window['videojs'][this.techName]['canPlaySource'](source)) {
4845        // create a source list with the current source and send through
4846        // the tech loop to check for a compatible technology
4847        this.sourceList_([source]);
4848      } else {
4849        this.cache_.src = source.src;
4850        this.currentType_ = source.type || '';
4851  
4852        // wait until the tech is ready to set the source
4853        this.ready(function(){
4854  
4855          // The setSource tech method was added with source handlers
4856          // so older techs won't support it
4857          // We need to check the direct prototype for the case where subclasses
4858          // of the tech do not support source handlers
4859          if (window['videojs'][this.techName].prototype.hasOwnProperty('setSource')) {
4860            this.techCall('setSource', source);
4861          } else {
4862            this.techCall('src', source.src);
4863          }
4864  
4865          if (this.options_['preload'] == 'auto') {
4866            this.load();
4867          }
4868  
4869          if (this.options_['autoplay']) {
4870            this.play();
4871          }
4872        });
4873      }
4874    }
4875  
4876    return this;
4877  };
4878  
4879  /**
4880   * Handle an array of source objects
4881   * @param  {[type]} sources Array of source objects
4882   * @private
4883   */
4884  vjs.Player.prototype.sourceList_ = function(sources){
4885    var sourceTech = this.selectSource(sources);
4886  
4887    if (sourceTech) {
4888      if (sourceTech.tech === this.techName) {
4889        // if this technology is already loaded, set the source
4890        this.src(sourceTech.source);
4891      } else {
4892        // load this technology with the chosen source
4893        this.loadTech(sourceTech.tech, sourceTech.source);
4894      }
4895    } else {
4896      // We need to wrap this in a timeout to give folks a chance to add error event handlers
4897      this.setTimeout( function() {
4898        this.error({ code: 4, message: this.localize(this.options()['notSupportedMessage']) });
4899      }, 0);
4900  
4901      // we could not find an appropriate tech, but let's still notify the delegate that this is it
4902      // this needs a better comment about why this is needed
4903      this.triggerReady();
4904    }
4905  };
4906  
4907  /**
4908   * Begin loading the src data.
4909   * @return {vjs.Player} Returns the player
4910   */
4911  vjs.Player.prototype.load = function(){
4912    this.techCall('load');
4913    return this;
4914  };
4915  
4916  /**
4917   * Returns the fully qualified URL of the current source value e.g. http://mysite.com/video.mp4
4918   * Can be used in conjuction with `currentType` to assist in rebuilding the current source object.
4919   * @return {String} The current source
4920   */
4921  vjs.Player.prototype.currentSrc = function(){
4922    return this.techGet('currentSrc') || this.cache_.src || '';
4923  };
4924  
4925  /**
4926   * Get the current source type e.g. video/mp4
4927   * This can allow you rebuild the current source object so that you could load the same
4928   * source and tech later
4929   * @return {String} The source MIME type
4930   */
4931  vjs.Player.prototype.currentType = function(){
4932      return this.currentType_ || '';
4933  };
4934  
4935  /**
4936   * Get or set the preload attribute.
4937   * @return {String} The preload attribute value when getting
4938   * @return {vjs.Player} Returns the player when setting
4939   */
4940  vjs.Player.prototype.preload = function(value){
4941    if (value !== undefined) {
4942      this.techCall('setPreload', value);
4943      this.options_['preload'] = value;
4944      return this;
4945    }
4946    return this.techGet('preload');
4947  };
4948  
4949  /**
4950   * Get or set the autoplay attribute.
4951   * @return {String} The autoplay attribute value when getting
4952   * @return {vjs.Player} Returns the player when setting
4953   */
4954  vjs.Player.prototype.autoplay = function(value){
4955    if (value !== undefined) {
4956      this.techCall('setAutoplay', value);
4957      this.options_['autoplay'] = value;
4958      return this;
4959    }
4960    return this.techGet('autoplay', value);
4961  };
4962  
4963  /**
4964   * Get or set the loop attribute on the video element.
4965   * @return {String} The loop attribute value when getting
4966   * @return {vjs.Player} Returns the player when setting
4967   */
4968  vjs.Player.prototype.loop = function(value){
4969    if (value !== undefined) {
4970      this.techCall('setLoop', value);
4971      this.options_['loop'] = value;
4972      return this;
4973    }
4974    return this.techGet('loop');
4975  };
4976  
4977  /**
4978   * the url of the poster image source
4979   * @type {String}
4980   * @private
4981   */
4982  vjs.Player.prototype.poster_;
4983  
4984  /**
4985   * get or set the poster image source url
4986   *
4987   * ##### EXAMPLE:
4988   *
4989   *     // getting
4990   *     var currentPoster = myPlayer.poster();
4991   *
4992   *     // setting
4993   *     myPlayer.poster('http://example.com/myImage.jpg');
4994   *
4995   * @param  {String=} [src] Poster image source URL
4996   * @return {String} poster URL when getting
4997   * @return {vjs.Player} self when setting
4998   */
4999  vjs.Player.prototype.poster = function(src){
5000    if (src === undefined) {
5001      return this.poster_;
5002    }
5003  
5004    // The correct way to remove a poster is to set as an empty string
5005    // other falsey values will throw errors
5006    if (!src) {
5007      src = '';
5008    }
5009  
5010    // update the internal poster variable
5011    this.poster_ = src;
5012  
5013    // update the tech's poster
5014    this.techCall('setPoster', src);
5015  
5016    // alert components that the poster has been set
5017    this.trigger('posterchange');
5018  
5019    return this;
5020  };
5021  
5022  /**
5023   * Whether or not the controls are showing
5024   * @type {Boolean}
5025   * @private
5026   */
5027  vjs.Player.prototype.controls_;
5028  
5029  /**
5030   * Get or set whether or not the controls are showing.
5031   * @param  {Boolean} controls Set controls to showing or not
5032   * @return {Boolean}    Controls are showing
5033   */
5034  vjs.Player.prototype.controls = function(bool){
5035    if (bool !== undefined) {
5036      bool = !!bool; // force boolean
5037      // Don't trigger a change event unless it actually changed
5038      if (this.controls_ !== bool) {
5039        this.controls_ = bool;
5040        if (bool) {
5041          this.removeClass('vjs-controls-disabled');
5042          this.addClass('vjs-controls-enabled');
5043          this.trigger('controlsenabled');
5044        } else {
5045          this.removeClass('vjs-controls-enabled');
5046          this.addClass('vjs-controls-disabled');
5047          this.trigger('controlsdisabled');
5048        }
5049      }
5050      return this;
5051    }
5052    return this.controls_;
5053  };
5054  
5055  vjs.Player.prototype.usingNativeControls_;
5056  
5057  /**
5058   * Toggle native controls on/off. Native controls are the controls built into
5059   * devices (e.g. default iPhone controls), Flash, or other techs
5060   * (e.g. Vimeo Controls)
5061   *
5062   * **This should only be set by the current tech, because only the tech knows
5063   * if it can support native controls**
5064   *
5065   * @param  {Boolean} bool    True signals that native controls are on
5066   * @return {vjs.Player}      Returns the player
5067   * @private
5068   */
5069  vjs.Player.prototype.usingNativeControls = function(bool){
5070    if (bool !== undefined) {
5071      bool = !!bool; // force boolean
5072      // Don't trigger a change event unless it actually changed
5073      if (this.usingNativeControls_ !== bool) {
5074        this.usingNativeControls_ = bool;
5075        if (bool) {
5076          this.addClass('vjs-using-native-controls');
5077  
5078          /**
5079           * player is using the native device controls
5080           *
5081           * @event usingnativecontrols
5082           * @memberof vjs.Player
5083           * @instance
5084           * @private
5085           */
5086          this.trigger('usingnativecontrols');
5087        } else {
5088          this.removeClass('vjs-using-native-controls');
5089  
5090          /**
5091           * player is using the custom HTML controls
5092           *
5093           * @event usingcustomcontrols
5094           * @memberof vjs.Player
5095           * @instance
5096           * @private
5097           */
5098          this.trigger('usingcustomcontrols');
5099        }
5100      }
5101      return this;
5102    }
5103    return this.usingNativeControls_;
5104  };
5105  
5106  /**
5107   * Store the current media error
5108   * @type {Object}
5109   * @private
5110   */
5111  vjs.Player.prototype.error_ = null;
5112  
5113  /**
5114   * Set or get the current MediaError
5115   * @param  {*} err A MediaError or a String/Number to be turned into a MediaError
5116   * @return {vjs.MediaError|null}     when getting
5117   * @return {vjs.Player}              when setting
5118   */
5119  vjs.Player.prototype.error = function(err){
5120    if (err === undefined) {
5121      return this.error_;
5122    }
5123  
5124    // restoring to default
5125    if (err === null) {
5126      this.error_ = err;
5127      this.removeClass('vjs-error');
5128      return this;
5129    }
5130  
5131    // error instance
5132    if (err instanceof vjs.MediaError) {
5133      this.error_ = err;
5134    } else {
5135      this.error_ = new vjs.MediaError(err);
5136    }
5137  
5138    // fire an error event on the player
5139    this.trigger('error');
5140  
5141    // add the vjs-error classname to the player
5142    this.addClass('vjs-error');
5143  
5144    // log the name of the error type and any message
5145    // ie8 just logs "[object object]" if you just log the error object
5146    vjs.log.error('(CODE:'+this.error_.code+' '+vjs.MediaError.errorTypes[this.error_.code]+')', this.error_.message, this.error_);
5147  
5148    return this;
5149  };
5150  
5151  /**
5152   * Returns whether or not the player is in the "ended" state.
5153   * @return {Boolean} True if the player is in the ended state, false if not.
5154   */
5155  vjs.Player.prototype.ended = function(){ return this.techGet('ended'); };
5156  
5157  /**
5158   * Returns whether or not the player is in the "seeking" state.
5159   * @return {Boolean} True if the player is in the seeking state, false if not.
5160   */
5161  vjs.Player.prototype.seeking = function(){ return this.techGet('seeking'); };
5162  
5163  // When the player is first initialized, trigger activity so components
5164  // like the control bar show themselves if needed
5165  vjs.Player.prototype.userActivity_ = true;
5166  vjs.Player.prototype.reportUserActivity = function(event){
5167    this.userActivity_ = true;
5168  };
5169  
5170  vjs.Player.prototype.userActive_ = true;
5171  vjs.Player.prototype.userActive = function(bool){
5172    if (bool !== undefined) {
5173      bool = !!bool;
5174      if (bool !== this.userActive_) {
5175        this.userActive_ = bool;
5176        if (bool) {
5177          // If the user was inactive and is now active we want to reset the
5178          // inactivity timer
5179          this.userActivity_ = true;
5180          this.removeClass('vjs-user-inactive');
5181          this.addClass('vjs-user-active');
5182          this.trigger('useractive');
5183        } else {
5184          // We're switching the state to inactive manually, so erase any other
5185          // activity
5186          this.userActivity_ = false;
5187  
5188          // Chrome/Safari/IE have bugs where when you change the cursor it can
5189          // trigger a mousemove event. This causes an issue when you're hiding
5190          // the cursor when the user is inactive, and a mousemove signals user
5191          // activity. Making it impossible to go into inactive mode. Specifically
5192          // this happens in fullscreen when we really need to hide the cursor.
5193          //
5194          // When this gets resolved in ALL browsers it can be removed
5195          // https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=103041
5196          if(this.tech) {
5197            this.tech.one('mousemove', function(e){
5198              e.stopPropagation();
5199              e.preventDefault();
5200            });
5201          }
5202  
5203          this.removeClass('vjs-user-active');
5204          this.addClass('vjs-user-inactive');
5205          this.trigger('userinactive');
5206        }
5207      }
5208      return this;
5209    }
5210    return this.userActive_;
5211  };
5212  
5213  vjs.Player.prototype.listenForUserActivity = function(){
5214    var onActivity, onMouseMove, onMouseDown, mouseInProgress, onMouseUp,
5215        activityCheck, inactivityTimeout, lastMoveX, lastMoveY;
5216  
5217    onActivity = vjs.bind(this, this.reportUserActivity);
5218  
5219    onMouseMove = function(e) {
5220      // #1068 - Prevent mousemove spamming
5221      // Chrome Bug: https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=366970
5222      if(e.screenX != lastMoveX || e.screenY != lastMoveY) {
5223        lastMoveX = e.screenX;
5224        lastMoveY = e.screenY;
5225        onActivity();
5226      }
5227    };
5228  
5229    onMouseDown = function() {
5230      onActivity();
5231      // For as long as the they are touching the device or have their mouse down,
5232      // we consider them active even if they're not moving their finger or mouse.
5233      // So we want to continue to update that they are active
5234      this.clearInterval(mouseInProgress);
5235      // Setting userActivity=true now and setting the interval to the same time
5236      // as the activityCheck interval (250) should ensure we never miss the
5237      // next activityCheck
5238      mouseInProgress = this.setInterval(onActivity, 250);
5239    };
5240  
5241    onMouseUp = function(event) {
5242      onActivity();
5243      // Stop the interval that maintains activity if the mouse/touch is down
5244      this.clearInterval(mouseInProgress);
5245    };
5246  
5247    // Any mouse movement will be considered user activity
5248    this.on('mousedown', onMouseDown);
5249    this.on('mousemove', onMouseMove);
5250    this.on('mouseup', onMouseUp);
5251  
5252    // Listen for keyboard navigation
5253    // Shouldn't need to use inProgress interval because of key repeat
5254    this.on('keydown', onActivity);
5255    this.on('keyup', onActivity);
5256  
5257    // Run an interval every 250 milliseconds instead of stuffing everything into
5258    // the mousemove/touchmove function itself, to prevent performance degradation.
5259    // `this.reportUserActivity` simply sets this.userActivity_ to true, which
5260    // then gets picked up by this loop
5261    // http://ejohn.org/blog/learning-from-twitter/
5262    activityCheck = this.setInterval(function() {
5263      // Check to see if mouse/touch activity has happened
5264      if (this.userActivity_) {
5265        // Reset the activity tracker
5266        this.userActivity_ = false;
5267  
5268        // If the user state was inactive, set the state to active
5269        this.userActive(true);
5270  
5271        // Clear any existing inactivity timeout to start the timer over
5272        this.clearTimeout(inactivityTimeout);
5273  
5274        var timeout = this.options()['inactivityTimeout'];
5275        if (timeout > 0) {
5276            // In <timeout> milliseconds, if no more activity has occurred the
5277            // user will be considered inactive
5278            inactivityTimeout = this.setTimeout(function () {
5279                // Protect against the case where the inactivityTimeout can trigger just
5280                // before the next user activity is picked up by the activityCheck loop
5281                // causing a flicker
5282                if (!this.userActivity_) {
5283                    this.userActive(false);
5284                }
5285            }, timeout);
5286        }
5287      }
5288    }, 250);
5289  };
5290  
5291  /**
5292   * Gets or sets the current playback rate.
5293   * @param  {Boolean} rate   New playback rate to set.
5294   * @return {Number}         Returns the new playback rate when setting
5295   * @return {Number}         Returns the current playback rate when getting
5296   */
5297  vjs.Player.prototype.playbackRate = function(rate) {
5298    if (rate !== undefined) {
5299      this.techCall('setPlaybackRate', rate);
5300      return this;
5301    }
5302  
5303    if (this.tech && this.tech['featuresPlaybackRate']) {
5304      return this.techGet('playbackRate');
5305    } else {
5306      return 1.0;
5307    }
5308  
5309  };
5310  
5311  /**
5312   * Store the current audio state
5313   * @type {Boolean}
5314   * @private
5315   */
5316  vjs.Player.prototype.isAudio_ = false;
5317  
5318  /**
5319   * Gets or sets the audio flag
5320   *
5321   * @param  {Boolean} bool    True signals that this is an audio player.
5322   * @return {Boolean}         Returns true if player is audio, false if not when getting
5323   * @return {vjs.Player}      Returns the player if setting
5324   * @private
5325   */
5326  vjs.Player.prototype.isAudio = function(bool) {
5327    if (bool !== undefined) {
5328      this.isAudio_ = !!bool;
5329      return this;
5330    }
5331  
5332    return this.isAudio_;
5333  };
5334  
5335  /**
5336   * Returns the current state of network activity for the element, from
5337   * the codes in the list below.
5338   * - NETWORK_EMPTY (numeric value 0)
5339   *   The element has not yet been initialised. All attributes are in
5340   *   their initial states.
5341   * - NETWORK_IDLE (numeric value 1)
5342   *   The element's resource selection algorithm is active and has
5343   *   selected a resource, but it is not actually using the network at
5344   *   this time.
5345   * - NETWORK_LOADING (numeric value 2)
5346   *   The user agent is actively trying to download data.
5347   * - NETWORK_NO_SOURCE (numeric value 3)
5348   *   The element's resource selection algorithm is active, but it has
5349   *   not yet found a resource to use.
5350   * @return {Number} the current network activity state
5351   * @see https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/embedded-content.html#network-states
5352   */
5353  vjs.Player.prototype.networkState = function(){
5354    return this.techGet('networkState');
5355  };
5356  
5357  /**
5358   * Returns a value that expresses the current state of the element
5359   * with respect to rendering the current playback position, from the
5360   * codes in the list below.
5361   * - HAVE_NOTHING (numeric value 0)
5362   *   No information regarding the media resource is available.
5363   * - HAVE_METADATA (numeric value 1)
5364   *   Enough of the resource has been obtained that the duration of the
5365   *   resource is available.
5366   * - HAVE_CURRENT_DATA (numeric value 2)
5367   *   Data for the immediate current playback position is available.
5368   * - HAVE_FUTURE_DATA (numeric value 3)
5369   *   Data for the immediate current playback position is available, as
5370   *   well as enough data for the user agent to advance the current
5371   *   playback position in the direction of playback.
5372   * - HAVE_ENOUGH_DATA (numeric value 4)
5373   *   The user agent estimates that enough data is available for
5374   *   playback to proceed uninterrupted.
5375   * @return {Number} the current playback rendering state
5376   * @see https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/embedded-content.html#dom-media-readystate
5377   */
5378  vjs.Player.prototype.readyState = function(){
5379    return this.techGet('readyState');
5380  };
5381  
5382  /**
5383   * Text tracks are tracks of timed text events.
5384   * Captions - text displayed over the video for the hearing impaired
5385   * Subtitles - text displayed over the video for those who don't understand language in the video
5386   * Chapters - text displayed in a menu allowing the user to jump to particular points (chapters) in the video
5387   * Descriptions (not supported yet) - audio descriptions that are read back to the user by a screen reading device
5388   */
5389  
5390  /**
5391   * Get an array of associated text tracks. captions, subtitles, chapters, descriptions
5392   * http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/master/embedded-content-0.html#dom-media-texttracks
5393   * @return {Array}           Array of track objects
5394   */
5395  vjs.Player.prototype.textTracks = function(){
5396    // cannot use techGet directly because it checks to see whether the tech is ready.
5397    // Flash is unlikely to be ready in time but textTracks should still work.
5398    return this.tech && this.tech['textTracks']();
5399  };
5400  
5401  vjs.Player.prototype.remoteTextTracks = function() {
5402    return this.tech && this.tech['remoteTextTracks']();
5403  };
5404  
5405  /**
5406   * Add a text track
5407   * In addition to the W3C settings we allow adding additional info through options.
5408   * http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/master/embedded-content-0.html#dom-media-addtexttrack
5409   * @param {String}  kind        Captions, subtitles, chapters, descriptions, or metadata
5410   * @param {String=} label       Optional label
5411   * @param {String=} language    Optional language
5412   */
5413  vjs.Player.prototype.addTextTrack = function(kind, label, language) {
5414    return this.tech && this.tech['addTextTrack'](kind, label, language);
5415  };
5416  
5417  vjs.Player.prototype.addRemoteTextTrack = function(options) {
5418    return this.tech && this.tech['addRemoteTextTrack'](options);
5419  };
5420  
5421  vjs.Player.prototype.removeRemoteTextTrack = function(track) {
5422    this.tech && this.tech['removeRemoteTextTrack'](track);
5423  };
5424  
5425  // Methods to add support for
5426  // initialTime: function(){ return this.techCall('initialTime'); },
5427  // startOffsetTime: function(){ return this.techCall('startOffsetTime'); },
5428  // played: function(){ return this.techCall('played'); },
5429  // seekable: function(){ return this.techCall('seekable'); },
5430  // videoTracks: function(){ return this.techCall('videoTracks'); },
5431  // audioTracks: function(){ return this.techCall('audioTracks'); },
5432  // videoWidth: function(){ return this.techCall('videoWidth'); },
5433  // videoHeight: function(){ return this.techCall('videoHeight'); },
5434  // defaultPlaybackRate: function(){ return this.techCall('defaultPlaybackRate'); },
5435  // mediaGroup: function(){ return this.techCall('mediaGroup'); },
5436  // controller: function(){ return this.techCall('controller'); },
5437  // defaultMuted: function(){ return this.techCall('defaultMuted'); }
5438  
5439  // TODO
5440  // currentSrcList: the array of sources including other formats and bitrates
5441  // playList: array of source lists in order of playback
5442  /**
5443   * Container of main controls
5444   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5445   * @param {Object=} options
5446   * @class
5447   * @constructor
5448   * @extends vjs.Component
5449   */
5450  vjs.ControlBar = vjs.Component.extend();
5451  
5452  vjs.ControlBar.prototype.options_ = {
5453    loadEvent: 'play',
5454    children: {
5455      'playToggle': {},
5456      'currentTimeDisplay': {},
5457      'timeDivider': {},
5458      'durationDisplay': {},
5459      'remainingTimeDisplay': {},
5460      'liveDisplay': {},
5461      'progressControl': {},
5462      'fullscreenToggle': {},
5463      'volumeControl': {},
5464      'muteToggle': {},
5465      // 'volumeMenuButton': {},
5466      'playbackRateMenuButton': {},
5467      'subtitlesButton': {},
5468      'captionsButton': {},
5469      'chaptersButton': {}
5470    }
5471  };
5472  
5473  vjs.ControlBar.prototype.createEl = function(){
5474    return vjs.createEl('div', {
5475      className: 'vjs-control-bar'
5476    });
5477  };
5478  /**
5479   * Displays the live indicator
5480   * TODO - Future make it click to snap to live
5481   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5482   * @param {Object=} options
5483   * @constructor
5484   */
5485  vjs.LiveDisplay = vjs.Component.extend({
5486    init: function(player, options){
5487      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options);
5488    }
5489  });
5490  
5491  vjs.LiveDisplay.prototype.createEl = function(){
5492    var el = vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
5493      className: 'vjs-live-controls vjs-control'
5494    });
5495  
5496    this.contentEl_ = vjs.createEl('div', {
5497      className: 'vjs-live-display',
5498      innerHTML: '<span class="vjs-control-text">' + this.localize('Stream Type') + '</span>' + this.localize('LIVE'),
5499      'aria-live': 'off'
5500    });
5501  
5502    el.appendChild(this.contentEl_);
5503  
5504    return el;
5505  };
5506  /**
5507   * Button to toggle between play and pause
5508   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5509   * @param {Object=} options
5510   * @class
5511   * @constructor
5512   */
5513  vjs.PlayToggle = vjs.Button.extend({
5514    /** @constructor */
5515    init: function(player, options){
5516      vjs.Button.call(this, player, options);
5517  
5518      this.on(player, 'play', this.onPlay);
5519      this.on(player, 'pause', this.onPause);
5520    }
5521  });
5522  
5523  vjs.PlayToggle.prototype.buttonText = 'Play';
5524  
5525  vjs.PlayToggle.prototype.buildCSSClass = function(){
5526    return 'vjs-play-control ' + vjs.Button.prototype.buildCSSClass.call(this);
5527  };
5528  
5529  // OnClick - Toggle between play and pause
5530  vjs.PlayToggle.prototype.onClick = function(){
5531    if (this.player_.paused()) {
5532      this.player_.play();
5533    } else {
5534      this.player_.pause();
5535    }
5536  };
5537  
5538    // OnPlay - Add the vjs-playing class to the element so it can change appearance
5539  vjs.PlayToggle.prototype.onPlay = function(){
5540    this.removeClass('vjs-paused');
5541    this.addClass('vjs-playing');
5542    this.el_.children[0].children[0].innerHTML = this.localize('Pause'); // change the button text to "Pause"
5543  };
5544  
5545    // OnPause - Add the vjs-paused class to the element so it can change appearance
5546  vjs.PlayToggle.prototype.onPause = function(){
5547    this.removeClass('vjs-playing');
5548    this.addClass('vjs-paused');
5549    this.el_.children[0].children[0].innerHTML = this.localize('Play'); // change the button text to "Play"
5550  };
5551  /**
5552   * Displays the current time
5553   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5554   * @param {Object=} options
5555   * @constructor
5556   */
5557  vjs.CurrentTimeDisplay = vjs.Component.extend({
5558    /** @constructor */
5559    init: function(player, options){
5560      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options);
5561  
5562      this.on(player, 'timeupdate', this.updateContent);
5563    }
5564  });
5565  
5566  vjs.CurrentTimeDisplay.prototype.createEl = function(){
5567    var el = vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
5568      className: 'vjs-current-time vjs-time-controls vjs-control'
5569    });
5570  
5571    this.contentEl_ = vjs.createEl('div', {
5572      className: 'vjs-current-time-display',
5573      innerHTML: '<span class="vjs-control-text">Current Time </span>' + '0:00', // label the current time for screen reader users
5574      'aria-live': 'off' // tell screen readers not to automatically read the time as it changes
5575    });
5576  
5577    el.appendChild(this.contentEl_);
5578    return el;
5579  };
5580  
5581  vjs.CurrentTimeDisplay.prototype.updateContent = function(){
5582    // Allows for smooth scrubbing, when player can't keep up.
5583    var time = (this.player_.scrubbing) ? this.player_.getCache().currentTime : this.player_.currentTime();
5584    this.contentEl_.innerHTML = '<span class="vjs-control-text">' + this.localize('Current Time') + '</span> ' + vjs.formatTime(time, this.player_.duration());
5585  };
5586  
5587  /**
5588   * Displays the duration
5589   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5590   * @param {Object=} options
5591   * @constructor
5592   */
5593  vjs.DurationDisplay = vjs.Component.extend({
5594    /** @constructor */
5595    init: function(player, options){
5596      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options);
5597  
5598      // this might need to be changed to 'durationchange' instead of 'timeupdate' eventually,
5599      // however the durationchange event fires before this.player_.duration() is set,
5600      // so the value cannot be written out using this method.
5601      // Once the order of durationchange and this.player_.duration() being set is figured out,
5602      // this can be updated.
5603      this.on(player, 'timeupdate', this.updateContent);
5604    }
5605  });
5606  
5607  vjs.DurationDisplay.prototype.createEl = function(){
5608    var el = vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
5609      className: 'vjs-duration vjs-time-controls vjs-control'
5610    });
5611  
5612    this.contentEl_ = vjs.createEl('div', {
5613      className: 'vjs-duration-display',
5614      innerHTML: '<span class="vjs-control-text">' + this.localize('Duration Time') + '</span> ' + '0:00', // label the duration time for screen reader users
5615      'aria-live': 'off' // tell screen readers not to automatically read the time as it changes
5616    });
5617  
5618    el.appendChild(this.contentEl_);
5619    return el;
5620  };
5621  
5622  vjs.DurationDisplay.prototype.updateContent = function(){
5623    var duration = this.player_.duration();
5624    if (duration) {
5625        this.contentEl_.innerHTML = '<span class="vjs-control-text">' + this.localize('Duration Time') + '</span> ' + vjs.formatTime(duration); // label the duration time for screen reader users
5626    }
5627  };
5628  
5629  /**
5630   * The separator between the current time and duration
5631   *
5632   * Can be hidden if it's not needed in the design.
5633   *
5634   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5635   * @param {Object=} options
5636   * @constructor
5637   */
5638  vjs.TimeDivider = vjs.Component.extend({
5639    /** @constructor */
5640    init: function(player, options){
5641      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options);
5642    }
5643  });
5644  
5645  vjs.TimeDivider.prototype.createEl = function(){
5646    return vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
5647      className: 'vjs-time-divider',
5648      innerHTML: '<div><span>/</span></div>'
5649    });
5650  };
5651  
5652  /**
5653   * Displays the time left in the video
5654   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5655   * @param {Object=} options
5656   * @constructor
5657   */
5658  vjs.RemainingTimeDisplay = vjs.Component.extend({
5659    /** @constructor */
5660    init: function(player, options){
5661      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options);
5662  
5663      this.on(player, 'timeupdate', this.updateContent);
5664    }
5665  });
5666  
5667  vjs.RemainingTimeDisplay.prototype.createEl = function(){
5668    var el = vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
5669      className: 'vjs-remaining-time vjs-time-controls vjs-control'
5670    });
5671  
5672    this.contentEl_ = vjs.createEl('div', {
5673      className: 'vjs-remaining-time-display',
5674      innerHTML: '<span class="vjs-control-text">' + this.localize('Remaining Time') + '</span> ' + '-0:00', // label the remaining time for screen reader users
5675      'aria-live': 'off' // tell screen readers not to automatically read the time as it changes
5676    });
5677  
5678    el.appendChild(this.contentEl_);
5679    return el;
5680  };
5681  
5682  vjs.RemainingTimeDisplay.prototype.updateContent = function(){
5683    if (this.player_.duration()) {
5684      this.contentEl_.innerHTML = '<span class="vjs-control-text">' + this.localize('Remaining Time') + '</span> ' + '-'+ vjs.formatTime(this.player_.remainingTime());
5685    }
5686  
5687    // Allows for smooth scrubbing, when player can't keep up.
5688    // var time = (this.player_.scrubbing) ? this.player_.getCache().currentTime : this.player_.currentTime();
5689    // this.contentEl_.innerHTML = vjs.formatTime(time, this.player_.duration());
5690  };
5691  /**
5692   * Toggle fullscreen video
5693   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5694   * @param {Object=} options
5695   * @class
5696   * @extends vjs.Button
5697   */
5698  vjs.FullscreenToggle = vjs.Button.extend({
5699    /**
5700     * @constructor
5701     * @memberof vjs.FullscreenToggle
5702     * @instance
5703     */
5704    init: function(player, options){
5705      vjs.Button.call(this, player, options);
5706    }
5707  });
5708  
5709  vjs.FullscreenToggle.prototype.buttonText = 'Fullscreen';
5710  
5711  vjs.FullscreenToggle.prototype.buildCSSClass = function(){
5712    return 'vjs-fullscreen-control ' + vjs.Button.prototype.buildCSSClass.call(this);
5713  };
5714  
5715  vjs.FullscreenToggle.prototype.onClick = function(){
5716    if (!this.player_.isFullscreen()) {
5717      this.player_.requestFullscreen();
5718      this.controlText_.innerHTML = this.localize('Non-Fullscreen');
5719    } else {
5720      this.player_.exitFullscreen();
5721      this.controlText_.innerHTML = this.localize('Fullscreen');
5722    }
5723  };
5724  /**
5725   * The Progress Control component contains the seek bar, load progress,
5726   * and play progress
5727   *
5728   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5729   * @param {Object=} options
5730   * @constructor
5731   */
5732  vjs.ProgressControl = vjs.Component.extend({
5733    /** @constructor */
5734    init: function(player, options){
5735      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options);
5736    }
5737  });
5738  
5739  vjs.ProgressControl.prototype.options_ = {
5740    children: {
5741      'seekBar': {}
5742    }
5743  };
5744  
5745  vjs.ProgressControl.prototype.createEl = function(){
5746    return vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
5747      className: 'vjs-progress-control vjs-control'
5748    });
5749  };
5750  
5751  /**
5752   * Seek Bar and holder for the progress bars
5753   *
5754   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5755   * @param {Object=} options
5756   * @constructor
5757   */
5758  vjs.SeekBar = vjs.Slider.extend({
5759    /** @constructor */
5760    init: function(player, options){
5761      vjs.Slider.call(this, player, options);
5762      this.on(player, 'timeupdate', this.updateARIAAttributes);
5763      player.ready(vjs.bind(this, this.updateARIAAttributes));
5764    }
5765  });
5766  
5767  vjs.SeekBar.prototype.options_ = {
5768    children: {
5769      'loadProgressBar': {},
5770      'playProgressBar': {},
5771      'seekHandle': {}
5772    },
5773    'barName': 'playProgressBar',
5774    'handleName': 'seekHandle'
5775  };
5776  
5777  vjs.SeekBar.prototype.playerEvent = 'timeupdate';
5778  
5779  vjs.SeekBar.prototype.createEl = function(){
5780    return vjs.Slider.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
5781      className: 'vjs-progress-holder',
5782      'aria-label': 'video progress bar'
5783    });
5784  };
5785  
5786  vjs.SeekBar.prototype.updateARIAAttributes = function(){
5787      // Allows for smooth scrubbing, when player can't keep up.
5788      var time = (this.player_.scrubbing) ? this.player_.getCache().currentTime : this.player_.currentTime();
5789      this.el_.setAttribute('aria-valuenow',vjs.round(this.getPercent()*100, 2)); // machine readable value of progress bar (percentage complete)
5790      this.el_.setAttribute('aria-valuetext',vjs.formatTime(time, this.player_.duration())); // human readable value of progress bar (time complete)
5791  };
5792  
5793  vjs.SeekBar.prototype.getPercent = function(){
5794    return this.player_.currentTime() / this.player_.duration();
5795  };
5796  
5797  vjs.SeekBar.prototype.onMouseDown = function(event){
5798    vjs.Slider.prototype.onMouseDown.call(this, event);
5799  
5800    this.player_.scrubbing = true;
5801    this.player_.addClass('vjs-scrubbing');
5802  
5803    this.videoWasPlaying = !this.player_.paused();
5804    this.player_.pause();
5805  };
5806  
5807  vjs.SeekBar.prototype.onMouseMove = function(event){
5808    var newTime = this.calculateDistance(event) * this.player_.duration();
5809  
5810    // Don't let video end while scrubbing.
5811    if (newTime == this.player_.duration()) { newTime = newTime - 0.1; }
5812  
5813    // Set new time (tell player to seek to new time)
5814    this.player_.currentTime(newTime);
5815  };
5816  
5817  vjs.SeekBar.prototype.onMouseUp = function(event){
5818    vjs.Slider.prototype.onMouseUp.call(this, event);
5819  
5820    this.player_.scrubbing = false;
5821    this.player_.removeClass('vjs-scrubbing');
5822    if (this.videoWasPlaying) {
5823      this.player_.play();
5824    }
5825  };
5826  
5827  vjs.SeekBar.prototype.stepForward = function(){
5828    this.player_.currentTime(this.player_.currentTime() + 5); // more quickly fast forward for keyboard-only users
5829  };
5830  
5831  vjs.SeekBar.prototype.stepBack = function(){
5832    this.player_.currentTime(this.player_.currentTime() - 5); // more quickly rewind for keyboard-only users
5833  };
5834  
5835  /**
5836   * Shows load progress
5837   *
5838   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5839   * @param {Object=} options
5840   * @constructor
5841   */
5842  vjs.LoadProgressBar = vjs.Component.extend({
5843    /** @constructor */
5844    init: function(player, options){
5845      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options);
5846      this.on(player, 'progress', this.update);
5847    }
5848  });
5849  
5850  vjs.LoadProgressBar.prototype.createEl = function(){
5851    return vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
5852      className: 'vjs-load-progress',
5853      innerHTML: '<span class="vjs-control-text"><span>' + this.localize('Loaded') + '</span>: 0%</span>'
5854    });
5855  };
5856  
5857  vjs.LoadProgressBar.prototype.update = function(){
5858    var i, start, end, part,
5859        buffered = this.player_.buffered(),
5860        duration = this.player_.duration(),
5861        bufferedEnd = this.player_.bufferedEnd(),
5862        children = this.el_.children,
5863        // get the percent width of a time compared to the total end
5864        percentify = function (time, end){
5865          var percent = (time / end) || 0; // no NaN
5866          return (percent * 100) + '%';
5867        };
5868  
5869    // update the width of the progress bar
5870    this.el_.style.width = percentify(bufferedEnd, duration);
5871  
5872    // add child elements to represent the individual buffered time ranges
5873    for (i = 0; i < buffered.length; i++) {
5874      start = buffered.start(i),
5875      end = buffered.end(i),
5876      part = children[i];
5877  
5878      if (!part) {
5879        part = this.el_.appendChild(vjs.createEl());
5880      }
5881  
5882      // set the percent based on the width of the progress bar (bufferedEnd)
5883      part.style.left = percentify(start, bufferedEnd);
5884      part.style.width = percentify(end - start, bufferedEnd);
5885    }
5886  
5887    // remove unused buffered range elements
5888    for (i = children.length; i > buffered.length; i--) {
5889      this.el_.removeChild(children[i-1]);
5890    }
5891  };
5892  
5893  /**
5894   * Shows play progress
5895   *
5896   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5897   * @param {Object=} options
5898   * @constructor
5899   */
5900  vjs.PlayProgressBar = vjs.Component.extend({
5901    /** @constructor */
5902    init: function(player, options){
5903      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options);
5904    }
5905  });
5906  
5907  vjs.PlayProgressBar.prototype.createEl = function(){
5908    return vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
5909      className: 'vjs-play-progress',
5910      innerHTML: '<span class="vjs-control-text"><span>' + this.localize('Progress') + '</span>: 0%</span>'
5911    });
5912  };
5913  
5914  /**
5915   * The Seek Handle shows the current position of the playhead during playback,
5916   * and can be dragged to adjust the playhead.
5917   *
5918   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5919   * @param {Object=} options
5920   * @constructor
5921   */
5922  vjs.SeekHandle = vjs.SliderHandle.extend({
5923    init: function(player, options) {
5924      vjs.SliderHandle.call(this, player, options);
5925      this.on(player, 'timeupdate', this.updateContent);
5926    }
5927  });
5928  
5929  /**
5930   * The default value for the handle content, which may be read by screen readers
5931   *
5932   * @type {String}
5933   * @private
5934   */
5935  vjs.SeekHandle.prototype.defaultValue = '00:00';
5936  
5937  /** @inheritDoc */
5938  vjs.SeekHandle.prototype.createEl = function() {
5939    return vjs.SliderHandle.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
5940      className: 'vjs-seek-handle',
5941      'aria-live': 'off'
5942    });
5943  };
5944  
5945  vjs.SeekHandle.prototype.updateContent = function() {
5946    var time = (this.player_.scrubbing) ? this.player_.getCache().currentTime : this.player_.currentTime();
5947    this.el_.innerHTML = '<span class="vjs-control-text">' + vjs.formatTime(time, this.player_.duration()) + '</span>';
5948  };
5949  /**
5950   * The component for controlling the volume level
5951   *
5952   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5953   * @param {Object=} options
5954   * @constructor
5955   */
5956  vjs.VolumeControl = vjs.Component.extend({
5957    /** @constructor */
5958    init: function(player, options){
5959      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options);
5960  
5961      // hide volume controls when they're not supported by the current tech
5962      if (player.tech && player.tech['featuresVolumeControl'] === false) {
5963        this.addClass('vjs-hidden');
5964      }
5965      this.on(player, 'loadstart', function(){
5966        if (player.tech['featuresVolumeControl'] === false) {
5967          this.addClass('vjs-hidden');
5968        } else {
5969          this.removeClass('vjs-hidden');
5970        }
5971      });
5972    }
5973  });
5974  
5975  vjs.VolumeControl.prototype.options_ = {
5976    children: {
5977      'volumeBar': {}
5978    }
5979  };
5980  
5981  vjs.VolumeControl.prototype.createEl = function(){
5982    return vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
5983      className: 'vjs-volume-control vjs-control'
5984    });
5985  };
5986  
5987  /**
5988   * The bar that contains the volume level and can be clicked on to adjust the level
5989   *
5990   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
5991   * @param {Object=} options
5992   * @constructor
5993   */
5994  vjs.VolumeBar = vjs.Slider.extend({
5995    /** @constructor */
5996    init: function(player, options){
5997      vjs.Slider.call(this, player, options);
5998      this.on(player, 'volumechange', this.updateARIAAttributes);
5999      player.ready(vjs.bind(this, this.updateARIAAttributes));
6000    }
6001  });
6002  
6003  vjs.VolumeBar.prototype.updateARIAAttributes = function(){
6004    // Current value of volume bar as a percentage
6005    this.el_.setAttribute('aria-valuenow',vjs.round(this.player_.volume()*100, 2));
6006    this.el_.setAttribute('aria-valuetext',vjs.round(this.player_.volume()*100, 2)+'%');
6007  };
6008  
6009  vjs.VolumeBar.prototype.options_ = {
6010    children: {
6011      'volumeLevel': {},
6012      'volumeHandle': {}
6013    },
6014    'barName': 'volumeLevel',
6015    'handleName': 'volumeHandle'
6016  };
6017  
6018  vjs.VolumeBar.prototype.playerEvent = 'volumechange';
6019  
6020  vjs.VolumeBar.prototype.createEl = function(){
6021    return vjs.Slider.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
6022      className: 'vjs-volume-bar',
6023      'aria-label': 'volume level'
6024    });
6025  };
6026  
6027  vjs.VolumeBar.prototype.onMouseMove = function(event) {
6028    if (this.player_.muted()) {
6029      this.player_.muted(false);
6030    }
6031  
6032    this.player_.volume(this.calculateDistance(event));
6033  };
6034  
6035  vjs.VolumeBar.prototype.getPercent = function(){
6036    if (this.player_.muted()) {
6037      return 0;
6038    } else {
6039      return this.player_.volume();
6040    }
6041  };
6042  
6043  vjs.VolumeBar.prototype.stepForward = function(){
6044    this.player_.volume(this.player_.volume() + 0.1);
6045  };
6046  
6047  vjs.VolumeBar.prototype.stepBack = function(){
6048    this.player_.volume(this.player_.volume() - 0.1);
6049  };
6050  
6051  /**
6052   * Shows volume level
6053   *
6054   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
6055   * @param {Object=} options
6056   * @constructor
6057   */
6058  vjs.VolumeLevel = vjs.Component.extend({
6059    /** @constructor */
6060    init: function(player, options){
6061      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options);
6062    }
6063  });
6064  
6065  vjs.VolumeLevel.prototype.createEl = function(){
6066    return vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
6067      className: 'vjs-volume-level',
6068      innerHTML: '<span class="vjs-control-text"></span>'
6069    });
6070  };
6071  
6072  /**
6073   * The volume handle can be dragged to adjust the volume level
6074   *
6075   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
6076   * @param {Object=} options
6077   * @constructor
6078   */
6079   vjs.VolumeHandle = vjs.SliderHandle.extend();
6080  
6081   vjs.VolumeHandle.prototype.defaultValue = '00:00';
6082  
6083   /** @inheritDoc */
6084   vjs.VolumeHandle.prototype.createEl = function(){
6085     return vjs.SliderHandle.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
6086       className: 'vjs-volume-handle'
6087     });
6088   };
6089  /**
6090   * A button component for muting the audio
6091   *
6092   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
6093   * @param {Object=} options
6094   * @constructor
6095   */
6096  vjs.MuteToggle = vjs.Button.extend({
6097    /** @constructor */
6098    init: function(player, options){
6099      vjs.Button.call(this, player, options);
6100  
6101      this.on(player, 'volumechange', this.update);
6102  
6103      // hide mute toggle if the current tech doesn't support volume control
6104      if (player.tech && player.tech['featuresVolumeControl'] === false) {
6105        this.addClass('vjs-hidden');
6106      }
6107  
6108      this.on(player, 'loadstart', function(){
6109        if (player.tech['featuresVolumeControl'] === false) {
6110          this.addClass('vjs-hidden');
6111        } else {
6112          this.removeClass('vjs-hidden');
6113        }
6114      });
6115    }
6116  });
6117  
6118  vjs.MuteToggle.prototype.createEl = function(){
6119    return vjs.Button.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
6120      className: 'vjs-mute-control vjs-control',
6121      innerHTML: '<div><span class="vjs-control-text">' + this.localize('Mute') + '</span></div>'
6122    });
6123  };
6124  
6125  vjs.MuteToggle.prototype.onClick = function(){
6126    this.player_.muted( this.player_.muted() ? false : true );
6127  };
6128  
6129  vjs.MuteToggle.prototype.update = function(){
6130    var vol = this.player_.volume(),
6131        level = 3;
6132  
6133    if (vol === 0 || this.player_.muted()) {
6134      level = 0;
6135    } else if (vol < 0.33) {
6136      level = 1;
6137    } else if (vol < 0.67) {
6138      level = 2;
6139    }
6140  
6141    // Don't rewrite the button text if the actual text doesn't change.
6142    // This causes unnecessary and confusing information for screen reader users.
6143    // This check is needed because this function gets called every time the volume level is changed.
6144    if(this.player_.muted()){
6145        if(this.el_.children[0].children[0].innerHTML!=this.localize('Unmute')){
6146            this.el_.children[0].children[0].innerHTML = this.localize('Unmute'); // change the button text to "Unmute"
6147        }
6148    } else {
6149        if(this.el_.children[0].children[0].innerHTML!=this.localize('Mute')){
6150            this.el_.children[0].children[0].innerHTML = this.localize('Mute'); // change the button text to "Mute"
6151        }
6152    }
6153  
6154    /* TODO improve muted icon classes */
6155    for (var i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
6156      vjs.removeClass(this.el_, 'vjs-vol-'+i);
6157    }
6158    vjs.addClass(this.el_, 'vjs-vol-'+level);
6159  };
6160  /**
6161   * Menu button with a popup for showing the volume slider.
6162   * @constructor
6163   */
6164  vjs.VolumeMenuButton = vjs.MenuButton.extend({
6165    /** @constructor */
6166    init: function(player, options){
6167      vjs.MenuButton.call(this, player, options);
6168  
6169      // Same listeners as MuteToggle
6170      this.on(player, 'volumechange', this.volumeUpdate);
6171  
6172      // hide mute toggle if the current tech doesn't support volume control
6173      if (player.tech && player.tech['featuresVolumeControl'] === false) {
6174        this.addClass('vjs-hidden');
6175      }
6176      this.on(player, 'loadstart', function(){
6177        if (player.tech['featuresVolumeControl'] === false) {
6178          this.addClass('vjs-hidden');
6179        } else {
6180          this.removeClass('vjs-hidden');
6181        }
6182      });
6183      this.addClass('vjs-menu-button');
6184    }
6185  });
6186  
6187  vjs.VolumeMenuButton.prototype.createMenu = function(){
6188    var menu = new vjs.Menu(this.player_, {
6189      contentElType: 'div'
6190    });
6191    var vc = new vjs.VolumeBar(this.player_, this.options_['volumeBar']);
6192    vc.on('focus', function() {
6193      menu.lockShowing();
6194    });
6195    vc.on('blur', function() {
6196      menu.unlockShowing();
6197    });
6198    menu.addChild(vc);
6199    return menu;
6200  };
6201  
6202  vjs.VolumeMenuButton.prototype.onClick = function(){
6203    vjs.MuteToggle.prototype.onClick.call(this);
6204    vjs.MenuButton.prototype.onClick.call(this);
6205  };
6206  
6207  vjs.VolumeMenuButton.prototype.createEl = function(){
6208    return vjs.Button.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
6209      className: 'vjs-volume-menu-button vjs-menu-button vjs-control',
6210      innerHTML: '<div><span class="vjs-control-text">' + this.localize('Mute') + '</span></div>'
6211    });
6212  };
6213  vjs.VolumeMenuButton.prototype.volumeUpdate = vjs.MuteToggle.prototype.update;
6214  /**
6215   * The component for controlling the playback rate
6216   *
6217   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
6218   * @param {Object=} options
6219   * @constructor
6220   */
6221  vjs.PlaybackRateMenuButton = vjs.MenuButton.extend({
6222    /** @constructor */
6223    init: function(player, options){
6224      vjs.MenuButton.call(this, player, options);
6225  
6226      this.updateVisibility();
6227      this.updateLabel();
6228  
6229      this.on(player, 'loadstart', this.updateVisibility);
6230      this.on(player, 'ratechange', this.updateLabel);
6231    }
6232  });
6233  
6234  vjs.PlaybackRateMenuButton.prototype.buttonText = 'Playback Rate';
6235  vjs.PlaybackRateMenuButton.prototype.className = 'vjs-playback-rate';
6236  
6237  vjs.PlaybackRateMenuButton.prototype.createEl = function(){
6238    var el = vjs.MenuButton.prototype.createEl.call(this);
6239  
6240    this.labelEl_ = vjs.createEl('div', {
6241      className: 'vjs-playback-rate-value',
6242      innerHTML: 1.0
6243    });
6244  
6245    el.appendChild(this.labelEl_);
6246  
6247    return el;
6248  };
6249  
6250  // Menu creation
6251  vjs.PlaybackRateMenuButton.prototype.createMenu = function(){
6252    var menu = new vjs.Menu(this.player());
6253    var rates = this.player().options()['playbackRates'];
6254  
6255    if (rates) {
6256      for (var i = rates.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
6257        menu.addChild(
6258          new vjs.PlaybackRateMenuItem(this.player(), { 'rate': rates[i] + 'x'})
6259          );
6260      }
6261    }
6262  
6263    return menu;
6264  };
6265  
6266  vjs.PlaybackRateMenuButton.prototype.updateARIAAttributes = function(){
6267    // Current playback rate
6268    this.el().setAttribute('aria-valuenow', this.player().playbackRate());
6269  };
6270  
6271  vjs.PlaybackRateMenuButton.prototype.onClick = function(){
6272    // select next rate option
6273    var currentRate = this.player().playbackRate();
6274    var rates = this.player().options()['playbackRates'];
6275    // this will select first one if the last one currently selected
6276    var newRate = rates[0];
6277    for (var i = 0; i <rates.length ; i++) {
6278      if (rates[i] > currentRate) {
6279        newRate = rates[i];
6280        break;
6281      }
6282    }
6283    this.player().playbackRate(newRate);
6284  };
6285  
6286  vjs.PlaybackRateMenuButton.prototype.playbackRateSupported = function(){
6287    return this.player().tech
6288      && this.player().tech['featuresPlaybackRate']
6289      && this.player().options()['playbackRates']
6290      && this.player().options()['playbackRates'].length > 0
6291    ;
6292  };
6293  
6294  /**
6295   * Hide playback rate controls when they're no playback rate options to select
6296   */
6297  vjs.PlaybackRateMenuButton.prototype.updateVisibility = function(){
6298    if (this.playbackRateSupported()) {
6299      this.removeClass('vjs-hidden');
6300    } else {
6301      this.addClass('vjs-hidden');
6302    }
6303  };
6304  
6305  /**
6306   * Update button label when rate changed
6307   */
6308  vjs.PlaybackRateMenuButton.prototype.updateLabel = function(){
6309    if (this.playbackRateSupported()) {
6310      this.labelEl_.innerHTML = this.player().playbackRate() + 'x';
6311    }
6312  };
6313  
6314  /**
6315   * The specific menu post type for selecting a playback rate
6316   *
6317   * @constructor
6318   */
6319  vjs.PlaybackRateMenuItem = vjs.MenuItem.extend({
6320    contentElType: 'button',
6321    /** @constructor */
6322    init: function(player, options){
6323      var label = this.label = options['rate'];
6324      var rate = this.rate = parseFloat(label, 10);
6325  
6326      // Modify options for parent MenuItem class's init.
6327      options['label'] = label;
6328      options['selected'] = rate === 1;
6329      vjs.MenuItem.call(this, player, options);
6330  
6331      this.on(player, 'ratechange', this.update);
6332    }
6333  });
6334  
6335  vjs.PlaybackRateMenuItem.prototype.onClick = function(){
6336    vjs.MenuItem.prototype.onClick.call(this);
6337    this.player().playbackRate(this.rate);
6338  };
6339  
6340  vjs.PlaybackRateMenuItem.prototype.update = function(){
6341    this.selected(this.player().playbackRate() == this.rate);
6342  };
6343  /* Poster Image
6344  ================================================================================ */
6345  /**
6346   * The component that handles showing the poster image.
6347   *
6348   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
6349   * @param {Object=} options
6350   * @constructor
6351   */
6352  vjs.PosterImage = vjs.Button.extend({
6353    /** @constructor */
6354    init: function(player, options){
6355      vjs.Button.call(this, player, options);
6356  
6357      this.update();
6358      player.on('posterchange', vjs.bind(this, this.update));
6359    }
6360  });
6361  
6362  /**
6363   * Clean up the poster image
6364   */
6365  vjs.PosterImage.prototype.dispose = function(){
6366    this.player().off('posterchange', this.update);
6367    vjs.Button.prototype.dispose.call(this);
6368  };
6369  
6370  /**
6371   * Create the poster image element
6372   * @return {Element}
6373   */
6374  vjs.PosterImage.prototype.createEl = function(){
6375    var el = vjs.createEl('div', {
6376      className: 'vjs-poster',
6377  
6378      // Don't want poster to be tabbable.
6379      tabIndex: -1
6380    });
6381  
6382    // To ensure the poster image resizes while maintaining its original aspect
6383    // ratio, use a div with `background-size` when available. For browsers that
6384    // do not support `background-size` (e.g. IE8), fall back on using a regular
6385    // img element.
6386    if (!vjs.BACKGROUND_SIZE_SUPPORTED) {
6387      this.fallbackImg_ = vjs.createEl('img');
6388      el.appendChild(this.fallbackImg_);
6389    }
6390  
6391    return el;
6392  };
6393  
6394  /**
6395   * Event handler for updates to the player's poster source
6396   */
6397  vjs.PosterImage.prototype.update = function(){
6398    var url = this.player().poster();
6399  
6400    this.setSrc(url);
6401  
6402    // If there's no poster source we should display:none on this component
6403    // so it's not still clickable or right-clickable
6404    if (url) {
6405      this.show();
6406    } else {
6407      this.hide();
6408    }
6409  };
6410  
6411  /**
6412   * Set the poster source depending on the display method
6413   */
6414  vjs.PosterImage.prototype.setSrc = function(url){
6415    var backgroundImage;
6416  
6417    if (this.fallbackImg_) {
6418      this.fallbackImg_.src = url;
6419    } else {
6420      backgroundImage = '';
6421      // Any falsey values should stay as an empty string, otherwise
6422      // this will throw an extra error
6423      if (url) {
6424        backgroundImage = 'url("' + url + '")';
6425      }
6426  
6427      this.el_.style.backgroundImage = backgroundImage;
6428    }
6429  };
6430  
6431  /**
6432   * Event handler for clicks on the poster image
6433   */
6434  vjs.PosterImage.prototype.onClick = function(){
6435    // We don't want a click to trigger playback when controls are disabled
6436    // but CSS should be hiding the poster to prevent that from happening
6437    this.player_.play();
6438  };
6439  /* Loading Spinner
6440  ================================================================================ */
6441  /**
6442   * Loading spinner for waiting events
6443   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
6444   * @param {Object=} options
6445   * @class
6446   * @constructor
6447   */
6448  vjs.LoadingSpinner = vjs.Component.extend({
6449    /** @constructor */
6450    init: function(player, options){
6451      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options);
6452  
6453      // MOVING DISPLAY HANDLING TO CSS
6454  
6455      // player.on('canplay', vjs.bind(this, this.hide));
6456      // player.on('canplaythrough', vjs.bind(this, this.hide));
6457      // player.on('playing', vjs.bind(this, this.hide));
6458      // player.on('seeking', vjs.bind(this, this.show));
6459  
6460      // in some browsers seeking does not trigger the 'playing' event,
6461      // so we also need to trap 'seeked' if we are going to set a
6462      // 'seeking' event
6463      // player.on('seeked', vjs.bind(this, this.hide));
6464  
6465      // player.on('ended', vjs.bind(this, this.hide));
6466  
6467      // Not showing spinner on stalled any more. Browsers may stall and then not trigger any events that would remove the spinner.
6468      // Checked in Chrome 16 and Safari 5.1.2. http://help.videojs.com/discussions/problems/883-why-is-the-download-progress-showing
6469      // player.on('stalled', vjs.bind(this, this.show));
6470  
6471      // player.on('waiting', vjs.bind(this, this.show));
6472    }
6473  });
6474  
6475  vjs.LoadingSpinner.prototype.createEl = function(){
6476    return vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
6477      className: 'vjs-loading-spinner'
6478    });
6479  };
6480  /* Big Play Button
6481  ================================================================================ */
6482  /**
6483   * Initial play button. Shows before the video has played. The hiding of the
6484   * big play button is done via CSS and player states.
6485   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
6486   * @param {Object=} options
6487   * @class
6488   * @constructor
6489   */
6490  vjs.BigPlayButton = vjs.Button.extend();
6491  
6492  vjs.BigPlayButton.prototype.createEl = function(){
6493    return vjs.Button.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
6494      className: 'vjs-big-play-button',
6495      innerHTML: '<span aria-hidden="true"></span>',
6496      'aria-label': 'play video'
6497    });
6498  };
6499  
6500  vjs.BigPlayButton.prototype.onClick = function(){
6501    this.player_.play();
6502  };
6503  /**
6504   * Display that an error has occurred making the video unplayable
6505   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player
6506   * @param {Object=} options
6507   * @constructor
6508   */
6509  vjs.ErrorDisplay = vjs.Component.extend({
6510    init: function(player, options){
6511      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options);
6512  
6513      this.update();
6514      this.on(player, 'error', this.update);
6515    }
6516  });
6517  
6518  vjs.ErrorDisplay.prototype.createEl = function(){
6519    var el = vjs.Component.prototype.createEl.call(this, 'div', {
6520      className: 'vjs-error-display'
6521    });
6522  
6523    this.contentEl_ = vjs.createEl('div');
6524    el.appendChild(this.contentEl_);
6525  
6526    return el;
6527  };
6528  
6529  vjs.ErrorDisplay.prototype.update = function(){
6530    if (this.player().error()) {
6531      this.contentEl_.innerHTML = this.localize(this.player().error().message);
6532    }
6533  };
6534  (function() {
6535    var createTrackHelper;
6536  /**
6537   * @fileoverview Media Technology Controller - Base class for media playback
6538   * technology controllers like Flash and HTML5
6539   */
6540  
6541  /**
6542   * Base class for media (HTML5 Video, Flash) controllers
6543   * @param {vjs.Player|Object} player  Central player instance
6544   * @param {Object=} options Options object
6545   * @constructor
6546   */
6547  vjs.MediaTechController = vjs.Component.extend({
6548    /** @constructor */
6549    init: function(player, options, ready){
6550      options = options || {};
6551      // we don't want the tech to report user activity automatically.
6552      // This is done manually in addControlsListeners
6553      options.reportTouchActivity = false;
6554      vjs.Component.call(this, player, options, ready);
6555  
6556      // Manually track progress in cases where the browser/flash player doesn't report it.
6557      if (!this['featuresProgressEvents']) {
6558        this.manualProgressOn();
6559      }
6560  
6561      // Manually track timeupdates in cases where the browser/flash player doesn't report it.
6562      if (!this['featuresTimeupdateEvents']) {
6563        this.manualTimeUpdatesOn();
6564      }
6565  
6566      this.initControlsListeners();
6567  
6568      if (!this['featuresNativeTextTracks']) {
6569        this.emulateTextTracks();
6570      }
6571  
6572      this.initTextTrackListeners();
6573    }
6574  });
6575  
6576  /**
6577   * Set up click and touch listeners for the playback element
6578   * On desktops, a click on the video itself will toggle playback,
6579   * on a mobile device a click on the video toggles controls.
6580   * (toggling controls is done by toggling the user state between active and
6581   * inactive)
6582   *
6583   * A tap can signal that a user has become active, or has become inactive
6584   * e.g. a quick tap on an iPhone movie should reveal the controls. Another
6585   * quick tap should hide them again (signaling the user is in an inactive
6586   * viewing state)
6587   *
6588   * In addition to this, we still want the user to be considered inactive after
6589   * a few seconds of inactivity.
6590   *
6591   * Note: the only part of iOS interaction we can't mimic with this setup
6592   * is a touch and hold on the video element counting as activity in order to
6593   * keep the controls showing, but that shouldn't be an issue. A touch and hold on
6594   * any controls will still keep the user active
6595   */
6596  vjs.MediaTechController.prototype.initControlsListeners = function(){
6597    var player, activateControls;
6598  
6599    player = this.player();
6600  
6601    activateControls = function(){
6602      if (player.controls() && !player.usingNativeControls()) {
6603        this.addControlsListeners();
6604      }
6605    };
6606  
6607    // Set up event listeners once the tech is ready and has an element to apply
6608    // listeners to
6609    this.ready(activateControls);
6610    this.on(player, 'controlsenabled', activateControls);
6611    this.on(player, 'controlsdisabled', this.removeControlsListeners);
6612  
6613    // if we're loading the playback object after it has started loading or playing the
6614    // video (often with autoplay on) then the loadstart event has already fired and we
6615    // need to fire it manually because many things rely on it.
6616    // Long term we might consider how we would do this for other events like 'canplay'
6617    // that may also have fired.
6618    this.ready(function(){
6619      if (this.networkState && this.networkState() > 0) {
6620        this.player().trigger('loadstart');
6621      }
6622    });
6623  };
6624  
6625  vjs.MediaTechController.prototype.addControlsListeners = function(){
6626    var userWasActive;
6627  
6628    // Some browsers (Chrome & IE) don't trigger a click on a flash swf, but do
6629    // trigger mousedown/up.
6630    // http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1444562/javascript-onclick-event-over-flash-object
6631    // Any touch events are set to block the mousedown event from happening
6632    this.on('mousedown', this.onClick);
6633  
6634    // If the controls were hidden we don't want that to change without a tap event
6635    // so we'll check if the controls were already showing before reporting user
6636    // activity
6637    this.on('touchstart', function(event) {
6638      userWasActive = this.player_.userActive();
6639    });
6640  
6641    this.on('touchmove', function(event) {
6642      if (userWasActive){
6643        this.player().reportUserActivity();
6644      }
6645    });
6646  
6647    this.on('touchend', function(event) {
6648      // Stop the mouse events from also happening
6649      event.preventDefault();
6650    });
6651  
6652    // Turn on component tap events
6653    this.emitTapEvents();
6654  
6655    // The tap listener needs to come after the touchend listener because the tap
6656    // listener cancels out any reportedUserActivity when setting userActive(false)
6657    this.on('tap', this.onTap);
6658  };
6659  
6660  /**
6661   * Remove the listeners used for click and tap controls. This is needed for
6662   * toggling to controls disabled, where a tap/touch should do nothing.
6663   */
6664  vjs.MediaTechController.prototype.removeControlsListeners = function(){
6665    // We don't want to just use `this.off()` because there might be other needed
6666    // listeners added by techs that extend this.
6667    this.off('tap');
6668    this.off('touchstart');
6669    this.off('touchmove');
6670    this.off('touchleave');
6671    this.off('touchcancel');
6672    this.off('touchend');
6673    this.off('click');
6674    this.off('mousedown');
6675  };
6676  
6677  /**
6678   * Handle a click on the media element. By default will play/pause the media.
6679   */
6680  vjs.MediaTechController.prototype.onClick = function(event){
6681    // We're using mousedown to detect clicks thanks to Flash, but mousedown
6682    // will also be triggered with right-clicks, so we need to prevent that
6683    if (event.button !== 0) return;
6684  
6685    // When controls are disabled a click should not toggle playback because
6686    // the click is considered a control
6687    if (this.player().controls()) {
6688      if (this.player().paused()) {
6689        this.player().play();
6690      } else {
6691        this.player().pause();
6692      }
6693    }
6694  };
6695  
6696  /**
6697   * Handle a tap on the media element. By default it will toggle the user
6698   * activity state, which hides and shows the controls.
6699   */
6700  vjs.MediaTechController.prototype.onTap = function(){
6701    this.player().userActive(!this.player().userActive());
6702  };
6703  
6704  /* Fallbacks for unsupported event types
6705  ================================================================================ */
6706  // Manually trigger progress events based on changes to the buffered amount
6707  // Many flash players and older HTML5 browsers don't send progress or progress-like events
6708  vjs.MediaTechController.prototype.manualProgressOn = function(){
6709    this.manualProgress = true;
6710  
6711    // Trigger progress watching when a source begins loading
6712    this.trackProgress();
6713  };
6714  
6715  vjs.MediaTechController.prototype.manualProgressOff = function(){
6716    this.manualProgress = false;
6717    this.stopTrackingProgress();
6718  };
6719  
6720  vjs.MediaTechController.prototype.trackProgress = function(){
6721    this.progressInterval = this.setInterval(function(){
6722      // Don't trigger unless buffered amount is greater than last time
6723  
6724      var bufferedPercent = this.player().bufferedPercent();
6725  
6726      if (this.bufferedPercent_ != bufferedPercent) {
6727        this.player().trigger('progress');
6728      }
6729  
6730      this.bufferedPercent_ = bufferedPercent;
6731  
6732      if (bufferedPercent === 1) {
6733        this.stopTrackingProgress();
6734      }
6735    }, 500);
6736  };
6737  vjs.MediaTechController.prototype.stopTrackingProgress = function(){ this.clearInterval(this.progressInterval); };
6738  
6739  /*! Time Tracking -------------------------------------------------------------- */
6740  vjs.MediaTechController.prototype.manualTimeUpdatesOn = function(){
6741    var player = this.player_;
6742  
6743    this.manualTimeUpdates = true;
6744  
6745    this.on(player, 'play', this.trackCurrentTime);
6746    this.on(player, 'pause', this.stopTrackingCurrentTime);
6747    // timeupdate is also called by .currentTime whenever current time is set
6748  
6749    // Watch for native timeupdate event
6750    this.one('timeupdate', function(){
6751      // Update known progress support for this playback technology
6752      this['featuresTimeupdateEvents'] = true;
6753      // Turn off manual progress tracking
